sourceString: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020
targetString: Insiden kumulatif penyakit koronavirus (COVID-19) yang meningkat cepat di Uni Eropa/Wilayah Ekonomi Eropa dan Inggris Raya, 1 Januari hingga 15 Maret 2020
en-mt: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the UK, 1 January to 15 March 2020

sourceString: The cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, while at a different stage depending on the country, the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in all countries.
targetString: Insiden kumulatif kasus penyakit koronavirus (COVID-19) menunjukkan tren serupa di negara Uni Eropa/Wilayah Ekonomi Eropa dan Inggris Raya yang mengonfirmasi bahwa, meskipun tahapnya berbeda-beda tergantung negara, pandemi COVID-19 berkembang sangat cepat di semua negara.
en-mt: The cumulative incidence of cases of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) shows similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, although the stages vary by country, the COVID-19 pandemic is developing very fast in all countries.

sourceString: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for a surge of patients with COVID-19 who will require healthcare, and in particular intensive care.
targetString: Berdasarkan pengalaman Italia, negara, rumah sakit, dan unit perawatan intensif hendaknya meningkatkan kesiapannya untuk lonjakan pasien COVID-19 yang akan memerlukan perawatan kesehatan, khususnya perawatan intensif.
en-mt: Based on Italy's experience, the country, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their readiness for a surge in COVID-19 patients who will require health care, especially intensive care.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown aetiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Pada 31 Desember 2019, klaster kasus pneumonia dengan etiologi tidak dikenal dilaporkan di Wuhan, Provinsi Hubei, Tiongkok.
en-mt: On December 31, 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown etiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the causative agent as being a novel coronavirus now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Pada 9 Januari 2020, Pusat Pengendalian dan Pencegahan Penyakit Tiongkok melaporkan agen kausatif penyakit ini adalah koronavirus baru yang sekarang disebut koronavirus sindrom pernapasan akut berat 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: On January 9, 2020, the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported that the causative agent of this disease was a new coronavirus, now called severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Since, the illness resulting from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: Sejak saat itu, penyakit yang diakibatkan oleh infeksi SARS-CoV-2 disebut penyakit koronavirus (COVID-19).
en-mt: Since then, the disease caused by infection with SARS-CoV-2 has been called coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

sourceString: Evidence to date is that ca 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have a mild disease, i.e. a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these recover.
targetString: Bukti hingga saat ini menunjukkan bahwa sekitar 80% penderita COVID-19 mengalami penyakit ringan, yakni infeksi saluran napas dengan atau tanpa pneumonia, dengan sebagian besar penderita ini sembuh.
en-mt: Evidence to date suggests that around 80% of people with COVID-19 experience mild illness, namely respiratory infections with or without pneumonia, with most of these sufferers recovering.

sourceString: In ca 14% cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalisation while the remaining 6% cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.
targetString: Pada sekitar 14% kasus, COVID-19 berkembang menjadi penyakit yang lebih berat dan memerlukan perawatan rumah sakit, sementara 6% kasus lainnya mengalami penyakit kritis yang memerlukan perawatan intensif.
en-mt: In around 14% of cases, COVID-19 develops into a more serious illness and requires hospital treatment, while another 6% of cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.

sourceString: The mortality of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is ca 4%.
targetString: Mortalitas pasien yang dirawat di rumah sakit akibat COVID-19 sekitar 4%.
en-mt: The mortality of patients hospitalized from COVID-19 is around 4%.

sourceString: In this study, we assess the trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to that of Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Dalam studi ini, kami mengkaji tren insiden kumulatif COVID-19 negara Uni Eropa/Wilayah Ekonomi Eropa (EU/EEA) dan Inggris Raya (UK) lalu membandingkannya dengan insiden di Provinsi Hubei, Tiongkok.
en-mt: In this study, we examine cumulative incidence trends of COVID-19 in European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) and United Kingdom (UK) countries and compare them with incidents in Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.
targetString: Kami juga membandingkan jumlah kasus COVID-19 saat ini di negara EU/EEA dan UK dengan jumlah kasus di Italia selama 31 Januari–15 Maret 2020.
en-mt: We also compared the number of current cases of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and UK countries with the number of cases in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Kasus COVID-19 di negara EU/EEA dan UK
en-mt: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA and UK countries

sourceString: Subsequent to China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical spread and the dynamic of the COVID-19 pandemic in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.
targetString: Setelah Tiongkok, COVID-19 mengalami penyebaran geografis lebih jauh dan dinamika pandemi COVID-19 di belahan dunia lainnya saat ini mengikuti dinamika pandemi di Tiongkok.
en-mt: After China, COVID-19 experienced further geographic spread and the dynamics of the COVID-19 pandemic in other parts of the world are currently following the dynamics of the pandemic in China.

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.
targetString: Pada 11 Maret 2020, Direktur Jendral Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia (WHO) menyatakan COVID-19 sebagai pandemi.
en-mt: On March 11, 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.

sourceString: In the 5 March issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases according to the WHO case definition.
targetString: Di Eurosurveillance 2020 terbitan 5 Maret, Spiteri et al. melaporkan orang Eropa pertama dengan kasus COVID-19 terkonfirmasi berdasarkan definisi kasus WHO.
en-mt: In the March 5 issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reports the first European person with a confirmed case of COVID-19 based on the WHO case definition.

sourceString: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in persons returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Di EU/EEA, tiga kasus terkonfirmasi pertama dilaporkan oleh Prancis pada 24 Januari 2020 pada orang-orang yang kembali dari Wuhan, Provinsi Hubei, Tiongkok.
en-mt: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in people returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: As at 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), whereby between 31 December 2019 and that date included, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.
targetString: Pada 15 Maret 2020, kasus COVID-19 telah dideteksi di seluruh 30 negara EU/EEA dan Ingris Raya (UK), antara tanggal 31 Desember 2019 dan 15 Maret 2020 dengan tanggal tersebut termasuk, ada 39.768 kasus dan 1.727 kematian dilaporkan, dengan 17.750 kasus dan 1.441 kematian dari Italia saja.
en-mt: As of 15 March 2020, cases of COVID-19 were detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), between 31 December 2019 and 15 March 2020 with these dates included, there were 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.

sourceString: Obtaining cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases
targetString: Mendapatkan angka kumulatif dan insiden kumulatif kasus COVID-19
en-mt: Get the cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases

sourceString: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the notified COVID-19 case counts in each country worldwide, obtained from only official sources such as the countries’ Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities and the WHO, are updated each day at 8:00 a.m.
targetString: Di Pusat Pencegahan dan Pengendalian Penyakit Eropa (ECDC), jumlah kasus COVID-19 yang diberitahukan setiap negara di seluruh dunia diperbarui setiap hari pada pukul 8.00. Jumlah ini diperoleh hanya dari sumber resmi seperti Kementrian Kesehatan negara tersebut, otoritas kesehatan nasional dan regional, dan WHO.
en-mt: At the European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the number of COVID-19 cases notified by each country around the world is updated daily at 8.00. This number is obtained only from official sources such as the country's Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities, and WHO.

sourceString: These data were used for assessing the trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and the UK, and comparing them to that in Italy.
targetString: Data ini digunakan untuk menilai tren COVID-19 di EU/EEA dan UK, serta membandingkannya dengan tren di Italia.
en-mt: This data is used to assess trends in COVID-19 in the EU/EEA and UK, and compare them with trends in Italy.

sourceString: As a proxy of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, during the 1 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Sebagai proksi prevalensi kasus COVID-19 aktif, kami menghitung insiden kumulatif terpenggal 14 hari, jadi memperhitungkan perjalanan alami COVID-19, di setiap negara EU/EEA dan UK, dalam periode 1 Januari–15 Maret 2020.
en-mt: As a proxy for the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated cumulative incidents separated by 14 days, thus accounting for the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA and UK country, in the period 1 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: We also presented the cumulative number of notified cases of each country as at 15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. compared with that of Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Kami juga menyajikan angka kumulatif kasus yang diberitahukan setiap negara hingga 15 Maret 2020 pukul 8.00 dibandingkan dengan kasus Italia selama periode 31 Januari–15Maret 2020.
en-mt: We also present the cumulative number of cases notified by each country up to 15 March 2020 at 8.00 am compared to the cases of Italy during the period 31 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: Trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Tren COVID-19 di negara EU/EEA dan UK
en-mt: COVID-19 trends in EU/EEA and UK countries

sourceString: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed that of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).
targetString: Tren insiden kumulatif terpenggal 14 hari kasus COVID-19 di negara EU/EEA dan UK umumnya mengikuti tren di Provinsi Hubei (Tiongkok) (Gambar 1).
en-mt: The trend of cumulative incidents separated by 14 days of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA and UK countries generally follows the trend in Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).

sourceString: For the EU/EEA and the UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).
targetString: Untuk EU/EEA dan UK secara keseluruhan, insiden kumulatif COVID-19 mulai meningkat sekitar 21 Februari, lalu meningkat tajam sekitar 28 Februari 2020 (Bahan tambahan).
en-mt: For the EU/EEA and the UK as a whole, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February, then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).

sourceString: This was mostly driven by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increasing trends of the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).
targetString: Tren ini terutama digerakkan oleh peningkatan cepat jumlah kasus yang dilaporkan dari Italia, tetapi semua negara EU/EEA yang lain dan UK menunjukkan tren peningkatan insiden kumulatif COVID-19 yang serupa (Bahan tambahan).
en-mt: This trend is primarily driven by the rapid increase in the number of cases reported from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK show a similar trend of increasing cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).

sourceString: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared with that in Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Gambar 2 menunjukkan jumlah kumulatif kasus COVID-19 di negara EU/EEA dan UK dibandingkan dengan jumlah kumulatif di Italia selama periode 31 Januari–15 Maret 2020.
en-mt: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA and UK countries compared to the cumulative number in Italy during the period 31 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: It highlights that, as at 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to that of Italy just 3 weeks prior or less.
targetString: Data tersebut menyoroti bahwa, hingga 15 Maret pukul 8.00, 15 negara EU/EEA lain dan UK telah melaporkan total jumlah kasus yang sebanding dengan total jumlah kasus Italia tiga minggu sebelumnya atau kurang dari itu.
en-mt: The data highlights that, as of March 15 at 8:00, 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK have reported total number of cases comparable to Italy's total number of cases three weeks earlier or less.

sourceString: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Hasil kami mengindikasikan bahwa jumlah kasus COVID-19 yang diberitahukan meningkat cepat di EU/EEA dan UK.
en-mt: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is increasing rapidly in the EU/EEA and UK.

sourceString: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is progressing at a comparable speed in all countries.
targetString: Tren yang teramati pada insiden kumulatif COVID-19 mengisyaratkan bahwa pandemi meningkat pada kecepatan yang sebanding di semua negara.
en-mt: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is increasing at a comparable pace in all countries.

sourceString: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients that must be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including catch-up testing.
targetString: Hal ini terlepas dari perbedaan tahap yang dialami negara-negara, variasi respons kesehatan masyarakat, dan kemungkinan perbedaan definisi kasus antara negara dan perbedaan protokol untuk memilih pasien yang harus diuji untuk konfirmasi COVID-19, yang mencakup pengujian susulan.
en-mt: This is despite the differences in the stages that countries experience, the variations in public health response, and possible differences in case definitions between countries and differences in protocols for selecting patients who should be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, which includes follow-up testing.

sourceString: Early March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation in which ca 10% of patients with COVID-19 required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had already reached their maximum capacity.
targetString: Pada awal Maret 2020, para dokter di wilayah Italia yang terdampak menjelaskan situasi sekitar 10% pasien COVID-19 memerlukan perawatan intensif dan sumber media melaporkan bahwa rumah sakit dan unit perawatan intensif di wilayah ini telah mencapai kapasitas maksimumnya.
en-mt: In early March 2020, doctors in the affected Italian regions described the situation as around 10% of COVID-19 patients requiring intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions have reached their maximum capacity.

sourceString: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases in a hospital and/or an intensive care unit are currently available at EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% cases, respectively (data not shown).
targetString: Saat ini, data penerimaan kasus COVID-19 di rumah sakit dan/atau unit perawatan intensif di tingkat EU/EAA hanya tersedia untuk masing-masing 6% dan 1% kasus (data tidak diperlihatkan).
en-mt: Currently, data on hospital and/or intensive care unit admissions of COVID-19 cases at the EU/EAA level are only available for 6% and 1% of cases respectively (data not shown).

sourceString: They should, however, be collected in a systematic fashion to complement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.
targetString: Namun, data harus dikumpulkan dalam cara yang sistematik untuk melengkapi data surveilans saat ini yang berfokus pada jumlah kasus yang dilaporkan dan angka kematian.
en-mt: However, data must be collected in a systematic way to complement the current surveillance data which focuses on the number of reported cases and mortality rates.

sourceString: A study performed in 2010–11 showed a large variation in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.
targetString: Studi yang dilakukan pada tahun 2010-2011 menunjukkan variasi besar dalam hal ketersediaan tempat tidur perawatan intensif dan perawatan madya di Eropa, berkisar mulai dari 29,2 di Jerman hingga 4,2 per 100.000 populasi di Portugal.
en-mt: Studies conducted in 2010–2011 show large variations in the availability of intensive care and secondary care beds within Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 per 100,000 population in Portugal.

sourceString: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).
targetString: Hal ini berarti bahwa negara-negara dapat memiliki sumber daya yang lebih banyak atau lebih sedikit dibandingkan Italia (12,5 tempat tidur perawatan intensif dan perawatan madya per 100.000 populasi pada tahun 2010-2011).
en-mt: This means that countries may have more or fewer resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and middle care beds per 100,000 population in 2010-2011).

sourceString: Modelling scenarios related to healthcare capacity saturation, with estimates for each EU/EEA country and the UK of the prevalence of hospitalised COVID-19 cases associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.
targetString: Skenario pemodelan terkait kejenuhan kapasitas perawatan kesehatan, dengan estimasi prevalensi kasus COVID-19 rawat inap untuk setiap negara EU/EEA dan UK yang berkaitan dengan risiko >90% melampaui kapasitas tempat tidur perawatan intensif, disediakan di pembaruan keenam penilaian risiko cepat ECDC tentang COVID-19.
en-mt: Modeling scenarios related to health care capacity saturation, with estimated prevalence of hospitalized COVID-19 cases for each EU/EEA and UK country associated with a >90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC's rapid risk assessment of COVID-19 19.

sourceString: Since cases have so far clustered in certain regions in EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve a defined regional catchment population, information about cases and intensive care beds should preferably be made available at the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.
targetString: Karena sejauh ini kasus terklaster di wilayah tertentu di negara EU/EEA dan UK, dan rumah sakit serta unit perawatan intensif biasanya melayani populasi cakupan pelayanan regional tertentu, informasi tentang kasus dan tempat tidur perawatan intensif sebaiknya disediakan pada tingkat Penamaan Unit Wilayah untuk Statistik 2 (NUTS-2).
en-mt: Since cases are clustered in certain regions of EU/EEA and UK countries, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve specific regional service coverage populations, information on cases and intensive care beds should be provided at the Regional Names Units for Statistics level 2 ( NUTS-2).

sourceString: The experience from Italy and the current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Pengalaman dari Italia dan tren saat ini di negara lain menunjukkan bahwa pandemi COVID-19 berkembang sangat cepat di EU/EEA dan UK.
en-mt: Experience from Italy and current trends in other countries shows that the COVID-19 pandemic is developing very fast in the EU/EEA and UK.

sourceString: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for a scenario of sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of patients with COVID-19 requiring healthcare, and in particular intensive care, such as the one occurring in the affected regions of Italy.
targetString: Karena itu, negara, rumah sakit, dan unit perawatan intensif hendaknya mempersiapkan diri untuk skenario transmisi komunitas SARS-CoV-2 dan peningkatkan jumlah pasien COVID-19 yang memerlukan perawatan kesehatan, khususnya perawatan intensif, seperti yang terjadi di wilayah terdampak di Italia.
en-mt: Therefore, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should prepare for scenarios of community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of COVID-19 patients requiring health care, especially intensive care, as happened in the affected areas in Italy.

sourceString: As pointed out in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the anticipated rapid increase in the number of cases may not provide decision makers and hospitals enough time to comprehend, accept and adapt their response accordingly if not implemented ahead of time.
targetString: Sebagaimana ditunjukkan dalam penilaian risiko cepat ECDC baru-baru ini, pendekatan yang cepat, proaktif, dan komprehensif sangat penting untuk memperlambat penyebaran SARS-CoV-2, dengan peralihan dari pendekatan pembendungan ke pendekatan mitigasi, sebab peningkatan jumlah kasus yang cepat, sebagaimana diantisipasi, mungkin tidak memberi cukup waktu kepada para pembuat keputusan dan rumah sakit untuk memahami, menerima, dan mengadaptasi respons yang tepat jika hal itu tidak diterapkan sebelumnya.
en-mt: As demonstrated in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is critical to slowing the spread of SARS-CoV-2, with the shift from a containment approach to a mitigation approach, due to the rapid increase in case numbers, as anticipated, may not give decision makers and the hospital enough time to understand, accept, and adapt an appropriate response if it is not implemented beforehand.

sourceString: The rapid risk assessment also lists the public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.
targetString: Penilaian risiko cepat tersebut juga mencantumkan langkah-langkah kesehatan masyarakat untuk memitigasi dampak pandemi.
en-mt: The rapid risk assessment also lists public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.

sourceString: There is a short window of opportunity during which countries have the possibility to further increase their control efforts to slow down the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and decrease the pressure on healthcare.
targetString: Tersedia jendela kesempatan yang pendek saat negara memiliki kemungkinan untuk lebih meningkatkan upaya pengendaliannya dalam memperlambat penyebaran SARS-CoV-2 dan mengurangi tekanan pada perawatan kesehatan.
en-mt: There is a short window of opportunity in which countries have the possibility to further enhance their control efforts to slow the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and reduce pressure on health care.

sourceString: Failing this, it is likely that the healthcare systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a surge of patients that require intensive care within the coming days or weeks.
targetString: Jika gagal, sistem perawatan kesehatan negara EU/EEA lain kemungkinan akan menghadapi lonjakan pasien yang memerlukan perawatan intensif dalam beberapa hari atau minggu ke depan.
en-mt: Failing that, healthcare systems in other EU/EEA countries are likely to face a surge in patients requiring intensive care in the coming days or weeks.

sourceString: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has thus far killed over 3,000 people and infected over 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in catastrophe for humans.
targetString: Wabah penyakit koronavirus 2019 (COVID-19), yang disebabkan oleh koronavirus sindrom pernapasan akut berat 2 (SARS-CoV-2), sejauh ini telah menewaskan lebih dari 3.000 orang dan menginfeksi lebih dari 80.000 orang di Tiongkok dan tempat lain di dunia, yang menyebabkan bencana bagi manusia.
en-mt: The outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has so far killed more than 3,000 people and infected more than 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, which cause disaster for humans.

sourceString: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 might also be transmitted from the bats and causes similar symptoms through a similar mechanism.
targetString: Mirip dengan virus homolognya, SARS-CoV, yang menyebabkan SARS pada ribuan orang pada tahun 2003, SARS-CoV-2 mungkin juga ditransmisikan dari kelelawar dan menyebabkan gejala yang mirip melalui mekanisme yang mirip.
en-mt: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 may also be transmitted from bats and cause similar symptoms via a similar mechanism.

sourceString: However, COVID-19 has lower severity and mortality than SARS but is much more transmissive and affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women.
targetString: Meski demikian, COVID-19 memiliki tingkat keparahan dan mortalitas yang lebih rendah dibandingkan SARS, tetapi lebih menular dan lebih banyak mengenai lansia daripada orang muda, serta lebih banyak pada pria daripada wanita.
en-mt: Nonetheless, COVID-19 has a lower severity and mortality rate than SARS, but is more contagious and affects older people more than young people, and more men than women.

sourceString: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on the emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of the swiftly developing research subject.
targetString: Sebagai respons terhadap jumlah publikasi yang meningkat cepat tentang penyakit yang baru muncul ini, artikel ini mencoba memberikan tinjauan tepat waktu dan komprehensif tentang subjek penelitian yang berkembang cepat.
en-mt: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on this emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive overview of this rapidly evolving research subject.

sourceString: We will cover the basics about the epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of the disease.
targetString: Kami akan membahas dasar-dasar epidemiologi, etiologi, virologi, diagnosis, perawatan, prognosis, dan pencegahan penyakit.
en-mt: We will cover the basics of epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of disease.

sourceString: Although many questions still require answers, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of the threatening disease.
targetString: Meski masih banyak pertanyaan yang belum terjawab, kami berharap tinjauan ini membantu pemahaman dan pemberantasan penyakit yang mengancam ini.
en-mt: While many questions remain unanswered, we hope that this review will aid the understanding and eradication of this threatening disease.

sourceString: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory to all Chinese who were urged to stay indoors for all the holiday and for many weeks after due to the outbreak of a novel viral disease.
targetString: Festival Musim Semi pada tanggal 25 Januari 2020 telah menjadi kenangan yang belum pernah terjadi dan tidak terlupakan bagi semua orang Tionghoa yang diperintahkan untuk tetap tinggal di rumah selama liburan dan beberapa minggu setelahnya karena wabah penyakit virus baru.
en-mt: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory for all Chinese people who were ordered to stay at home during the holiday and the following weeks due to the outbreak of a new viral disease.

sourceString: The virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; thus, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the associated disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
targetString: Virus ini sangat homolog dengan koronavirus (CoV) yang menyebabkan wabah sindrom pernapasan akut berat (SARS) pada tahun 2003; karena itu, virus ini diberi nama SARS-CoV-2 oleh Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia (WHO) pada 11 Februari 2020, dan penyakit yang disebabkannya disebut CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
en-mt: This virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused the severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) outbreak in 2003; Therefore, this virus was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the disease it causes is called CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread throughout the entire country and to near 50 others all over the world.
targetString: Epidemi berawal di Wuhan, Tiongkok, dan dengan cepat menyebar ke seluruh negeri dan ke hampir 50 negara lain di seluruh dunia.
en-mt: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread across the country and to nearly 50 other countries around the world.

sourceString: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in over 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and over 3,000 patients who died.
targetString: Hingga 2 Maret 2020, virus ini telah mengakibatkan 80.000 kasus COVID-19 terkonfirmasi, dengan lebih dari 40.000 pasien dipulangkan dan 3.000 pasien meninggal dunia.
en-mt: As of March 2 2020, this virus has resulted in 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients being discharged and 3,000 patients dying.

sourceString: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and potentially more powerful than terrorism.
targetString: WHO memperingatkan bahwa COVID-19 merupakan “musuh khalayak nomor 1” dan berpotensi merusak lebih kuat daripada terorisme.
en-mt: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and has the potential to do more damage than terrorism.

sourceString: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, over 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from multiple patients.
targetString: Menurut PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), dalam waktu kurang dari dua bulan sejak laporan pertama pada 7 Januari 2020 yang menetapkan sekuens virus yang diisolasi dari beberapa pasien, lebih dari 200 makalah telah diterbitkan tentang COVID-19, yang mencakup virologi, epidemiologi, etiologi, diagnosis, dan perawatannya.
en-mt: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months since the first report on 7 January 2020 establishing viral sequences isolated from several patients, more than 200 papers have been published about COVID-19, which includes its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment.

sourceString: This review attempts to summarize the research progress in the new and swiftly developing subject area.
targetString: Tinjauan ini berusaha merangkum kemajuan riset dalam bidang subjek baru yang berkembang cepat ini.
en-mt: This review attempts to summarize research progress in this new, fast-growing subject area.

sourceString: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-caused disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, an outbreak in 2012).
targetString: Sedapat mungkin, kami akan mencoba membandingkan COVID-19 dengan SARS dan penyakit yang disebabkan CoV lainnya, yakni sindrom pernapasan Timur Tengah (MERS, wabah pada tahun 2012).
en-mt: As much as possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another disease caused by CoV, namely Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, outbreak in 2012).

sourceString: We will also discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and prognosis of the disease as well as some remaining yet urgent questions.
targetString: Kami juga akan membahas hal yang telah dipelajari sejauh ini mengenai pencegahan dan prognosis penyakit serta beberapa pertanyaan lain yang belum terjawab, tetapi mendesak.
en-mt: We will also discuss what has been learned so far about disease prevention and prognosis and some other unanswered, but urgent questions.

sourceString: CoVs have been traditionally considered nonlethal pathogens to humans, mainly causing approximately 15% of common colds 4.
targetString: Berdasarkan tradisi, CoV dianggap patogen nonletal bagi manusia, terutama menyebabkan sekitar 15% pilek 4.
en-mt: Traditionally, CoV is considered a non-lethal pathogen for humans, primarily causing around 15% of colds 4.

sourceString: However, in this century, we have encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs twice, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused an outbreak originally in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with horrible morbidity and mortality.
targetString: Meski demikian, pada abad ini, kita telah menjumpai CoV yang sangat patogenik bagi manusia dua kali, yakni SARS-CoV dan MERS-CoV, masing-masing menyebabkan wabah yang berawal di Tiongkok pada tahun 2003 dan Arab Saudi pada tahun 2012, dan segera menyebar ke banyak negara lain dengan morbiditas dan mortalitas yang mengerikan.
en-mt: However, in this century, we have encountered CoV that is highly pathogenic to humans twice, namely SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively causing outbreaks that started in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, and quickly spread to many other countries with appalling morbidity and mortality.

sourceString: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.
targetString: Karena itu, COVID-19 saat ini adalah wabah CoV ketiga dalam sejarah manusia yang tercatat.
en-mt: Because of this, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in recorded human history.

sourceString: As shown in Fig. ​Fig.1,1, clusters of pneumonia that had unknown origins were first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.
targetString: Seperti diperlihatkan di Gbr. 1.1, klaster pneumonia dengan asal tidak diketahui pertama kali dilaporkan dari Wuhan pada 31 Desember 2019 kepada Komisi Kesehatan Nasional Republik Rakyat Tiongkok.
en-mt: As shown in Fig. 1.1, cluster pneumonia of unknown origin was first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the National Health Commission of the People's Republic of China.

sourceString: Seven days later the sequence of the CoV was released.
targetString: Tujuh hari kemudian, sekuens CoV diluncurkan.
en-mt: Seven days later, CoV sequences were launched.

sourceString: On January 15, 2020 the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.
targetString: Pada 15 Januari 2020, kasus fatal pertama dari Wuhan dilaporkan.
en-mt: On 15 January 2020, the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.

sourceString: Meanwhile, the epidemic rapidly spread to the neighboring cities, provinces, and countries.
targetString: Sementara itu, epidemi menyebar cepat ke kota, provinsi, dan negara tetangga.
en-mt: Meanwhile, the epidemic spread rapidly to neighboring cities, provinces and countries.

sourceString: On January 20, the infection of health-care providers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was possible.
targetString: Pada 20 Januari, infeksi penyedia perawatan kesehatan dilaporkan, yang mengisyaratkan bahwa transmisi manusia-ke-manusia mungkin terjadi.
en-mt: On January 20, a health care provider infection was reported, which hinted that human-to-human transmission was possible.

sourceString: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with all its public transportation stopped.
targetString: Pada 23 Januari, karantina wilayah diberlakukan di kota Wuhan dan seluruh angkutan umum dihentikan.
en-mt: On January 23, a lockdown was imposed on the city of Wuhan and all public transportation was stopped.

sourceString: On January 24 the first clinical study on the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered the starting site of the infection from an unknown animal source.
targetString: Pada 24 Januari, studi klinis pertama tentang penyakit ini melaporkan bahwa, dari 41 pasien dengan kasus terkonfirmasi, hanya 21 pasien yang berkontak langsung dengan pasar makanan laut Wuhan yang dianggap sebagai lokasi awal infeksi dari sumber hewan yang tidak diketahui.
en-mt: On January 24, the first clinical study of the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market which is thought to be the initial site of infection from an unknown animal source.

sourceString: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
targetString: Pada 30 Januari, WHO menyatakan wabah ini sebagai darurat kesehatan global.
en-mt: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.

sourceString: By the time of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and near 50 other countries all over the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).
targetString: Pada waktu laporan ini ditulis, penyakit ini sudah menyebar ke seluruh Tiongkok dan hampir 50 negara lain di seluruh dunia (Gbr. 2).2).
en-mt: At the time this report was written, the disease had spread throughout China and nearly 50 other countries around the world (Fig. 2).2).

sourceString: As the situation is rapidly evolving, the final scope and severity of the outbreak remain to be determined.
targetString: Karena situasi berkembang dengan sangat cepat, cakupan akhir dan keparahan wabah masih harus ditetapkan.
en-mt: Because the situation is developing at such a rapid pace, the final scope and severity of the outbreak has yet to be established.

sourceString: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study on 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients presented a more updated illustration of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
targetString: Pada 11 Februari 2020, studi multipusat pada 8.866 pasien, yang mencakup 4.021 pasien COVID-19 terkonfirmasi, menyajikan gambaran epidemi yang lebih diperbarui berikut (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
en-mt: On 11 February 2020, a multi-center study of 8,866 patients, which included 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients, presented the following more updated picture of the epidemic (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly at the age of 30-65.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 menginfeksi orang pada segala usia, tetapi terutama pada usia 30-65.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infects people of all ages, but especially those aged 30-65.

sourceString: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected individuals were over 50 years old, very few were under 20, and only 14 infected individuals were under the age of 10.
targetString: Hampir separuh (47,7%) dari orang-orang yang terinfeksi berusia lebih dari 50 tahun, hanya sedikit yang berusia di bawah 20 tahun, dan hanya 14 orang terinfeksi yang berusia di bawah usia 10 tahun.
en-mt: Nearly half (47.7%) of those infected were over 50 years old, only a few were under 20 years old, and only 14 infected people were under 10 years old.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 lebih banyak menginfeksi pria (0,31/100.000) dibandingkan wanita (0,27/100.000).
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infects more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).

sourceString: COVID-19 expanded in clusters mainly in and around Hubei.
targetString: COVID-19 meluas dalam klaster, terutama di dalam dan sekitar Hubei.
en-mt: COVID-19 is spreading in clusters, especially in and around Hubei.

sourceString: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.
targetString: COVID-19 memakan waktu rata-rata 5 (2-9) hari mulai dari awitan hingga diagnosis.
en-mt: COVID-19 takes an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.

sourceString: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.
targetString: Periode inkubasi rata-rata adalah 4,8 (3,0-7,2) hari.
en-mt: The average incubation period is 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.

sourceString: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.
targetString: Waktu rata-rata mulai dari awitan hingga kematian adalah 9,5 (4,8-13) hari.
en-mt: The median time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.

sourceString: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.
targetString: Angka reproduksi dasar (R0) adalah 3,77 (95% CI: 3,51-4,05) dan R0 tersuai 2,23-4,82.
en-mt: The basic reproduction number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05) and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.

sourceString: The number of infected people increased exponentially before 23 Jan. 2020, matching the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.
targetString: Jumlah orang yang terinfeksi meningkat secara eksponensial sebelum 23 Jan. 2020, sesuai dengan waktu transportasi masif sebelum Festival Musim Semi di Tiongkok.
en-mt: The number of infected people increased exponentially before Jan 23. 2020, according to the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.

sourceString: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality of all the patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
targetString: Mortalitas pasien dengan kasus terkonfirmasi sebesar 1,44% (95% CI: 1,10-1,86%) dan mortalitas tersuai untuk semua pasien sebesar 3,06% (95% CI: 2,02-4,59%).
en-mt: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%) and the adjusted mortality for all patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).

sourceString: Three major risk factors for COVID-19 were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.
targetString: Tiga faktor risiko utama untuk COVID-19 adalah jenis kelamin (pria), usia (≥60 tahun), dan pneumonia berat.
en-mt: The three main risk factors for COVID-19 are gender (male), age (≥60 years), and severe pneumonia.

sourceString: CoVs are a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses containing a single strand of sense RNA.
targetString: CoV adalah subfamili virus besar bersampul yang mengandung untai tunggal RNA sense.
en-mt: CoV is a subfamily of large-enveloped viruses containing single-stranded sense RNA.

sourceString: They can be divided into four genera, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.
targetString: CoV dapat dibagi menjadi empat genus, yakni alfa, beta, gamma, dan delta, dengan alfa- dan beta-CoV diketahui menginfeksi manusia.
en-mt: CoV can be divided into four genera, namely alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, with alpha- and beta-CoV known to infect humans.

sourceString: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane fusion occurs.
targetString: Glikoprotein tonjolan atau spike (S) sampul berikatan dengan reseptor selnya, enzim penukar angiotensin 2 (ACE 2) dan dipeptidil peptidase 4 (DPP4) masing-masing untuk SARS-CoV dan MERS-CoV, lalu fusi membran terjadi.
en-mt: The spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cell receptors, angiotensin exchange enzyme 2 (ACE 2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and membrane fusion occurs.

sourceString: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins forms virion-containing vesicles, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.
targetString: Genom RNA virus dilepaskan ke dalam sitoplasma; setelah replikasi genom virus, RNA genomik disertai glikoprotein sampul dan protein nukleokapsid membentuk vesikel berisi virion, yang kemudian mengalami fusi dengan membran plasma untuk melepaskan virus.
en-mt: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; After replication of the viral genome, the genomic RNA, accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins, forms a vesicle containing the virion, which then fuses with the plasma membrane to release the virus.

sourceString: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.
targetString: Sekuens genomik SARS-CoV-2 pertama dilaporkan pada 10 Januari 2020.
en-mt: The first SARS-CoV-2 genomic sequence was reported on 10 January 2020.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the original site of the outbreak, the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 merupakan beta-CoV tipe baru dengan kesamaan genetik lebih dari 99,98% di antara 10 sampel yang disekuensi; sampel tersebut diambil dari lokasi asal wabah, yakni Pasar Makanan Laut Huanan di Wuhan.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic similarity among the 10 sequenced samples; the samples were taken from the location of the outbreak, namely the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.
targetString: Secara genetik, SARS-CoV-2 lebih mirip dengan SARS-CoV dibandingkan dengan MERS-CoV.
en-mt: Genetically, SARS-CoV-2 is more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium.
targetString: Melalui mikroskopi elektron transmisi, partikel SARS-CoV-2 ditemukan di bagian epitelium saluran napas manusia yang sangat tipis.
en-mt: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in very thin sections of the epithelium of the human airways.

sourceString: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.
targetString: ACE2 manusia ditemukan merupakan reseptor untuk SARS-CoV-2 seperti juga SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 like SARS-CoV.

sourceString: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 more weakly than that of SARS-CoV, which is coincident with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.
targetString: Meski demikian, protein S SARS-CoV-2 berikatan dengan ACE2 manusia lebih lemah daripada ikatannya dengan protein S SARS-CoV, yang sesuai dengan fakta bahwa SARS-CoV-2 menyebabkan infeksi yang tidak separah infeksi SARS-CoV pada pasien.
en-mt: However, the SARS-CoV-2 S protein binds to human ACE2 weaker than it binds to the SARS-CoV S protein, which is consistent with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes infections that are less severe than SARS-CoV infections in patients.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 juga dapat membentuk protein pendek baru yang disandikan dengan orf3b dan protein yang disekresikan dengan sandi orf8.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 can also form new short proteins encoded with orf3b and secreted proteins encoded with orf8.

sourceString: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.
targetString: Protein orf3b SARS-CoV-2 mungkin berperan dalam patogenisitas virus dan inhibisi ekspresi IFNβ; namun, orf8 tidak memiliki domain fungsional atau motif yang dikenal.
en-mt: The orf3b protein of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in viral pathogenicity and inhibition of IFNβ expression; however, orf8 has no known functional domains or motifs.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of the full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.
targetString: Pada 18 Februari 2020, Zhou, et al. melaporkan struktur cryo-EM ACE2 lengkap manusia pada resolusi 2,9 Å dalam kompleks dengan transporter asam amino B0AT1.
en-mt: On 18 February 2020, Zhou, et al. reported the complete human ACE2 cryo-EM structure at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.

sourceString: They found that the complex, which had open and closed conformations, was assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which provides evidence for CoV recognition and infection.
targetString: Mereka menemukan bahwa kompleks, yang memiliki konformasi terbuka dan tertutup, tersusun membentuk dimer dan kompleks ACE2-B0AT1 dapat mengikat dua protein S, yang menjadi bukti untuk pengenalan dan infeksi CoV.
en-mt: They found that the complex, which has open and closed conformations, arrays to form dimers and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which is evidence for CoV recognition and infection.

sourceString: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.
targetString: B0AT1 dapat dijadikan sasaran terapeutik dalam penapisan obat untuk menekan infeksi SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: B0AT1 can be used as a therapeutic target in drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.

sourceString: The origin and intermediate host
targetString: Inang asal dan perantara
en-mt: Origin and intermediate hosts

sourceString: It has been known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.
targetString: SARS-CoV dan MERS-CoV diketahui berasal dari kelelawar dan masing-masing ditransmisikan kepada manusia melalui musang dan unta.
en-mt: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV are known to originate in bats and are transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.

sourceString: Through a phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered the native host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.
targetString: Melalui perbandingan filogenetik SARS-CoV-2 dengan CoV lain, kelelawar dianggap sebagai inang asli SARS-CoV-2 karena virus baru ini 96% identik dengan dua CoV mirip-SARS dari kelelawar yang disebut bat-SL-CoVZX45 dan bat-SL-CoVZX21.
en-mt: Through phylogenetic comparisons of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats are considered to be the original hosts of SARS-CoV-2 because the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21 .

sourceString: However, what intermediate host helped the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the transmission route is yet to be elucidated.
targetString: Namun, inang perantara yang membantu virus melintas penghalang spesies untuk menginfeksi manusia masih belum diketahui, dan rute transmisi masih harus dijelaskan.
en-mt: However, the intermediate host that helps the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the route of transmission remains to be elucidated.

sourceString: Ji, et al., proposed snakes as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans which involved homologous recombination within the S protein.
targetString: Ji, et al. mengusulkan ular sebagai pembawa virus dari kelelawar kepada manusia yang melibatkan rekombinasi homolog di dalam protein S.
en-mt: Ji, et al. proposed snakes as carriers of viruses from bats to humans involving homologous recombination in the S protein.

sourceString: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggested that pangolins - long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine - are the potential intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology in a CoV discovered in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Menurut sebuah studi, peneliti di Guangzhou, Tiongkok, mengusulkan bahwa tenggiling, mamalia bermoncong panjang pemakan semut yang sering digunakan dalam obat Tionghoa tradisional, berpotensi sebagai inang perantara SARS-CoV-2 berdasarkan 99% homologi genetik pada CoV yang ditemukan di tenggiling dan SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, proposed that pangolins, a long-snouted ant-eating mammal often used in traditional Chinese medicine, could potentially serve as an intermediate host for SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology to CoV found in pangolins and SARS-CoV. CoV-2.

sourceString: However, 1% difference spread all over two genomes is still a big difference; thus, conclusive results for concrete evidence are awaited (Fig. ​(Fig.33).
targetString: Meski demikian, 1% perbedaan yang tersebar di seluruh genom masih merupakan perbedaan yang besar; karena itu, hasil yang konklusif sebagai bukti konkret masih belum didapatkan (Gbr. 3).
en-mt: Even so, a 1% difference spread across the genome is still a big difference; therefore, conclusive results as concrete evidence have yet to be obtained (Fig. 3).

sourceString: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely not yet known.
targetString: Sifat fisikokimia SARS-CoV-2 sebagian besar belum diketahui.
en-mt: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely unknown.

sourceString: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.
targetString: In vitro, SARS-CoV dan MERS-CoV dapat bertahan selama 48 jam di lingkungan yang kering dan hingga 5 hari pada 20 °C dan kelembapan 40%-50%.
en-mt: In vitro, SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days at 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar properties.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 mungkin memiliki sifat yang serupa.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 may have similar properties.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate the virus.
targetString: Dilaporkan bahwa SARS-CoV-2 sensitif terhadap sinar ultraviolet dan panas pada 56 °C selama 30 menit; eter, etanol 75%, disinfektan yang mengandung klorin, asam perasetat, kloroform, dan pelarut lemak lainnya, tetapi bukan klorheksidin, efektif menonaktifkan virus.
en-mt: It was reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet light and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectants, peracetic acid, chloroform and other fat solvents, but not chlorhexidine, are effective in inactivating viruses.

sourceString: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and hence is susceptible to the novel virus.
targetString: Secara umum, seluruh populasi manusia tidak memiliki imunitas terhadap SARS-CoV-2 dan karena itu rentan terhadap virus baru ini.
en-mt: In general, the entire human population lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and is therefore susceptible to this new virus.

sourceString: Currently, no detailed study has been reported regarding the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Saat ini, belum ada studi terperinci yang melaporkan tentang respons imunologis terhadap SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Currently, there are no detailed studies reporting on the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Thus, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. ​(Fig.4).4).
targetString: Karena itu, kita hanya bisa merujuk ke penelitian CoV lain sebelumnya, khususnya SARS-CoV dan MERS-CoV (Gbr. 4).4).
en-mt: Therefore, we can only refer to other previous CoV studies, specifically SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. 4).4).

sourceString: In general, after a virus invades the host, it is first recognized by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
targetString: Secara umum, setelah menginvasi inang, virus dikenali oleh sistem imun bawaan melalui reseptor pengenal pola (PRR), yang mencakup C-type lectin-like receptor, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), dan RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
en-mt: In general, after invading a host, viruses are recognized by the innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs), which include C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptors (TLRs), NOD-like receptors (NLRs), and RIG- I-like receptors (RLR).

sourceString: Through different pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spreading of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.
targetString: Melalui jalur yang berbeda, virus menginduksi ekspresi faktor inflamatori, maturasi sel dendritik, dan sintesis interferon tipe I (IFN) yang membatasi penyebaran virus dan mempercepat fagositosis antigen virus oleh makrofag.
en-mt: Via different pathways, viruses induce expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferon (IFN) which limit viral spread and accelerate phagocytosis of viral antigens by macrophages.

sourceString: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape from the immune responses.
targetString: Namun, protein N pada SARS-CoV dapat membantu virus mengelakkan respons imun.
en-mt: However, the N protein in SARS-CoV can help the virus evade the immune response.

sourceString: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.
targetString: Tidak lama kemudian, respons imun adaptif bergabung dalam pertempuran melawan virus ini.
en-mt: It wasn't long before the adaptive immune response joined the battle against this virus.

sourceString: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in the defense.
targetString: Limfosit T, yang mencakup sel CD4+ dan CD8+, memainkan peranan penting dalam pertahanan ini.
en-mt: T lymphocytes, which include CD4+ and CD8+ cells, play an important role in this defense.

sourceString: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.
targetString: Sel T CD4+ menstimulasi sel B untuk menghasilkan antibodi yang spesifik terhadap virus, dan sel T CD8+ membunuh sel yang terinfeksi virus secara langsung.
en-mt: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells kill virus-infected cells directly.

sourceString: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help the defending cells.
targetString: Sel T penolong menghasilkan sitokin proinflamatori untuk membantu melindungi sel.
en-mt: Helper T cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help protect the cell.

sourceString: However, CoV can inhibit T cell functions by inducing apoptosis of T cells.
targetString: Meski demikian, CoV dapat menghambat fungsi sel T dengan menginduksi apoptosis sel T.
en-mt: However, CoV can inhibit T cell function by inducing T cell apoptosis.

sourceString: The humoral immunity including complements such as C3a and C5a and antibodies is also essential in combating the viral infection.
targetString: Imunitas humoral, yang mencakup komplemen, seperti C3a dan C5a, serta antibodi juga penting dalam melawan infeksi virus.
en-mt: Humoral immunity, which includes complement, such as C3a and C5a, and antibodies are also important in fighting viral infections.

sourceString: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient neutralized MERS-CoV.
targetString: Misalnya, antibodi yang diisolasi dari pasien yang sudah sembuh menetralkan MERS-CoV.
en-mt: For example, antibodies isolated from recovered patients neutralize MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates a large number of free radicals locally that can cause severe damages to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst scenario, multi-organ failure and even death.
targetString: Di sisi lain, reaksi sistem imun yang berlebihan menghasilkan sejumlah besar radikal bebas secara lokal, yang dapat menyebabkan kerusakan parah pada paru dan organ lain, dan, pada skenario terburuk, gagal organ majemuk dan bahkan kematian.
en-mt: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates large amounts of free radicals locally, which can cause severe damage to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst case scenario, multiple organ failure and even death.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 infection, featured by clustering onset, is more likely to affect elderly people with comorbidities and pregnant women.
targetString: Infeksi SARS-CoV-2, yang ditandai dengan klaster awitan, lebih banyak mengenai lansia dengan penyakit penyerta dan wanita hamil.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infection, which is characterized by an onset cluster, mostly affects the elderly with co-morbidities and pregnant women.

sourceString: It is common that for people who are exposed to a large number of viruses or whose immune functions are compromised, they have higher chance to be infected than others.
targetString: Umumnya, orang yang terpapar virus dalam jumlah besar atau yang fungsi imunnya terganggu memiliki peluang terinfeksi lebih tinggi daripada orang lain.
en-mt: Generally, people who are exposed to large amounts of the virus or whose immune function is compromised have a higher chance of being infected than other people.

sourceString: The estimated mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Estimasi periode inkubasi rata-rata SARS-CoV-2 adalah 1-14 hari, kebanyakan 3-7 hari berdasarkan studi terhadap 425 kasus pertama di Wuhan.
en-mt: The estimated average incubation period for SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: However, a study on 1,099 cases demonstrates that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.
targetString: Namun, sebuah studi terhadap 1.099 kasus menunjukkan bahwa periode inkubasi rata-rata adalah 3 hari dan berkisar mulai dari 0 hingga 24 hari.
en-mt: However, a study of 1,099 cases showed that the average incubation period was 3 days and ranged from 0 to 24 days.

sourceString: A more recent study, as described above, demonstrates that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demography of 8,866 cases.
targetString: Studi yang lebih baru, sebagaimana dijelaskan di atas, menunjukkan bahwa periode inkubasi 4,8 (3,0-7,2) hari berdasarkan demografi 8.866 kasus.
en-mt: The more recent study, as described above, showed an incubation period of 4.8 (3.0–7.2) days based on the demographics of 8,866 cases.

sourceString: It is very important for health authorities to adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period, thus preventing infected but symptomless people from transmitting the virus to others.
targetString: Penting sekali otoritas kesehatan menyesuaikan waktu karantina efektif berdasarkan periode inkubasi paling akurat sehingga mencegah orang yang terinfeksi, tetapi tanpa gejala, mentransmisikan virus kepada orang lain.
en-mt: It is critical that health authorities adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period so as to prevent people who are infected but asymptomatic from transmitting the virus to others.

sourceString: As a common practice, individuals exposed to, or infected by, the virus are usually required to be quarantined for 14 days.
targetString: Sebagai praktik umum, orang yang terpapar virus atau terinfeksi biasanya diharuskan untuk dikarantina selama 14 hari.
en-mt: As a general practice, people exposed to the virus or infected are usually required to quarantine for 14 days.

sourceString: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?
targetString: Haruskan waktu karantina diperpanjang hingga 24 hari?
en-mt: Should quarantine time be extended to 24 days?

sourceString: Fever is often the major and initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be accompanied by no symptom or other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle ache, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
targetString: Demam sering kali merupakan gejala COVID-19 utama dan awal, dengan atau tanpa disertai gejala lain seperti batuk kering, sesak napas, nyeri otot, limbung, sakit kepala, sakit tenggorokan, rinorea, nyeri dada, diare, nausea, dan muntah.
en-mt: Fever is often the main and initial symptom of COVID-19, with or without other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle aches, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea and vomiting.

sourceString: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.
targetString: Beberapa pasien mengalami dispnea dan/atau hipoksemia satu minggu setelah awitan penyakit.
en-mt: Some patients experience dyspnea and/or hypoxaemia one week after the onset of the disease.

sourceString: In severe cases, patients quickly progressed to develop acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.
targetString: Pada kasus yang berat, perkembangan penyakit pasien berlangsung cepat menjadi sindrom pernapasan akut, syok septik, asidosis metabolik, dan koagulopati.
en-mt: In severe cases, the patient progresses rapidly to acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.

sourceString: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without pulmonary imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.
targetString: Pasien yang mengalami demam dan/atau gejala pernapasan dan demam akut, walaupun tanpa kelainan pencitraan paru, harus ditapis terhadap virus untuk diagnosis dini.
en-mt: Patients presenting with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without lung imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.

sourceString: A demographic study in late December of 2019 showed that the percentages of the symptoms were 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of the patients required ventilation support.
targetString: Studi demografi pada akhir Desember 2019 menunjukkan bahwa persentase gejala sebesar 98% untuk demam, 76% untuk batuk kering, 55% untuk dispnea, dan 3% untuk diare; 8% pasien memerlukan dukungan ventilator.
en-mt: Demographic studies at the end of December 2019 showed that the percentage of symptoms was 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of patients require ventilator support.

sourceString: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cluster and a cluster caused by transmission from an asymptomatic individual.
targetString: Temuan serupa dilaporkan dalam dua studi baru-baru ini, yakni studi pada klaster keluarga dan klaster yang disebabkan transmisi dari orang asimtomatik.
en-mt: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies, namely the family cluster and the study attributable to transmission from asymptomatic persons.

sourceString: Comparably, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.
targetString: Sebanding dengan itu, studi demografi pada tahun 2012 menunjukkan bahwa pasien MERS-CoV juga mengalami demam (98%), batuk kering (47%), dan dispnea (55%) sebagai gejala utamanya.
en-mt: In comparison, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also experienced fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.

sourceString: However, 80% of them required ventilation support, much more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than of COVID-19.
targetString: Namun, 80% pasien membutuhkan dukungan ventilasi, jauh lebih banyak daripada pasien COVID-19 dan konsisten dengan letalitas MERS yang lebih tinggi daripada COVID-19.
en-mt: However, 80% of patients required ventilation support, far more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than COVID-19.

sourceString: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed with MERS patients.
targetString: Diare (26%) dan sakit tenggorokan (21%) juga teramati pada pasien MERS.
en-mt: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed in MERS patients.

sourceString: In SARS patients, it has been demonstrated that fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and ventilation support was required for approximately 14%-20% of the patients.
targetString: Pada pasien SARS, demam (99%-100%), batuk kering (29%-75%), dispnea (40%-42%), diare (20-25%), dan sakit tenggorokan (13-25%) ditunjukkan sebagai gejala utama dan dukungan ventilasi diperlukan untuk sekitar 14%-20% pasien.
en-mt: In SARS patients, fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) are shown as the main symptom and ventilatory support is required for approximately 14%-20% of patients.

sourceString: By February 14, the mortality of COVID-19 was 2% when the confirmed cases reached 66,576 globally.
targetString: Hingga 14 Februari, mortalitas COVID-19 sebesar 2% dengan kasus terkonfirmasi mencapai 66.576 di seluruh dunia.
en-mt: Until February 14, the COVID-19 mortality was 2% with confirmed cases reaching 66,576 worldwide.

sourceString: Comparably, the mortality of SARS by November 2002 was 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.
targetString: Sebanding dengan itu, mortalitas SARS pada November 2002 sebesar 10% dari 8.096 kasus terkonfirmasi.
en-mt: In comparison, the mortality of SARS in November 2002 was 10% from 8,096 confirmed cases.

sourceString: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, the mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.
targetString: Untuk MERS, berdasarkan studi demografi pada Juni 2012, mortalitas sebesar 37% dari 2.494 kasus terkonfirmasi.
en-mt: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.

sourceString: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, whereas the R0 of SARS-CoV only ranged from 2 to 4.
targetString: Studi sebelumnya melaporkan bahwa R0 SARS-CoV-2 mencapai setinggi 6,47 dengan interval kepercayaan (CI) 95% sebesar 5,71-7,23, sementara R0 SARS-CoV hanya berkisar 2 hingga 4.
en-mt: Previous studies reported that the R0 for SARS-CoV-2 reached as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, while the R0 for SARS-CoV only ranged from 2 to 4.

sourceString: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV regarding their symptoms, mortality, and R0 is presented in Table ​Table1.1.
targetString: Perbandingan SARS-CoV-2 dengan MERS-CoV dan SARS-CoV dalam hal gejala, mortalitas, dan R0 diberikan di Tabel 1.
en-mt: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV in terms of symptoms, mortality and R0 is given in Table 1.

sourceString: The above figures suggest that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it is less lethal than the latter two.
targetString: Angka-angka tersebut menunjukkan bahwa SARS-CoV-2 memiliki kemampuan menyebar yang lebih tinggi dibandingkan MERS-CoV dan SARS-CoV, tetapi tidak semematikan MERS-CoV dan SARS-CoV.
en-mt: These figures show that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but is not as lethal as MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
targetString: Karena itu, tantangan untuk mengontrol pandemi SARS-CoV-2 lebih besar daripada pandemi MERS-CoV dan SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Therefore, the challenge to control the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic is greater than the MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV pandemics.

sourceString: Clustered onset often happens in the same family or from the same gathering or vehicle such as a cruise ship.
targetString: Awitan berklaster sering dijumpai dalam satu keluarga atau dari satu perkumpulan atau kendaraan seperti kapal pesiar.
en-mt: Clustered onset is often found in one family or from one association or vehicle such as a cruise ship.

sourceString: Patients often have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected individuals or patients in the recent two weeks before the onset.
targetString: Pasien sering kali memiliki riwayat perjalanan atau tinggal di Wuhan atau daerah terdampak lainnya atau berkontak dengan orang terinfeksi atau pasien dalam dua minggu terakhir sebelum awitan.
en-mt: Patients often have a history of traveling or living in Wuhan or other affected areas or coming into contact with infected people or patients in the last two weeks prior to onset.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms longer than two weeks and cured patients discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, which sends out an alarm to increase the time for quarantine.
targetString: Namun, dilaporkan bahwa orang dapat membawa virus tanpa menunjukkan gejala lebih dari dua minggu dan pasien yang dipulangkan dari rumah sakit dapat membawa virus lagi. Hal ini menimbulkan kewaspadaan untuk meningkatkan waktu karantina.
en-mt: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without showing symptoms for more than two weeks and patients who are discharged from the hospital can carry the virus again. This raises awareness to increase quarantine time.

sourceString: Patients have normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) at the early stage.
targetString: Di tahap awal, pasien memiliki hitung sel darah putih perifer (khususnya limfosit) normal atau menurun.
en-mt: In the early stages, patients have a normal or decreased peripheral white blood cell (especially lymphocyte) count.

sourceString: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Misalnya, limfopenia dengan hitung sel darah putih < 4×109/L, yang mencakup hitung limfosit < 1×109/L, dan kadar aspartat aminotransferase serta viremia yang meningkat ditemukan pada 1.099 pasien COVID-19.
en-mt: For example, lymphopenia with a white blood cell count < 4×109/L, which includes a lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: The levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin were increased in the blood of some patients, and C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation were increased in the blood of most patients.
targetString: Kadar enzim hati dan otot serta mioglobin meningkat dalam darah sejumlah pasien, serta protein C-reaktif dan laju endap darah meningkat pada sebagian besar pasien.
en-mt: Blood levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin were increased in some patients, and C-reactive protein and the erythrocyte sedimentation rate were increased in the majority of patients.

sourceString: In patients with severe cases, the level of D-dimer, a fibrin degradation product present in the blood, was elevated, and lymphocyte count was progressively reduced.
targetString: Pada pasien dengan kasus berat, kadar D-dimer meningkat, yakni produk penguraian fibrin yang ada dalam darah, dan hitung limfosit menurun secara progresif.
en-mt: In patients with severe cases, the level of D-dimer, which is a breakdown product of fibrin present in the blood, increases, and the lymphocyte count decreases progressively.

sourceString: Abnormalities in chest radiography are found in most COVID-19 patients and featured by bilateral patchy shadows or ground glass opacity in the lungs.
targetString: Kelainan foto toraks ditemukan pada sebagaian besar pasien COVID-19 dan ditandai dengan bayangan berawan bilateral atau opasitas ground-glass di paru.
en-mt: X-ray abnormalities are found in the majority of COVID-19 patients and are characterized by bilateral cloudy shadows or ground-glass opacity in the lungs.

sourceString: Patients often develop an atypical pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: Pasien sering kali mengalami pneumonia atipis, cedera paru akut, dan sindrom gawat napas akut (ARDS).
