en-mt: Patients frequently present with atypic pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).

sourceString: When ARDS happens, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely compromise the gas exchange.
targetString: Saat ARDS terjadi, inflamasi takterkendali, akumulasi cairan, dan fibrosis progresif sangat memperparah gangguan pertukaran gas.
en-mt: When ARDS occurs, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis greatly exacerbate the impaired gas exchange.

sourceString: Dysfunction of type-I and type-II pneumocytes decreases the surfactant level and increases surface tension, thus reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and heightening the risk of lung collapse.
targetString: Disfungsi pneumosit tipe I dan tipe II menurunkan kadar surfaktan dan meningkatkan tekanan permukaan sehingga menurunkan kemampuan paru untuk mengembang dan meningkatkan risiko kolaps paru.
en-mt: Dysfunction of type I and type II pneumocytes reduces surfactant levels and increases surface tension, thereby reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and increasing the risk of lung collapse.

sourceString: Therefore, the worst chest radiographic findings often parallel the most severe extent of the disease.
targetString: Karena itu, temuan paling buruk pada foto toraks sering kali paralel dengan tingkat penyakit paling parah.
en-mt: Therefore, the worst findings on the chest X-ray often parallel the most severe disease.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, the first pathological analysis of COVID-19 demonstrated the desquamation of pneumocytes, hyaline membrane formation, and interstitial lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of a patient who died of the disease, consistent with the pathology of viral infection and ARDS and similar to that of SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: Pada 18 Februari 2020, analisis patologis COVID-19 pertama menunjukkan deskuamasi pneumosit, pembentukan membran hialin, dan infiltrasi limfosit interstisial, serta sel sinsitial berinti banyak di paru pasien yang meninggal karena penyakit ini, sesuai dengan patologi infeksi virus dan ARDS serta serupa dengan analisis patologis pasien SARS dan MERS.
en-mt: On 18 February 2020, the first COVID-19 pathological analysis showed desquamation of pneumocytes, formation of hyaline membranes, and infiltration of interstitial lymphocytes and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of patients who died of this disease, consistent with the pathology of viral infection and ARDS and similar to pathological analysis. SARS and MERS patients.

sourceString: The detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA via reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) was used as the major criteria for the diagnosis of COVID-19.
targetString: Deteksi RNA SARS-CoV-2 melalui reaksi rantai polimerase transkriptase balik (RT-PCR) digunakan sebagai kriteria utama untuk diagnosis COVID-19.
en-mt: Detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA through reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) is used as the main criterion for the diagnosis of COVID-19.

sourceString: However, due to the high false-negative rate, which may accelerate the epidemic, clinical manifestations started to be used for diagnosis (which no longer solely relied on RT-PCR) in China on February 13, 2020.
targetString: Namun, karena tingginya tingkat negatif palsu, yang dapat mempercepat epidemi, manifestasi klinis mulai digunakan untuk diagnosis (yang tidak lagi hanya bergantung pada RT-PCR) di Tiongkok pada 13 Februari 2020.
en-mt: However, due to the high rate of false negatives, which may accelerate the epidemic, clinical manifestations started to be used for diagnosis (which no longer rely solely on RT-PCR) in China on February 13, 2020.

sourceString: A similar situation also occurred with the diagnosis of SARS.
targetString: Situasi serupa juga terjadi pada diagnosis SARS.
en-mt: A similar situation also occurs with the diagnosis of SARS.

sourceString: Therefore, a combination of disease history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests, and radiological findings is essential and imperative for making an effective diagnosis.
targetString: Karena itu, kombinasi antara riwayat penyakit, manifestasi klinis, uji laboratorium, dan temuan radiologis sangat penting dan suatu keharusan untuk membuat diagnosis yang efektif.
en-mt: Therefore, a combination of history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests, and radiological findings is essential and a must for making an effective diagnosis.

sourceString: On February 14, 2020, the Feng Zhang group described a protocol of using the CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique to detect SARS-CoV-2, which detects synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fragments at 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter of input) using a dipstick in less than an hour without requiring elaborate instrumentation.
targetString: Pada 14 Februari 2020, grup Feng Zhang menjelaskan protokol penggunaan teknik SHERLOCK berbasis-CRISPR untuk mendeteksi SARS-CoV-2, yang mendeteksi fragmen RNA SARS-CoV-2 sintetik pada 20 × 10-18 mol/L hingga 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 salinan per mikroliter input) menggunakan tongkat celup dalam waktu kurang dari satu jam tanpa memerlukan instrumentasi yang rumit.
en-mt: On February 14, 2020, Feng Zhang's group described a protocol for using the CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique for detecting SARS-CoV-2, which detects synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fragments at 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol /L (10-100 copies per microliter of input) using the dipstick in less than an hour without the need for complex instrumentation.

sourceString: Hopefully, the new technique can dramatically enhance the sensitivity and convenience if verified in clinical samples.
targetString: Semoga saja, teknik baru ini dapat sangat meningkatkan sensitivitas dan kemudahan jika terverifikasi pada sampel klinis.
en-mt: Hopefully, this new technique could greatly improve sensitivity and ease of verification in clinical samples.

sourceString: Due to the lack of experience with the novel CoV, physicians can mainly provide supportive care to COVID-19 patients, while attempting a variety of therapies that have been used or proposed before for the treatment of other CoVs such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV and other viral diseases (Table ​(Table2).2).
targetString: Karena kurangnya pengalaman dengan CoV baru, dokter terutama menawarkan perawatan pendukung kepada pasien COVID-19, selagi mencoba berbagai terapi yang pernah digunakan atau diusulkan sebelumnya untuk perawatan CoV lain, seperti SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV, dan penyakit viral lainnya (Tabel 2).2).
en-mt: Due to the lack of experience with new CoV, doctors mainly offer supportive care to COVID-19 patients, while trying various therapies that have been used or proposed previously for the treatment of other CoV, such as SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and other viral diseases (Table 2) .2).

sourceString: These therapies include current and potential treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.
targetString: Terapi ini mencakup terapi yang ada saat ini dan terapi potensial dengan obat antivirus, imunosupresan, steroid, plasma dari pasien yang sudah sembuh, obat tradisional Tionghoa, dan dukungan psikologis.
en-mt: These therapies include current and potential treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, convalescent plasma, traditional Chinese medicine, and psychological support.

sourceString: Even plasma from recovered patients was proposed to be used for treatment.
targetString: Bahkan plasma dari pasien yang sudah sembuh diusulkan untuk digunakan dalam terapi.
en-mt: Even plasma from recovered patients has been proposed for use in therapy.

sourceString: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.
targetString: Perusahaan farmasi berlomba mengembangkan antibodi dan vaksin terhadap virus ini.
en-mt: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against this virus.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 mainly attacks the lungs in the beginning and probably also attacks, to a lesser degree, other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and the kidneys.
targetString: Di tahap awal, SARS-CoV-2 terutama menyerang paru dan mungkin juga menyerang organ lain yang mengekspresikan ACE2 dalam tingkat yang lebih rendah, seperti sistem gastrointestinal dan ginjal.
en-mt: In its early stages, SARS-CoV-2 mainly attacks the lungs and may also attack other organs that express ACE2 to a lesser extent, such as the gastrointestinal system and kidneys.

sourceString: Nevertheless, respiratory dysfunction and failure are the major threat to the patients and the major cause of death.
targetString: Namun, disfungsi dan kegagalan pernapasan merupakan ancaman utama bagi pasien dan penyebab utama kematian.
en-mt: However, respiratory dysfunction and failure is a major threat to patients and a leading cause of death.

sourceString: Thus, respiratory support is critical to relieve the symptoms and save lives and includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation depending on the severity of the disease.
targetString: Karena itu, dukungan pernapasan sangat penting untuk meringankan gejala dan menyelamatkan nyawa, yang mencakup terapi oksigen umum, oksigen aliran tinggi, ventilasi noninvasif, dan ventilasi mekanis invasif, tergantung tingkat keparahan penyakit.
en-mt: Because of this, respiratory support is essential to relieve symptoms and save lives, which includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, non-invasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation, depending on the severity of the disease.

sourceString: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms have to be supported by extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used for the treatment of life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.
targetString: Pasien dengan gejala pernapasan berat harus didukung dengan oksigenasi membran ekstrakorporeum (ECMO), yaitu teknik pintas kardiopulmoner termodifikasi yang digunakan untuk perawatan kegagalan jantung atau pernapasan yang mengancam jiwa.
en-mt: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms should be supported with extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used for the treatment of life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.

sourceString: In addition, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, the prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and the protection of the functions of the vital organs are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.
targetString: Selain itu, penjagaan keseimbangan elektrolit, pencegahan dan perawatan infeksi sekunder dan syok septik, serta perlindungan fungsi organ vital juga sangat penting bagi pasien SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: In addition, maintaining electrolyte balance, preventing and treating secondary infections and septic shock, and protecting vital organ functions are also very important for SARS-CoV-2 patients.

sourceString: It has been known that a cytokine storm results from an overreaction of the immune system in SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: Reaksi sistem imun yang berlebihan diketahui mengakibatkan badai sitokin pada pasien SARS dan MERS.
en-mt: Overreaction of the immune system is known to cause cytokine storms in SARS and MERS patients.

sourceString: Cytokine storm is a form of systemic inflammatory response featured by the release of a series of cytokines including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.
targetString: Badai sitokin adalah bentuk respons inflamatori sistemik yang ditandai degnan pelepasan serangkaian sitokin, yang mencakup TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, dan MCP-1.
en-mt: Cytokine storm is a form of systemic inflammatory response characterized by the release of a series of cytokines, including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.

sourceString: These cytokines induce immune cells to release a vast number of free radicals which are the major cause of ARDS and multiple organ failure.
targetString: Sitokin-sitokin ini menginduksi sel imun untuk melepaskan sejumlah besar radikal bebas yang menjadi penyebab utama ARDS dan gagal organ majemuk.
en-mt: These cytokines induce immune cells to release large amounts of free radicals which are the main cause of ARDS and multiple organ failure.

sourceString: Immunosuppression is essential in the treatment of cytokine storms, especially in severe patients.
targetString: Imunosupresi sangat penting dalam penanganan badai sitokin, terutama pada pasien yang parah.
en-mt: Immunosuppression is very important in the management of cytokine storms, especially in severe patients.

sourceString: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytokine storm.
targetString: Kortikosteroid dan Tocilizumab, suatu antibodi monoklonal anti-IL6, telah digunakan untuk menangani badai sitokin.
en-mt: Corticosteroids and Tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytokine storms.

sourceString: Other immunosuppression treatments for cytokine storm include the modulation of T cell-directed immune response; the blockade of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressor of cytokine signaling 4; and HDAC inhibitors.
targetString: Penanganan imunosupresi lain untuk badai sitokin mencakup modulasi respons imun yang diarahkan sel T; pemblokiran IFN-γ, IL-1, dan TNF; inhibisi JAK; blinatumomab; penekan sinyal sitokin 4; dan inhibitor HDAC.
en-mt: Other immunosuppressive treatments for cytokine storm include modulation of the T-cell-directed immune response; IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF blocking; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; cytokine signaling suppressor 4; and HDAC inhibitors.

sourceString: Steroids, as immunosuppressants, were widely used in the treatment of SARS to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: Steroid, sebagai imunosupresan, banyak digunakan dalam perawatan SARS untuk mengurangi keparahan kerusakan inflamatori.
en-mt: Steroids, being immunosuppressants, are widely used in the treatment of SARS to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.

sourceString: However, steroids at high dosages were not beneficial to severe lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Namun, steroid pada dosis tinggi tidak berguna untuk cedera paru berat pada pasien SARS dan COVID-19.
en-mt: However, steroids at high doses are not useful for severe lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Instead, they may cause severe side effects, especially avascular osteonecrosis, dramatically affecting the prognosis.
targetString: Sebaliknya, steroid dapat mengakibatkan efek samping berat, khususnya osteonekrosis, yang sangat memengaruhi prognosis.
en-mt: In contrast, steroids can cause serious side effects, particularly osteonecrosis, which can greatly affect the prognosis.

sourceString: Nevertheless, short courses of corticosteroids at low-to-moderate doses have been recommended to be used prudently for critically ill COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Meski demikian, pemberian kortikosteroid singkat pada dosis rendah hingga sedang dianjurkan untuk diberikan dengan hati-hati pada pasien COVID-19 yang sakit kritis.
en-mt: However, brief administration of corticosteroids at low to moderate doses is recommended to be administered with caution to critically ill COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: At the time of writing, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.
targetString: Pada saat penulisan tinjauan ini, belum ada terapi antivirus efektif yang telah terkonfirmasi.
en-mt: At the time of writing this review, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.

sourceString: However, intravenous administration with remdesivir, a nucleotide analog, has been found to be efficacious in an American patient with COVID-19.
targetString: Namun, pemberian remdesivir secara intravena, yakni sebuah analog nukleotida, didapati berkhasiat pada seorang pasien COVID-19 dari Amerika.
en-mt: However, intravenous administration of remdesivir, a nucleotide analogue, was found to be efficacious in a COVID-19 patient from America.

sourceString: Remdesivir is a novel antiviral drug developed by Gilead initially for the treatment of diseases caused by Ebola and Marlburg viruses.
targetString: Remdesivir adalah obat antivirus baru yang dikembangkan oleh Gilead, semula untuk perawatan penyakit yang disebabkan oleh virus Ebola dan Marlburg.
en-mt: Remdesivir is a new antiviral drug developed by Gilead, originally for the treatment of diseases caused by the Ebola and Marlburg viruses.

sourceString: Later, remdesivir also demonstrated possible inhibition of other single stranded RNA viruses including MERS and SARS viruses.
targetString: Belakangan, remdesivir juga menunjukkan inhibisi terhadap virus RNA untai tunggal lainnya, yang mencakup virus MERS dan SARS.
en-mt: Recently, remdesivir has also shown inhibition against other single-stranded RNA viruses, including the MERS and SARS viruses.

sourceString: Based on these, Gilead has provided the compound to China to conduct a pair of trials on SARS-CoV-2-infected individuals, and the results are highly anticipated.
targetString: Berdasarkan hal ini, Gilead menyediakan senyawa ini bagi Tiongkok untuk melakukan serangkaian uji coba pada orang terinfeksi SARS-CoV-2, dan hasilnya sangat dinantikan.
en-mt: Based on this, Gilead provided this compound to China to conduct a series of trials on people infected with SARS-CoV-2, and the results are eagerly awaited.

sourceString: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.
targetString: Selain itu, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, dan ribavirin telah disarankan sebagai terapi potensial untuk pasien dengan gejala pernapasan akut.
en-mt: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.

sourceString: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other adverse reactions can occur following combined therapy with lopinavir/ritonavir.
targetString: Diare, nausea, muntah, kerusakan hati, dan reaksi samping lainnya dapat terjadi setelah terapi kombinasi dengan lopinavir/ritonavir.
en-mt: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage and other side reactions may occur after combination therapy with lopinavir/ritonavir.

sourceString: The interaction of these treatments with other drugs used in the patients should be monitored carefully.
targetString: Interaksi terapi ini dengan obat lain yang digunakan pasien harus dipantau secara saksama.
en-mt: Interactions of this therapy with other drugs used by the patient should be carefully monitored.

sourceString: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody generation
targetString: Plasma dari pasien yang sudah sembuh dan pembuatan antibodi
en-mt: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody production

sourceString: The collection of the blood from patients who recovered from a contagious disease to treat other patients suffering from the same disease or to protect healthy individuals from catching the disease has a long history.
targetString: Ada sejarah panjang tentang pengumpulan darah pasien yang sudah sembuh dari penyakit menular untuk mengobati pasien lain yang menderita penyakit yang sama atau untuk mencegah orang sehat terkena penyakit tersebut.
en-mt: There is a long history of collecting the blood of recovered patients from infectious diseases to treat other patients with the disease or to prevent healthy people from getting it.

sourceString: Indeed, recovered patients often have a relatively high level of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.
targetString: Memang, pasien yang sudah sembuh sering kali memiliki kadar antibodi yang relatif tinggi dalam darahnya.
en-mt: Indeed, recovered patients often have relatively high levels of antibodies in their blood.

sourceString: Antibodies are an immunoglobulin (Ig) produced by B lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other foreign objects and they recognize unique molecules in the pathogens and neutralize them directly.
targetString: Antibodi adalah imunoglobulin (Ig) yang dihasilkan limfosit B untuk melawan patogen serta benda asing lainnya, mengenali molekul unik pada patogen, dan langsung menetralkannya.
en-mt: Antibodies are immunoglobulins (Ig) that B lymphocytes produce to fight pathogens and other foreign bodies, recognize unique molecules in pathogens, and neutralize them instantly.

sourceString: Based on this, plasma was collected from the blood of a group of patients who recovered from COVID-19 and was injected into 10 seriously ill patients.
targetString: Berdasarkan hal ini, plasma dikumpulkan dari darah sekelompok pasien yang sudah sembuh dari COVID-19 dan disuntikkan kepada 10 pasien yang sakit parah.
en-mt: Based on this, plasma was collected from the blood of a group of patients who had recovered from COVID-19 and injected it into 10 seriously ill patients.

sourceString: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, accompanied by reduced inflammation and viral loads and improved oxygen saturation in the blood.
targetString: Gejala mereka membaik dalam 24 jam, disertai dengan menurunnya inflamasi dan beban virus serta meningkatnya saturasi oksigen dalam darah.
en-mt: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, accompanied by decreased inflammation and viral load and increased blood oxygen saturation.

sourceString: However, verification and clarification are necessary to propose the method for large-scale use before specific therapies are not yet developed.
targetString: Namun, verifikasi dan klarifikasi perlu dilakukan untuk mengajukan metode tersebut untuk penggunaan skala besar sebelum terapi spesifik dikembangkan.
en-mt: However, verification and clarification is necessary to propose the method for large-scale use before specific therapies are developed.

sourceString: In addition, given the therapeutic effects, some disadvantages associated with the plasma should be considered carefully.
targetString: Lebih lanjut, selain efek terapeutiknya, beberapa kekurangan yang berkaitan dengan plasma harus dipertimbangkan secara saksama.
en-mt: Furthermore, apart from the therapeutic effect, some drawbacks related to plasma must be carefully considered.

sourceString: For example, antibodies can overstimulate the immune response and cause cytokine release syndrome, which is potentially a life-threatening toxicity.
targetString: Sebagai contoh, antibodi dapat menstimulasi respons imun secara berlebihan dan menyebabkan sindrom pelepasan sitokin, yang merupakan toksisitas yang berpotensi mengancam jiwa.
en-mt: For example, antibodies can overstimulate the immune response and cause a cytokine release syndrome, which is a potentially life-threatening toxicity.

sourceString: The concentration of antibodies in the blood is usually low, and the demand for the plasma is large to treat critically ill patients.
targetString: Konsentrasi antibodi dalam darah biasanya rendah dan plasma dibutuhkan dalam jumlah besar untuk merawat pasien yang sakit kritis.
en-mt: Antibody concentrations in the blood are usually low and large amounts of plasma are required to treat critically ill patients.

sourceString: It is difficult to develop and produce specific antibodies rapidly enough to fight against a global epidemic.
targetString: Pengembangan dan produksi antibodi spesifik dengan cukup cepat untuk melawan epidemi global sulit dilakukan.
en-mt: Developing and producing specific antibodies fast enough to fight a global epidemic is difficult.

sourceString: Thus, it is more critical and practical to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify the genetic codes encoding effective antibodies or screen for effective antibodies against essential proteins of the virus.
targetString: Karena itu, lebih penting dan praktis mengisolasi sel B dari pasien yang sudah sembuh dan mengidentifikasi kode genetik yang menyandi antibodi efektif atau melakukan penapisan antibodi yang efektif terhadap protein yang penting bagi virus.
en-mt: Therefore, it is more important and practical to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify the genetic code that encodes effective antibodies or performs effective antibody screening against proteins important for viruses.

sourceString: This way, we can readily scale up the production of the antibodies.
targetString: Dengan cara ini, kita dapat dengan mudah meningkatkan skala produksi antibodi.
en-mt: In this way, we can easily scale up the production of antibodies.

sourceString: TCM has been used to treat a variety of diseases in China for thousands of years.
targetString: TCM telah digunakan untuk mengobati berbagai penyakit di Tiongkok selama ribuan tahun.
en-mt: TCM has been used to treat various ailments in China for thousands of years.

sourceString: However, its effects largely rely on a combination of multiple components in a formula that varies depending on the diagnosis of a disease based on the theories of TCM.
targetString: Namun, efeknya sebagian besar tergantung pada kombinasi berbagai komponen dalam formula. Formula ini berbeda-beda tergantung pada diagnosis penyakit berdasarkan teori TCM.
en-mt: However, the effect largely depends on the combination of various components in the formula. This formula varies depending on the diagnosis of the disease based on the TCM theory.

sourceString: Most of the effective components remain unknown or are vague as it is difficult to extract and verify such components or their optimal combinations.
targetString: Sebagian besar komponen efektif masih belum diketahui atau belum jelas karena sulit untuk mengekstrak atau memverifikasi komponen tersebut atau kombinasi optimalnya.
en-mt: Most of the effective components are still unknown or unclear because it is difficult to extract or verify them or their optimal combination.

sourceString: Currently, due to the lack of effective and specific therapy for COVID-19, TCM has become one of the major alternative treatments for patients with light to moderate symptoms or for those who have recovered from severe stages.
targetString: Saat ini, karena terapi yang efektif dan spesifik untuk COVID-19 belum ada, TCM menjadi salah satu terapi alternatif utama untuk pasien dengan gejala ringan hingga sedang atau untuk orang yang pulih dari penyakit berat.
en-mt: Currently, because there is no effective and specific therapy for COVID-19, TCM has become one of the main alternative therapies for patients with mild to moderate symptoms or for people recovering from severe illness.

sourceString: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du capsules and Lian Hua Qing Wen capsules were found to be effective for COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: Sebagai contoh, kapsul Shu Feng Jie Du dan kapsul Lian Hua Qing Wen didapati manjur untuk terapi COVID-19.
en-mt: For example, the Shu Feng Jie Du capsule and the Lian Hua Qing Wen capsule were found to be effective for treating COVID-19.

sourceString: Top cure rates in the treatment of COVID-19 patients were observed in several provinces in China that used TCM in 87% of their patients, including Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), and Hunan (50%), whereas Hubei province, which used TCM in only approximately 30% of its COVID-19 patients, had the lowest cure rate (13%).
targetString: Tingkat kesembuhan teratas dalam terapi pasien COVID-19 teramati di beberapa provinsi Tiongkok yang menggunakan TCM pada 87% pasiennya, yang mencakup Gansu (63,7%), Ningxia (50%), dan Hunan (50%), sementara provinsi Hubei, yang menggunakan TCM hanya pada sekitar 30% pasien COVID-19, memiliki tingkat kesembuhan terendah (13%).
en-mt: Top cure rates in treating COVID-19 patients were observed in Chinese provinces that used TCM in 87% of their patients, which included Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), and Hunan (50%), while Hubei province, which using TCM in only about 30% of COVID-19 patients, had the lowest cure rate (13%).

sourceString: However, this is quite a rough comparison as many other impact factors such as the number and severity of the patients should be included in the evaluation.
targetString: Namun, perbandingan ini masih sangat kasar sebab banyak faktor dampak lainnya, seperti jumlah dan keparahan pasien, harus disertakan dalam evaluasi.
en-mt: However, this comparison is still very crude because many other impact factors, such as the number and severity of patients, must be included in the evaluation.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and coworkers published a study to compare western medicine (WM) treatment alone with combined treatment of WM and TCM.
targetString: Pada 18 Februari 2020, Boli Zhang dan kawan-kawan memplubikasikan sebuah studi yang membandingkan terapi obat barat (WM) saja dengan terapi gabungan WM dan TCM.
en-mt: On February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and colleagues published a study comparing western drug therapy (WM) alone with combined therapy of WM and TCM.

sourceString: They found that the times needed for body temperature recovery, symptom disappearance, and hospitalization were remarkably shorter in the WM+TCM group than in the WM only group.
targetString: Mereka menemukan bahwa waktu yang diperlukan untuk pemulihan suhu tubuh, hilangnya gejala, dan rawat inap sangat jauh lebih singkat pada kelompok WM+TCM dibandingkan dengan kelompok WM saja.
en-mt: They found that the time to temperature recovery, relief of symptoms, and hospitalization was significantly shorter in the WM+TCM group than in the WM group alone.

sourceString: Most impressively, the rate for symptomatic worsening (from light to severe) was remarkably lower for the WM+TCM group than for the WM only group (7.4% versus 46.2%) and the mortality was lower in the WM+TCM group than WM only group (8.8% versus 39%).
targetString: Hal yang lebih mengesankan, tingkat pemburukan gejala (dari ringan ke berat) jauh lebih rendah untuk kelompok WM+TCM dibandingkan dengan kelompok WM saja (7,4% dibanding 46,2%) dan mortalitas lebih rendah pada kelompok WM+TCM dibandingkan dengan kelompok WM saja (8,8% dibanding 39%).
en-mt: More impressively, the rate of symptom aggravation (from mild to severe) was significantly lower for the WM+TCM group compared to the WM alone (7.4% vs. 46.2%) and lower mortality in the WM+TCM group compared to the WM+TCM group. WM only (8.8% vs 39%).

sourceString: Nevertheless, the efficacy and safety of TCM still await more well-controlled trials at larger scales and in more centers.
targetString: Meski demikian, efikasi dan keamanan TCM masih menunggu uji coba yang terkontrol lebih baik pada skala lebih besar dan di lebih banyak pusat penelitian.
en-mt: However, the efficacy and safety of TCM is still awaiting better controlled trials on a larger scale and in more research centers.

sourceString: It would also be intriguing to characterize the mechanism of actions and clarify the effective components of TCM treatments or their combinations if possible.
targetString: Hal yang menarik lainnya adalah mencirikan mekanisme kerja dan mengklarifikasi komponen efektif dalam terapi TCM atau kombinasinya, jika memungkinkan.
en-mt: Another area of interest is characterizing the mechanism of action and clarifying the effective components of TCM therapy or their combinations, where possible.

sourceString: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 mostly experience great fear of the highly contagious and even fatal disease, and quarantined people also experience boredom, loneliness, and anger.
targetString: Sebagian besar pasien yang diduga atau dikonfirmasi COVID-19 merasa sangat ketakutan akan penyakit yang sangat menular dan bahkan mematikan ini, dan orang yang dikarantina juga merasakan kebosanan, kesepian, dan kemarahan.
en-mt: Most patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 feel intense fear of this highly contagious and even deadly disease, and people in quarantine also experience boredom, loneliness and anger.

sourceString: Furthermore, symptoms of the infection such as fever, hypoxia, and cough as well as adverse effects of the treatments such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can lead to more anxiety and mental distress.
targetString: Lebih lanjut, gejala infeksi seperti demam, hipoksia, dan batuk serta efek samping terapi seperti insomnia yang disebabkan kortikosteroid dapat menyebabkan kecemasan dan tekanan mental yang lebih besar.
en-mt: Furthermore, symptoms of infection such as fever, hypoxia, and cough as well as side effects of therapy such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can cause greater anxiety and mental distress.

sourceString: In the early phase of the SARS outbreak, a range of psychiatric morbidities including persistent depression, anxiety, panic attacks, psychomotor excitement, psychotic symptoms, delirium, and even suicidality were reported.
targetString: Di fase awal wabah SARS, serangkaian morbiditas psikiatri, yang mencakup depresi, kecemasan, serangan panik, gejolak psikomotor, gejala psikotik, delirium, dan bahkan suisidalitas pernah dilaporkan.
en-mt: In the early phase of the SARS outbreak, a range of psychiatric morbidity, including depression, anxiety, panic attacks, psychomotor agitation, psychotic symptoms, delirium, and even suicide was reported.

sourceString: Mandatory contact tracing and quarantine, as a part of the public health responses to the COVID-19 outbreak, can make people more anxious and guilty about the effects of the contagion, quarantine, and stigma on their families and friends.
targetString: Pelacakan riwayat kontak dan karantina wajib, sebagai bagian dari respons kesehatan masyarakat terhadap wabah COVID-19, dapat membuat orang menjadi lebih cemas dan merasa bersalah terkait efek penularan, karantina, dan stigma tentang kerabat dan teman.
en-mt: Contact history tracing and mandatory quarantine, as part of the public health response to the COVID-19 outbreak, can make people more anxious and feel guilty about the effects of transmission, quarantine and stigma around relatives and friends.

sourceString: Thus, mental health care should be provided to COVID-19 patients, suspected individuals, and people in contact with them as well as the general public who are in need.
targetString: Karena itu, perawatan kesehatan mental harus disediakan bagi pasien COVID-19, orang yang diduga, dan orang yang berkontak dengan mereka, serta masyarakat umum yang membutuhkan.
en-mt: Therefore, mental health care must be provided for COVID-19 patients, suspected persons and those who come into contact with them, as well as the general public in need.

sourceString: The psychological support should include the establishment of multidisciplinary mental health teams, clear communications with regular and accurate updates about the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak and treatment plans and the use of professional electronic devices and applications to avoid close contact with each other.
targetString: Dukungan psikologis harus mencakup pembentukan tim kesehatan mental multidisipliner, komunikasi yang jelas dengan pembaruan rutin dan akurat tentang wabah SARS-CoV-2, dan rencana terapi serta penggunaan perangkat dan aplikasi elektronik profesional untuk menghindari kontak dekat satu sama lain.
en-mt: Psychological support should include establishing a multidisciplinary mental health team, clear communication with regular and accurate updates about the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak, and treatment plans and use of professional electronic devices and applications to avoid close contact with one another.

sourceString: Effective vaccines are essential for interrupting the chain of transmission from animal reservoirs and infected humans to susceptible hosts and are often complementary to antiviral treatment in the control of epidemics caused by emerging viruses.
targetString: Vaksin yang efektif sangat penting untuk memutus rantai transmisi dari reservoir hewan dan manusia terinfeksi kepada inang yang rentan dan sering kali bersifat melengkapi terapi antivirus dalam mengontrol epidemi yang disebabkan oleh kemunculan virus.
en-mt: Effective vaccines are essential to breaking the chain of transmission from infected animal and human reservoirs to susceptible hosts and are often complementary to antiviral therapy in controlling epidemics caused by emerging viruses.

sourceString: Efforts have been made to develop S protein-based vaccines to generate long-term and potent neutralizing antibodies and/or protective immunity against SARS-CoV.
targetString: Upaya telah dilakukan untuk mengembangkan vaksin berbasis protein S, yang secara jangka panjang dan efektif membuat antibodi penetralan dan/atau imunitas yang melindungi terhadap SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Efforts have been made to develop an S protein-based vaccine, which in the long term and effectively produces neutralizing antibodies and/or protective immunity against SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Live-attenuated vaccines have been evaluated in animal models for SARS.
targetString: Untuk SARS, vaksin hidup-dilemahkan telah dievaluasi pada hewan percobaan.
en-mt: For SARS, live-attenuated vaccines have been evaluated in animal models.

sourceString: However, the in vivo efficacy of these vaccine candidates in elderly individuals and lethal-challenge models and their protection against zoonotic virus infection have yet to be determined before a clinical study is initiated.
targetString: Meski demikian, efikasi in vivo kandidat vaksin ini pada lansia dan model tantangan letal serta perlindungannya terhadap infeksi virus zoonotik masih harus ditentukan sebelum studi klinis dimulai.
en-mt: However, the in vivo efficacy of this vaccine candidate in the elderly and its lethal challenge model and protection against zoonotic viral infections have yet to be determined before clinical studies begin.

sourceString: This is probably because SARS died down 17 years ago and no new case has been reported since.
targetString: Hal ini mungkin karena SARS mereda 17 tahun lalu dan tidak ada kasus baru dilaporkan sejak saat itu.
en-mt: This may be because SARS died down 17 years ago and no new cases have been reported since then.

sourceString: In contrast, sporadic cases and clusters of MERS continue to occur in the Middle East and spread to other regions owing to the persistence of zoonotic sources in endemic areas.
targetString: Sebaliknya, kasus sporadis dan klaster MERS terus terjadi di Timur Tengah dan menyebar ke wilayah lain karena terus adanya sumber zoonotik di daerah endemi.
en-mt: On the other hand, sporadic cases and clusters of MERS continued to occur in the Middle East and spread to other regions due to continued zoonotic sources in endemic areas.

sourceString: Vaccination strategies have been developed for MERS by using inactivated virus, DNA plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, virus-like particles and recombinant protein subunits and some have been evaluated in animal models.
targetString: Strategi vaksinasi telah dikembangkan untuk MERS dengan menggunakan virus yang dinonaktifkan, plasmid DNA, vektor virus, nanopartikel, partikel mirip virus, dan subunit protein rekombinan dan sebagian telah dievaluasi pada hewan percobaan.
en-mt: Vaccination strategies have been developed for MERS using deactivated virus, plasmid DNA, viral vectors, nanoparticles, virus-like particles, and recombinant protein subunits and have been partially evaluated in experimental animals.

sourceString: The development of a safe and effective vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 for non-immune individuals is an urgent and critical task for controlling the ongoing epidemic.
targetString: Pengembangan vaksin terhadap SARS-CoV-2 yang aman dan efektif untuk orang non-imun merupakan tugas yang sangat mendesak dan penting untuk mengontrol epidemi yang sedang berlangsung.
en-mt: The development of a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 that is safe and effective for non-immune people is a very urgent and important task for controlling the ongoing epidemic.

sourceString: However, it is challenging to overcome the difficulty because of the long period of time (averaged 18 months) needed for vaccine development and the dynamic variations of CoVs.
targetString: Namun, kesulitan ini tidak mudah diatasi karena waktu yang panjang untuk mengembangkan vaksin (rata-rata 18 bulan) dan variasi CoV yang dinamis.
en-mt: However, these difficulties are not easy to overcome due to the long time it takes to develop a vaccine (18 months on average) and the dynamic variation of CoV.

sourceString: As a novel disease, COVID-19 has just started to manifest its full clinical course throughout thousands of patients.
targetString: Sebagai penyakit baru, COVID-19 baru mulai memperlihatkan perjalanan klinis penuhnya pada ribuan pasien.
en-mt: As a new disease, COVID-19 is just starting to show its full clinical course in thousands of patients.

sourceString: In most cases, patients can recover gradually without sequelae.
targetString: Pada sebagian besar kasus, pasien dapat berangsur sembuh tanpa sequela.
en-mt: In most cases, patients recover slowly without sequelae.

sourceString: However, similar to SARS and MERS, COVID-19 is also associated with high morbidity and mortality in patients with severe cases.
targetString: Namun, serupa dengan SARS dan MERS, COVID-19 juga dikaitkan dengan morbiditas dan mortalitas yang tinggi pada pasien dengan kasus berat.
en-mt: However, similar to SARS and MERS, COVID-19 is also associated with high morbidity and mortality in patients with severe cases.

sourceString: Therefore, building a prognosis model for the disease is essential for health-care agencies to prioritize their services, especially in resource-constrained areas.
targetString: Karena itu, pembentukan model prognosis penyakit sangat penting bagi badan perawatan kesehatan guna memprioritaskan layanannya, khususnya di area dengan sumber daya terbatas.
en-mt: Therefore, establishing a disease prognosis model is critical for healthcare agencies to prioritize their services, especially in areas with limited resources.

sourceString: Based on clinical studies reported thus far, the following factors may affect or be associated with the prognosis of COVID-19 patients (Table ​(Table33):
targetString: Berdasarkan studi klinis yang dilaporkan sejauh ini, faktor berikut dapat memengaruhi atau dikaitkan dengan prognosis pasien COVID-19 (Tabel 3):
en-mt: Based on the clinical studies reported so far, the following factors may influence or be associated with the prognosis of COVID-19 patients (Table 3):

sourceString: Age: Age was the most important factor for the prognosis of SARS, which is also true for COVID-19.
targetString: Usia: Usia merupakan faktor paling penting untuk prognosis SARS, yang juga berlaku untuk COVID-19.
en-mt: Age: Age is the most important factor for the prognosis of SARS, which is also true for COVID-19.

sourceString: COVID-19 mainly happened at the age of 30-65 with 47.7% of those patients being over 50 in a study of 8,866 cases as described above.
targetString: COVID-19 terutama terjadi pada usia 30-65 tahun dengan 47,7% pasien berusia di atas 50 tahun dalam studi berisi 8.866 kasus sebagaimana dijelaskan di atas.
en-mt: COVID-19 mainly occurs at the age of 30-65 years with 47.7% of patients aged over 50 years in a study containing 8,866 cases as described above.

sourceString: Patients who required intensive care were more likely to have underlying comorbidities and complications and were significantly older than those who did not (at the median age of 66 versus 51), suggesting age as a prognostic factor for the outcome of COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Pasien yang membutuhkan perawatan intensif cenderung memiliki komorbiditas penyerta dan komplikasi serta secara signifikan berusia lebih tua dibandingkan pasien yang tidak membutuhkan perawatan intensif (median usia 66 tahun dibanding 51 tahun), yang mengisyaratkan usia sebagai faktor prognostik untuk hasil akhir pasien COVID-19.
en-mt: Patients who required intensive care tended to have comorbidities and complications and were significantly older than patients who did not require intensive care (median age 66 vs. 51 years), suggesting age as a prognostic factor for the outcome of COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Sex: SARS-CoV-2 has infected more men than women (0.31/100,000 versus 0.27/100,000), as described above.
targetString: Jenis kelamin: SARS-CoV-2 lebih banyak menginfeksi pria dibanding wanita (0,31/100.000 dibanding 0,27/100.000), sebagaimana dijelaskan di atas.
en-mt: Gender: SARS-CoV-2 infects more men than women (0.31/100,000 compared to 0.27/100,000), as described above.

sourceString: Comorbidities and complications: Patients with COVID-19 who require intensive care are more likely to suffer from acute cardiac injury and arrhythmia.
targetString: Komorbiditas dan komplikasi: Pasien COVID-19 yang memerlukan perawatan intensif memiliki kemungkinan lebih besar mengalami cedera jantung akut dan aritmia.
en-mt: Comorbidities and complications: COVID-19 patients who require intensive care are more likely to experience acute heart injury and arrhythmias.

sourceString: Cardiac events were also the main reason for death in SARS patients.
targetString: Kejadian jantung juga meruapakan alasan utama kematian pada pasien SARS.
en-mt: Cardiac events are also the main reason for death in SARS patients.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 can also bind to ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, which might lead to liver dysfunctions in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 dilaporkan juga dapat berikatan dengan kolangiosit dengan ACE2-positif, yang dapat mengakibatkan disfungsi hati pada pasien COVID-19.
en-mt: It is reported that SARS-CoV-2 can also bind to ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, which can result in liver dysfunction in COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: It is worth noting that age and underlying disease are strongly correlated and might interfere with each other.
targetString: Perlu diperhatikan bahwa usia dan penyakit yang mendasari sangat berkorelasi dan dapat saling memengaruhi.
en-mt: It should be noted that age and underlying disease are highly correlated and can influence each other.

sourceString: Abnormal laboratory findings: The C-reactive protein (CRP) level in blood reflects the severity of inflammation or tissue injury and has been proposed to be a potential prognostic factor for disease, response to therapy, and ultimate recovery.
targetString: Temuan laboratorium abnormal: Kadar protein C-reaktif (CRP) dalam darah mencerminkan keparahan inflamasi atau cedera jaringan dan diusulkan sebagai faktor prognostik potensial untuk penyakit, respons terhadap terapi, dan pemulihan akhir.
en-mt: Abnormal laboratory findings: Blood levels of C-reactive protein (CRP) reflect the severity of inflammation or tissue injury and are proposed as potential prognostic factors for disease, response to therapy, and eventual recovery.

sourceString: The correlation of CRP level to the severity and prognosis of COVID-19 has also been proposed.
targetString: Korelasi antara kadar CRP dan keparahan serta prognosis COVID-19 juga telah diusulkan.
en-mt: A correlation between CRP levels and the severity and prognosis of COVID-19 has also been suggested.

sourceString: In addition, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and creatine kinase (CK) may also help predict the outcome.
targetString: Selain itu, peningkatan laktat dehidrogenase (LDH), aspartat aminotransferase (AST), alanin aminotransferase (ALT), dan kreatin kinase (CK) juga dapat membantu memprediksi hasil akhir.
en-mt: In addition, increases in lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and creatine kinase (CK) can also help predict the outcome.

sourceString: These enzymes are expressed extensively in multiple organs, especially in the heart and liver, and are released during tissue damage.
targetString: Enzim-enzim ini diekspresikan sangat tinggi di berbagai organ, khususnya di jantung dan hati, dan dilepaskan selama kerusakan jaringan.
en-mt: These enzymes are highly expressed in various organs, particularly in the heart and liver, and are released during tissue damage.

sourceString: Thus, they are traditional markers for heart or liver dysfunctions.
targetString: Karena itu, enzim-enzim ini merupakan penanda tradisional untuk disfungsi jantung dan hati.
en-mt: Therefore, these enzymes are traditional markers for cardiac and hepatic dysfunction.

sourceString: Major clinical symptoms: Chest radiography and temporal progression of clinical symptoms should be considered together with the other issues for the prediction of outcomes and complications of COVID-19.
targetString: Gejala klinis utama: Foto toraks dan perkembangan gejala klinis temporal harus dipertimbangkan bersama dengan hal-hal lainnya untuk memprediksi hasil akhir dan komplikasi COVID-19.
en-mt: Key clinical features: Chest X-ray and the development of temporal clinical symptoms should be considered together with other factors to predict the outcome and complications of COVID-19.

sourceString: Use of steroids: As described above, steroids are immunosuppressant commonly used as an adjunctive therapy for infectious diseases to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: Penggunaan steroid: Sebagaimana dijelaskan di atas, steroid merupakan imunosupresan yang banyak digunakan sebagai terapi penunjang untuk penyakit infeksi guna mengurangi keparahan kerusakan inflamatori.
en-mt: Steroid use: As explained above, steroids are immunosuppressants that are widely used as adjunctive therapy for infectious diseases to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.

sourceString: Since a high dosage of corticosteroids was widely used in severe SARS patients, many survivors suffered from avascular osteonecrosis with life-long disability and poor life quality.
targetString: Karena kortikosteroid dosis tinggi banyak digunakan pada pasien SARS parah, banyak orang yang selamat dari penyakit ini akhirnya menderita osteonekrosis avaskular dengan disabilitas seumur hidup dan kualitas hidup yang buruk.
en-mt: Because high-dose corticosteroids were widely used in patients with severe SARS, many survivors of the disease eventually developed avascular osteonecrosis with lifelong disability and poor quality of life.

sourceString: Thus, if needed, steroids should be used at low dosage and for a short time in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Karena itu, jika diperlukan, steroid harus digunakan pada dosis rendah dan kurun waktu singkat pada pasien COVID-19.
en-mt: Therefore, if needed, steroids should be used at low doses for a short period of time in COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Mental stress: As described above, during the COVID-19 outbreak many patients have suffered from extraordinary stress as they often endured long periods of quarantine and extreme uncertainty and witnessed the death of close family members and fellow patients.
targetString: Tekanan mental: Seperti dijelaskan di atas, selama wabah COVID-19, banyak pasien menderita stres luar biasa karena mereka harus menjalani karantina jangka panjang dan ketidakpastian yang ekstrem serta menyaksikan kematian anggota keluarga dekat dan sesama pasien.
en-mt: Mental stress: As explained above, during the COVID-19 outbreak, many patients are suffering tremendous stress as they have to endure long-term quarantine and extreme uncertainty and witness the death of close family members and fellow patients.

sourceString: It is imperative to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from the stress and return to normal life.
targetString: Konseling psikologis dan dukungan jangka panjang harus diberikan untuk menolong pasien ini pulih dari stres dan kembali ke kehidupan normal.
en-mt: Psychological counseling and long-term support should be provided to help these patients recover from stress and return to normal life.

sourceString: According to demographic studies so far, COVID-19 seems to have different epidemiological features from SARS.
targetString: Berdasarkan studi demografi sejauh ini, COVID-19 tampaknya memiliki gambaran epidemiologis yang berbeda dengan SARS.
en-mt: Based on demographic studies so far, COVID-19 appears to have a different epidemiological picture than SARS.

sourceString: In addition to replicating in the lower respiratory tract, SARS-CoV-2 can efficiently replicate in the upper respiratory tract and causes mild or no symptoms in the early phase of infection, similar to other CoVs that cause common colds.
targetString: Selain bereplikasi di saluran pernapasan bawah, SARS-CoV-2 dapat bereplikasi secara efisien di saluran pernapasan atas dan menyebabkan gejala ringan atau tanpa gejala di fase awal infeksi, serupa dengan CoV lain yang menyebabkan pilek.
en-mt: As well as replicating in the lower respiratory tract, SARS-CoV-2 can replicate efficiently in the upper respiratory tract and cause mild or no symptoms in the early phase of infection, similar to other CoV that cause colds.

sourceString: Therefore, infected patients at the early phase or incubation period can produce a large amount of virus during daily activities, causing great difficulty for the control of the epidemic.
targetString: Karena itu, pada fase awal atau masa inkubasi, pasien yang terinfeksi dapat menghasilkan virus dalam jumlah besar selama aktivitas sehari-hari, yang menimbulkan kesulitan besar untuk mengontrol epidemi.
en-mt: Therefore, in the initial phase or incubation period, infected patients may produce large amounts of virus during their daily activities, which creates great difficulties for epidemic control.

sourceString: However, the transmission of SARS-CoV was considered to occur when the patients are severely ill, while most transmission did not happen at the early phase.
targetString: Namun, transmisi SARS-CoV dipercaya terjadi saat pasien sakit parah dan kebanyakan tidak terjadi pada fase awal.
en-mt: However, transmission of SARS-CoV is believed to occur when the patient is seriously ill and mostly does not occur in the early stages.

sourceString: Thus, the current outbreak of COVID-19 is much more severe and difficult to control than the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: Dengan demikian, wabah COVID-19 saat ini jauh lebih parah dan sulit dikontrol daripada wabah SARS.
en-mt: Thus, the current outbreak of COVID-19 is much more severe and difficult to control than the outbreak of SARS.

sourceString: Great efforts are currently underway in China including the lockdown of Wuhan and surrounding cities and continuous quarantine of almost the entire population in hopes of interrupting the transmission of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Saat ini, upaya besar sedang dilakukan di Tiongkok, yang mencakup karantina wilayah Wuhan dan kota-kota sekitar serta karantina berkelanjutan hampir seluruh populasi dengan harapan memutus transmisi SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Currently, major efforts are being made in China, which include the quarantine of the Wuhan area and surrounding cities and the continuous quarantine of almost the entire population in the hope of stopping the transmission of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Although these actions have been dramatically damaging the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new patients is declining, indicating the slowdown of the epidemic.
targetString: Walaupun tindakan ini sangat merusak ekonomi dan sektor lain dalam negara, jumlah pasien baru menurun, yang mengindikasikan perlambatan epidemi.
en-mt: Although these measures greatly damaged the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new patients decreased, indicating a slowdown in the epidemic.

sourceString: The most optimistic estimate is that the outbreak will end by March and the downswing phase will last for 3-4 months.
targetString: Estimasi paling optimis menyatakan wabah akan berakhir pada bulan Maret dan fase penurunan berlangsung selama 3-4 bulan.
en-mt: The most optimistic estimates state that the outbreak will end in March and the decline phase will last for 3-4 months.

sourceString: However, some other experts are not that optimistic.
targetString: Namun, beberapa pakar lain tidak seoptimis itu.
en-mt: However, some other experts are not so optimistic.

sourceString: Paul Hunter, et al., estimated that COVID-19, which seems substantially more infectious than SARS, will not end in 2020.
targetString: Paul Hunter et al. mengestimasi bahwa COVID-19, yang tampaknya jauh lebih menular daripada SARS, tidak akan berakhir pada tahun 2020.
en-mt: Paul Hunter et al. estimates that COVID-19, which appears to be much more contagious than SARS, will not end in 2020.

sourceString: Ira Longini, et al., established a model to predict the outcome of the epidemic and suggested that SARS-CoV-2 could infect two-thirds of the global population.
targetString: Ira Longini, et al. membuat model untuk memprediksi hasil akhir epidemi dan menyatakan bahwa SARS-CoV-2 dapat menginfeksi dua pertiga populasi global.
en-mt: Ira Longini, et al. created a model to predict the outcome of the epidemic and suggested that SARS-CoV-2 could infect two-thirds of the global population.

sourceString: A Canadian group reported that SARS-CoV-2 was detected in both mid-turbinate and throat swabs of patients who recovered and left the hospital 2 weeks earlier, which indicates that the newly identified virus could become a cyclical episode similar to influenza.
targetString: Grup peneliti Kanada melaporkan bahwa SARS-CoV-2 terdeteksi di usap mid-konka dan tenggorokan pasien yang sudah sembuh dan pulang dari rumah sakit 2 minggu sebelumnya. Hal ini mengindikasikan bahwa virus yang teridentifikasi kembali dapat menjadi episode berulang, mirip dengan influenza.
en-mt: A Canadian research group reported that SARS-CoV-2 was detected in mid-concha and throat swabs of patients who had recovered and were discharged from the hospital 2 weeks previously. This indicates that re-identified viruses may become recurrent episodes, similar to influenza.

sourceString: However, promising signs have occurred in China based on the declining number of new cases, indicating the current strategies might have been working.
targetString: Meski demikian, tanda-tanda menjanjikan terjadi di Tiongkok, jika dilihat berdasarkan menurunnya jumlah kasus baru, yang menunjukkan bahwa strategi saat ini mungkin berhasil.
en-mt: Still, the signs are promising in China, judging by the declining number of new cases, indicating that the current strategy may be working.

sourceString: Ebola was originally predicted to cause up to a million cases with half a million deaths.
targetString: Ebola semula diprediksi akan menyebabkan satu juta kasus dengan setengah juga kematian.
en-mt: Ebola was originally predicted to cause one million cases and half a million deaths.

sourceString: However, via strict quarantine and isolation, the disease has eventually been put under control.
targetString: Namun, dengan karantina dan isolasi ketat, penyakit ini akhirnya dapat dikendalikan.
en-mt: However, with strict quarantine and isolation, the disease was eventually brought under control.

sourceString: It is possible, similar to SARS-CoV, that SARS-CoV-2 might become weaker in infectivity and eventually die down or become a less pathogenic virus co-existent with humans.
targetString: Mungkin juga, mirip dengan SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 melemah kemampuannya menginfeksi dan akhirnya menghilang atau menjadi virus tidak terlalu patogen yang dapat berdampingan dengan manusia.
en-mt: It is also possible that, similar to SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 weakens its ability to infect and eventually disappears or becomes a less pathogenic virus that can coexist with humans.

sourceString: A comparison of the epidemic of COVID-19 with that of SARS and MERS is provided below (Fig. ​(Fig.55).
targetString: Perbandingan epidemi COVID-19 dengan epidemi SARS dan MERS diberikan di bawah ini (Gbr. 5).
en-mt: A comparison of the COVID-19 epidemic with the SARS and MERS epidemics is given below (Fig. 5).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is highly transmittable through coughing or sneezing, and possibly also through direct contact with materials contaminated by the virus.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 sangat mudah ditransmisikan melalui batuk atau bersin, dan mungkin juga melalui kontak langsung dengan bahan yang terkontaminasi oleh virus.
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is very easily transmitted by coughing or sneezing, and possibly also through direct contact with material contaminated with the virus.

sourceString: The virus was also found in feces, which raises a new possibility of feces-to-mouth transmission.
targetString: Virus ini ditemukan juga di feses sehingga memunculkan kemungkinan transmisi baru, yakni transmisi feses-ke-mulut.
en-mt: This virus is also found in faeces, giving rise to a new transmission possibility, namely faecal-to-mouth transmission.

sourceString: A recent study on 138 cases reported that 41% of the cases were possibly caused by nosocomial infections, including 17 patients with other prior diseases and 40 health-care providers.
targetString: Studi baru-baru ini pada 138 kasus melaporkan bahwa 41% kasus mungkin disebabkan oleh infeksi nosokomial, yang mencakup 17 pasien dengan penyakit lain sebelumnya dan 40 penyedia perawatan kesehatan.
en-mt: A recent study of 138 cases reported that 41% of cases were probably due to nosocomial infection, which included 17 patients with other pre-existing illnesses and 40 healthcare providers.

sourceString: Thus, great precaution should be used to protect humans, especially health-care providers, social workers, family members, colleagues, and even bystanders in contact with patients or infected people.
targetString: Karena itu, tindakan pencegahan yang saksama harus dilakukan untuk melindungi manusia, khususnya penyedia perawatan kesehatan, pekerja sosial, anggota keluarga, rekan kerja, dan bahkan orang yang kebetulan berkontak dengan pasien atau orang yang terinfeksi.
en-mt: Because of this, careful precautions must be taken to protect people, especially health care providers, social workers, family members, colleagues, and even people who come into contact with patients or infected persons.

sourceString: The first line of defense that could be used to lower the risk of infection is through wearing face masks; both the use of surgical masks and N95 respirator masks (series # 1860s) helps control the spread of viruses.
targetString: Lini pertahanan pertama yang dapat digunakan untuk menurunkan risiko infeksi adalah melalui penggunaan masker wajah, baik masker bedah maupun masker respirator N95 (nomor seri 1860-an) membantu mengendalikan penyebaran virus.
en-mt: The first line of defense that can be used to reduce the risk of infection is through the use of face masks, both surgical masks and N95 respirator masks (serial number 1860s) help control the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Surgical face masks prevent liquid droplets from a potentially infected individual from traveling through the air or sticking onto surfaces of materials, where they could be passed on to others.
targetString: Masker bedah menjaga agar percikan ludah orang yang berpotensi terinfeksi tidak terikut udara atau menempel pada permukaan bahan, tempat percikan ludah tersebut dapat diteruskan kepada orang lain.
en-mt: Surgical masks keep splashes of potentially infected people from getting airborne or sticking to material surfaces, where they can be passed on to others.

sourceString: However, only N95 (series # 1860s) masks can protect against the inhalation of virions as small as 10 to 80 nm, with only 5% of the virions being able to penetrate completely; SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV in size and both are approximately 85 nm.
targetString: Namun, hanya masker N95 (nomor seri 1860-an) yang dapat melindungi terhadap inhalasi virion dengan ukuran sekecil 10 sampai 80 nm, dengan hanya 5% virion dapat memenetrasi sepenuhnya; SARS-CoV-2 mirip dengan SARS-CoV dalam hal ukuran, keduanya berukuran sekitar 85 nm.
en-mt: However, only the N95 mask (serial number 1860s) protects against inhalation of virions as small as 10 to 80 nm, with only 5% of the virions fully penetrating; SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV in terms of size, both being around 85 nm in size.

sourceString: Since particles can penetrate even five surgical masks stacked together, health-care providers in direct contact with patients must wear N95 (series # 1860s) masks but not surgical masks.
targetString: Karena partikel dapat memenetrasi bahkan lima masker bedah yang ditumpuk menjadi satu, penyedia perawatan kesehatan yang berkontak langsung dengan pasien harus mengenakan N95 (nomor seri 1860-an) dan bukan masker bedah.
en-mt: Because particles can penetrate even five surgical masks stacked together, healthcare providers who are in direct patient contact should wear N95 (serial number 1860s) and not surgical masks.

sourceString: In addition to masks, health-care providers should wear fitted isolation gowns in order to further reduce contact with viruses.
targetString: Selain masker, penyedia perawatan kesehatan harus mengenakan jubah isolasi yang pas untuk lebih mengurangi kontak dengan virus.
en-mt: In addition to masks, health care providers should wear snug-fitting isolation gowns to further reduce contact with the virus.

sourceString: Viruses can also infect an individual through the eyes.
targetString: Virus juga dapat menginfeksi seseorang melalui mata.
en-mt: The virus can also infect a person through the eyes.

sourceString: On January 22, 2020, a doctor was infected with SARS-CoV-2 although he wore an N95 mask; the virus might have entered his body through his inflammatory eyes.
targetString: Pada 22 Januari 2020, seorang dokter terinfeksi SARS-CoV-2 walaupun ia mengenakan masker N95; virus mungkin masuk ke dalam tubuhnya melalui peradangan mata.
en-mt: On January 22, 2020, a doctor was infected with SARS-CoV-2 even though he was wearing an N95 mask; the virus may enter the body through inflammation of the eye.

sourceString: Thus, health-care providers should also wear transparent face shields or goggles while working with patients.
targetString: Karena itu, penyedia perawatan kesehatan juga harus mengenakan perisai wajah tembus pandang atau kacamata selagi bekerja dengan pasien.
en-mt: Because of this, healthcare providers must also wear an invisibility face shield or goggles while working with patients.

sourceString: For the general public in affected or potentially affected areas, it is highly suggested that everybody wash their hands with disinfectant soaps more often than usual, try to stay indoors for self-quarantine and limit contact with potentially infected individuals.
targetString: Untuk masyarakat umum di daerah yang terdampak atau berpotensi terdampak, sangat disarankan bagi setiap orang untuk mencuci tangannya dengan sabun disinfektan lebih sering daripada biasa, mencoba untuk tetap di rumah guna karantina mandiri, dan menghindari kontak dengan orang yang berpotensi terinfeksi.
en-mt: For the general public in affected or potentially affected areas, it is highly recommended for everyone to wash their hands with disinfectant soap more often than usual, try to stay at home for self-quarantine, and avoid contact with potentially infected people.

sourceString: Three feet is considered an appropriate distance for people to stay away from a patient.
targetString: Jarak tiga kaki diyakini sesuai untuk menjaga jarak dari pasien.
en-mt: Three feet is believed to be appropriate to keep the patient away.

sourceString: These actions are effective methods to lower the risk of infection as well as prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: Tindakan-tindakan ini merupakan metode yang efektif untuk mengurangi risiko infeksi serta mencegah penyebaran virus.
en-mt: These measures are an effective method of reducing the risk of infection as well as preventing the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV-2 came as a new virus to the human world, its high homology to SARS-CoV as reported on 7 January 2020 should have caused high alert to China based on her deep memory of the SARS outbreak in 2003.
targetString: Meskipun SARS-CoV-2 merupakan virus baru bagi dunia manusia, homologinya yang tinggi dengan SARS-CoV, sebagaimana dilaporkan pada 7 Januari 2020, mestinya menjadi peringatan besar bagi Tiongkok yang memiliki kenangan kuat terhadap wabah SARS tahun 2003.
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV-2 is a new virus to the human world, its high homology with SARS-CoV, as reported on January 7, 2020, should serve as a big wake-up call to China, which has strong memories of the 2003 SARS outbreak.

sourceString: However, not until 19 January 2020 did the director of the Center of Disease Control of Wuhan comfort the citizens by saying that the novel virus has low contagiousness and limited reproductivity from human to human and that it is not a problem to prevent and contain the disease.
targetString: Meski demikian, pada tanggal 19 Januari 2020, direktur Pusat Pengendalian Penyakit Wuhan menenangkan penduduk dengan mengatakan bahwa virus baru ini memiliki sifat penyebaran rendah dan kapasitas reproduksi terbatas dari manusia ke manusia dan pencegahan serta pembendungan penyakit ini bukanlah suatu masalah.
en-mt: However, on January 19, 2020, the director of the Wuhan Center for Disease Control reassured the population by saying that this new virus has low transmission properties and limited human-to-human reproduction capacity and prevention and containment of this disease is not a problem.

sourceString: This message remarkably relaxed the alarm of the public, especially when the entire country was preparing for the Spring Festival, and the critical time was missed to contain the disease at its minimal scale in Wuhan.
targetString: Pesan ini sangat menenangkan ketakutan masyarakat, terutama saat seluruh negeri sedang mempersiapkan Festival Musim Semi, sehingga waktu yang kritis ini terlewat untuk membendung penyakit yang masih berskala kecil di Wuhan.
en-mt: This message has greatly calmed people's fears, especially when the whole country is preparing for the Spring Festival, so that this critical time has passed to contain the small-scale disease in Wuhan.

sourceString: The disease control agencies in China may take this hard lesson and make critical improvements in the future.
targetString: Badan pengendalian penyakit di Tiongkok hendaknya memetik pelajaran dari hal ini dan membuat perbaikan besar di masa depan.
en-mt: The disease control agency in China should learn from this and make great improvements in the future.

sourceString: For example, these agencies should be (1) more careful when making public announcements as every word counts to citizens and can change their attitude and decisions; (2) more sensitive and reactive to unusual information from clinics rather than waiting for formal reports from doctors or officials; (3) more restrictive to contain a potential epidemic at its early stage rather than attempting to comfort the public; and (4) more often to issue targeted and effective drills to increase the public's awareness about epidemic diseases and to test and improve the response system of the society periodically.
targetString: Misalnya, badan ini seharusnya (1) lebih berhati-hati saat membuat pengumuman publik sebab setiap kata diperhatikan oleh penduduk dan dapat mengubah sikap dan keputusan mereka; (2) lebih sensitif dan reaktif terhadap informasi tidak lazim dari klinik daripada menunggu laporan resmi dari dokter atau petugas yang berwenang; (3) lebih membatasi guna membendung potensi epidemi pada tahap awal, dan bukan mencoba menenangkan publik; dan (4) lebih sering mengeluarkan latihan bertarget dan efektif guna meningkatkan kesadaran publik tentang epidemi penyakit dan menguji serta meningkatkan sistem respons masyarakat secara periodik.
en-mt: For example, the agency should (1) be more careful when making public announcements because every word is noticed by citizens and can change their attitudes and decisions; (2) more sensitive and reactive to unusual information from the clinic than waiting for an official report from a doctor or authorized officer; (3) more restrictive in order to stem the potential for an epidemic at an early stage, rather than trying to appease the public; and (4) more frequently issue targeted and effective exercises to increase public awareness of disease epidemics and periodically test and improve community response systems.

sourceString: The outbreak of COVID-19 caused by the novel virus SARS-CoV-2 started in the end of December 2019.
targetString: Wabah COVID-19 disebabkan oleh virus baru SARS-CoV-2 yang mulai merebak pada akhir Desember 2019.
en-mt: The COVID-19 outbreak was caused by the new SARS-CoV-2 virus which began to spread in late December 2019.

sourceString: In less than two months, it has spread all over China and near 50 other countries globally at the time of this writing.
targetString: Dalam waktu kurang dari 2 bulan, wabah telah menyebar ke seluruh Tiongkok dan lebih dari 50 negara di dunia pada saat penulisan tinjauan ini.
en-mt: In less than 2 months, the outbreak has spread across China and over 50 countries around the world at the time of writing this review.

sourceString: Since the virus is very similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms are also similar between COVID-19 and SARS, the outbreak of COVID-19 has created a sense of SARS recurring.
targetString: Karena virus ini sangat mirip dengan SARS-CoV dan gejala COVID-19 dan SARS juga serupa, wabah COVID-19 memberi kesan seperti wabah SARS terulang kembali.
en-mt: Because this virus is very similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms of COVID-19 and SARS are also similar, the COVID-19 outbreak gives the impression that the SARS outbreak is repeating itself.

sourceString: However, there are some remarkable differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are essential for containing the epidemic and treating the patients.
targetString: Namun, ada beberapa perbedaan jelas antara COVID-19 dan SARS, yang sangat penting untuk membendung epidemi dan menangani pasien.
en-mt: However, there are some clear differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are very important to stem the epidemic and treat patients.

sourceString: COVID-19 affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women, and the severity and death rate are also higher in elderly individual than in youth.
targetString: COVID-19 lebih banyak mengenai lansia daripada orang muda dan lebih banyak mengenai pria daripada wanita, serta tingkat kematian juga lebih tinggi pada lansia dibandingkan orang muda.
en-mt: COVID-19 affects more elderly people than young people and more men than women, and the death rate is also higher for the elderly than for the young.

sourceString: SARS has higher mortality than COVID-19 (10.91% versus 1.44%).
targetString: Mortalitas SARS lebih tinggi daripada mortalitas COVID-19 (10,91% dibanding 1,44%).
en-mt: SARS mortality was higher than COVID-19 mortality (10.91% compared to 1.44%).

sourceString: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus even when they are symptomless whereas SARS patients do so usually when they are severely ill, which causes much greater difficulty to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.
targetString: Pasien COVID-19 mentransmisikan virus walaupun saat mereka tanpa gejala, sementara pasien SARS biasanya mentransmisikan virus saat mereka sakit parah. Hal ini membuat kesulitan yang lebih besar dalam membendung penyebaran COVID-19 dibandingkan SARS.
en-mt: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus even when they are asymptomatic, while SARS patients usually transmit the virus when they are seriously ill. This makes it even more difficult to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.

sourceString: This partially explains why SARS-CoV-2 spread much faster and broader than SARS-CoV.
targetString: Hal ini menjelaskan sebagian alasan SARS-CoV-2 menyebar lebih cepat dan lebih luas daripada SARS-CoV.
en-mt: This partially explains why SARS-CoV-2 spread faster and more widely than SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The regular RNA assay for SARS-CoV-2 can be negative in some COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Asai RNA rutin untuk memeriksa SARS-CoV-2 dapat memberi hasil negatif pada beberapa pasien COVID-19.
en-mt: Routine RNA assays for testing for SARS-CoV-2 can give negative results in some COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: On the other hand, cured patients can be positive for the virus again.
targetString: Di sisi lain, pasien yang sudah sembuh dapat memberi hasil positif lagi terhadap pemeriksaan virus.
en-mt: On the other hand, patients who have recovered may test positive for the virus again.

sourceString: These findings dramatically increase the risk of virus spreading.
targetString: Temuan ini sangat meningkatkan risiko penyebaran virus.
en-mt: These findings greatly increase the risk of spreading the virus.

sourceString: Given such rapid progress in research on COVID-19, several critical issues remain to be solved, as follows:
targetString: Dengan begitu cepatnya kemajuan penelitian COVID-19, beberapa masalah penting masih harus diselesaikan, yaitu:
en-mt: With the rapid progress of COVID-19 research, several important issues still need to be resolved, namely:

sourceString: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?
targetString: Dari mana SARS-CoV-2 berasal?
en-mt: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?

sourceString: Although 96% genetic homolog was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from bats.
targetString: Walaupun ditemukan homologi genetik sebesar 96% antara SARS-CoV-2 dan dua CoV mirip-SARS kelelawar, kita masih belum dapat menyimpulkan bahwa SARS-CoV-2 berasal dari kelelawar.
en-mt: Although a genetic homology of 96% was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat-like SARS-CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 originated in bats.

sourceString: What animal was the intermediate species to transmit the virus from the original host, say bats, to humans?
targetString: Hewan apa yang menjadi spesies perantara untuk mentranmisikan virus dari inang asal, katakanlah kelelawar, kepada manusia?
en-mt: What animal is the intermediate species for transmitting the virus from the original host, say bats, to humans?

sourceString: Without knowing answers to #1 and 2, we cannot efficiently cut the transmission, and the outbreak can relapse at any time.
targetString: Tanpa mengetahui jawaban nomor 1 dan 2, kita tidak dapat memutus transmisi dengan efektif dan wabah dapat merebak kembali setiap saat.
en-mt: Without knowing the answers to numbers 1 and 2, we cannot effectively cut off transmission and the outbreak could re-emerge at any time.

sourceString: Although molecular modeling and biochemical assays have demonstrated that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how exactly does the virus enter the airway cells and cause subsequent pathological changes?
targetString: Walaupun pemodelan molekuler dan asai biokimia menunjukkan bahwa SARS-CoV-2 berikatan dengan ACE2, bagaimana tepatnya virus masuk ke sel saluran napas dan mengakibatkan perubahan patologis selanjutnya?
en-mt: Although molecular modeling and biochemical assays suggest that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how exactly does the virus enter airway cells and cause subsequent pathological changes?

sourceString: Does the virus also bind ACE2-expressing cells in other organs?
