targetString: Studi ini mengadopsi metode penyusunan yang berbeda dan kurasi manual untuk menghasilkan sekuens genom parsial yang terdiri dari sekitar 86,3% genom virus lengkap.
en-mt: This study adopted a different assembly method and manual curation to generate a partial genome sequence comprising approximately 86.3% of the complete viral genome.

sourceString: We cannot exclude the possibility that pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kita tidak dapat mengesampingkan kemungkinan trenggiling sebagai salah satu inang hewan perantara SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: We cannot rule out the possibility that pangolins are one of the intermediate animal hosts for SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, currently there is no evidence in support of a direct pangolin origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Namun, saat ini belum ada bukti yang mendukung SARS-CoV-2 berasal langsung dari trenggiling karena perbedaan sekuens antara SARS-CoV-2 dan beta-CoV kerabat-SARS-CoV-2 tenggiling.
en-mt: However, there is currently no evidence to support that SARS-CoV-2 originated directly from pangolins due to sequence differences between SARS-CoV-2 and the beta-CoV relative-SARS-CoV-2 pangolins.

sourceString: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than that between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Selain itu, jarak antara SARS-CoV-2 dan RaTG13 malah lebih dekat dibanding jarak antara SARS-CoV-2 dan beta-CoV kerabat-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even closer than the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and its relative beta-CoV-SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.
targetString: Jalur evolusioner SARS-CoV-2 di kelelawar, trenggiling, dan mamalia lain masih harus ditetapkan.
en-mt: The evolutionary path of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.

sourceString: Whereas the highest sequence homology has been found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share the highest genome-wide sequence homology.
targetString: Walaupun homologi sekuens tertinggi pada RBD ditemukan antara SARS-CoV-2 dan beta-CoV kerabat-SARS-CoV-2 trenggiling, SARS-CoV-2 dan RaTG13 berbagi homologi tertinggi di tingkat sekuens seluruh genom.
en-mt: Although the highest sequence homology in RBD was found between SARS-CoV-2 and the pangolin beta-CoV relative-SARS-CoV-2, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share the highest homology at the whole genome sequence level.

sourceString: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.
targetString: Terlalu berspekulasi jika dikatakan bahwa tingginya tingkat kemiripan antara RBD beta-CoV kerabat-SARS-CoV-2 trenggiling dan SARS-CoV-2 digerakkan oleh evolusi konvergen yang selektivitasnya dimediasi.
en-mt: It is too speculative to say that the high degree of similarity between the RBD beta-CoV of the pangolin-relative SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by convergent evolution in which selectivity is mediated.

sourceString: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.
targetString: Hipotesis tandingan mendukung rekombinasi antara beta-CoV kerabat-SARS-CoV-2 trenggiling dan RaTG13 di spesies hewan liar ketiga.
en-mt: The counter hypothesis supports recombination between the pangolin beta-CoV relative-SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.

sourceString: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-CoVs.
targetString: Sebagai faktor penggerak evolusi, rekombinasi banyak terjadi di antara beta-CoV.
en-mt: As a driving factor for evolution, recombination occurs a lot among beta-CoV.

sourceString: The jury is still out on the immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Para peneliti masih belum dapat memutuskan mengenai asal zoonotik SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Researchers still cannot decide on the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.
targetString: Selain HCoV yang sangat patogenik, asal zoonotik HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63, dan HCoV-HKU1 juga telah diteliti.
en-mt: In addition to the highly pathogenic HCoV, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63, and HCoV-HKU1 has also been investigated.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E might have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.
targetString: Bukti filogenetik mengindikasikan bahwa HCoV-NL63 dan HCoV-229E mungkin berasal dari CoV kelelawar, sementara virus induk HCoV-OC43 dan HCoV-HKU1 telah ditemukan di hewan pengerat.
en-mt: Phylogenetic evidence indicates that HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E may have originated from bat CoV, while the parent viruses HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.

sourceString: It has been reported that a bat CoV termed ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolored bat displayed close relationship with HCoV-NL63.
targetString: Dilaporkan bahwa CoV kelelawar bernama ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) yang dideteksi di kelelawar tiga warna Amerika Utara menunjukkan kekerabatan dekat dengan HCoV-NL63.
en-mt: It was reported that a bat CoV named ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolor bats showed close kinship with HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, termed Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, while camelids have also been suspected as its intermediate host.
targetString: Di sisi lain, HCoV-229E secara genetis berkerabat dengan CoV kelelawar lainnya, dengan nama Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, yang terdeteksi di Ghana, dengan Camelidae diduga juga merupakan inang perantaranya.
en-mt: On the other hand, HCoV-229E is genetically related to another bat CoV, with the name Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, with Camelidae presumably also being the intermediate host.

sourceString: For clarity, the current knowledge on animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure ​1 and Table 2.
targetString: Agar lebih jelas, pengetahuan saat ini tentang asal hewan HCoV yang diketahui diringkas di Gambar 1 dan Tabel 2.
en-mt: For clarity, current knowledge of known animal origin of HCoV is summarized in Figure 1 and Table 2.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of HCoVs in the history.
targetString: Analisis filogenetik telah memberikan bukti kejadian transmisi antarspesies HCoV dalam sejarah.
en-mt: Phylogenetic analyzes have provided evidence of historical events of interspecies transmission of HCoV.

sourceString: When HCoV-OC43 crossed species to infect humans from domestic livestock around 1890, a pandemic of respiratory infection was recorded.
targetString: Pada sekitar tahun 1890, saat HCoV-OC43 melintas spesies dari hewan ternak untuk menginfeksi manusia, tercatat adanya pandemi infeksi pernapasan.
en-mt: In about 1890, when HCoV-OC43 crossed species from livestock to infect humans, a respiratory infection pandemic was recorded.

sourceString: The interspecies transmission history of HCoV-229E is less clear.
targetString: Sejarah transmisi HCoV-229E antarspesies tidak terlalu jelas.
en-mt: The history of HCoV-229E transmission between species is not very clear.

sourceString: Bat alpha-CoVs closely related to HCoV-229E have been found.
targetString: Alfa-CoV kelelawar yang berkerabat dengan HCoV-229E telah ditemukan.
en-mt: Bat alpha-CoV related to HCoV-229E has been discovered.

sourceString: Between them there is an alpaca alpha-CoV.
targetString: Di antara keduanya, ada alfa-CoV alpaka.
en-mt: Between the two, there is the alpaca alpha-CoV.

sourceString: Several lines of evidence support the transmission of virus from bats to humans directly.
targetString: Beberapa bukti mendukung transmisi virus langsung dari kelelawar kepada manusia.
en-mt: Some evidence supports direct transmission of the virus from bats to humans.

sourceString: First, humans but not alpacas might have contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.
targetString: Pertama, manusia, bukan alpaka, yang mungkin berkontak dengan kelelawar dalam relung ekologi bersama.
en-mt: First, humans, not alpacas, may come into contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.

sourceString: Instead, humans have close contact with alpacas.
targetString: Sebaliknya, manusia memiliki kontak erat dengan alpaka.
en-mt: In contrast, humans have close contact with alpacas.

sourceString: Second, HCoV-229E-related bat alpha-CoVs are diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, whereas alpaca alpha-CoV caused an outbreak of respiratory disease in infected animals.
targetString: Kedua, alfa-CoV kelelawar yang berkerabat dengan HCoV-229E ada bermacam-macam dan nonpatogenik di kelelawar, sementara alfa-CoV alpaka menyebabkan wabah penyakit pernapasan pada hewan yang terinfeksi.
en-mt: Second, bat alpha-CoV, which is related to HCoV-229E, is diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, while alpaca alpha-CoV causes respiratory disease outbreaks in infected animals.

sourceString: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV has not been found in feral animals.
targetString: Terakhir, alfa-CoV alpaka tidak ditemukan di hewan feral.
en-mt: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV is not found in feral animals.

sourceString: Thus, the possibility cannot be excluded that alpacas obtain the HCoV-229E-related alpha-CoV from humans.
targetString: Karena itu, kemungkinan alpaka mendapatkan alfa-CoV kerabat-HCoV-229E dari manusia tidak dapat dikesampingkan.
en-mt: Therefore, the possibility of alpacas acquiring the alpha-CoV kin-HCoV-229E from humans cannot be ruled out.

sourceString: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.
targetString: Faktanya, kelelawar merupakan sumber langsung untuk virus patogenik manusia, yang mencakup virus rabies, virus Ebola, virus Nipah, dan virus Hendra.
en-mt: In fact, bats are a direct source of human pathogenic viruses, which include rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus, and Hendra virus.

sourceString: It is therefore not too surprising that bats might transmit HCoV-229E to humans directly.
targetString: Karena itu, tidak terlalu mengherankan bahwa kelelawar mungkin langsung mentransmisikan HCoV-229E ke manusia.
en-mt: Therefore, it is not too surprising that bats might directly transmit HCoV-229E to humans.

sourceString: Alternatively, whereas bat alpha-CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedary camels might serve as intermediate hosts that transmit viruses to humans, exactly as in the case of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Kemungkinan lainnya, sementara alfa-CoV kelelawar berfungsi sebagai lungkang gen HCoV-229E, alpaka dan unta Arab mungkin berfungsi sebagai inang perantara yang mentransmisikan virus kepada manusia, persis seperti kasus MERS-CoV.
en-mt: Alternatively, while bat alpha-CoV functions as the HCoV-229E gene pool, alpacas and Arabian camels may serve as intermediate hosts that transmit the virus to humans, much like the case of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: MERS-CoV serves as an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to dromedary camels and from dromedary camels to humans.
targetString: MERS-CoV merupakan contoh yang sangat baik untuk transmisi antarspesies dari kelelawar ke unta Arab dan dari unta Arab ke manusia.
en-mt: MERS-CoV is an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to Arabian camels and from Arabian camels to humans.

sourceString: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats is known at its initial identification and has also been strengthened by subsequent findings.
targetString: Asal evolusioner MERS-CoV dari kelelawar diketahui pada identifikasi awal virus dan juga diperkuat dengan temuan setelahnya.
en-mt: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats was known in the initial identification of the virus and was also confirmed by later findings.

sourceString: It is obvious that bats provide a rich pool of virus species for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.
targetString: Jelas bahwa kelelawar merupakan lungkang spesies virus yang kaya untuk pertukaran fragmen genetik antarspesies dan transmisi antarspesies.
en-mt: It is clear that bats constitute a species-rich viral pool for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.

sourceString: Longevity, densely packed colonies, close social interaction and strong ability to fly are all favourable conditions for bats to be an ideal 'virus spreader'.
targetString: Umur yang panjang, koloni yang tersusun rapat, interaksi sosial yang erat, dan kemampuan terbang yang kuat, semua adalah kondisi yang mendukung bagi kelelawar untuk menjadi 'penyebar virus' yang ideal.
en-mt: Long lifespan, tightly packed colonies, close social interaction, and strong flight ability are all favorable conditions for bats to become ideal 'virus spreaders'.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been introduced to dromedary camels for decades.
targetString: Di sisi lain, MERS-CoV sudah masuk ke unta Arab selama puluhan tahun.
en-mt: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been getting into Arabian camels for decades.

sourceString: It is well adapted to these camels that have turned from an intermediate host to a stable and natural reservoir host.
targetString: Virus ini telah beradaptasi dengan unta yang telah berubah dari inang perantara menjadi inang reservoir yang stabil dan alami.
en-mt: The virus has adapted to camels which have changed from an intermediate host to a stable and natural reservoir host.

sourceString: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease and maintains a relatively low mutation rate in these animals.
targetString: MERS-CoV menyebabkan penyakit yang sangat ringan dan mempertahankan laju mutasi yang relatif rendah dalam hewan ini.
en-mt: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease and maintains a relatively low mutation rate in this animal.

sourceString: Its sporadic transmission to humans is an accident and humans remain a dead-end host of MERS-CoV as its transmission cannot be sustained.
targetString: Transmisinya yang sporadik ke manusia terjadi secara kebetulan dan manusia tetap menjadi inang akhir bagi MERS-CoV karena transmisinya tidak bisa berkelanjutan.
en-mt: Its sporadic transmission to humans occurs incidentally and humans remain the final host for MERS-CoV because transmission cannot be sustained.

sourceString: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if there is any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.
targetString: Tidak seperti peran unta dalam transmisi MERS-CoV, peran trenggiling, jika ada, dalam transmisi SARS-CoV-2 berbeda.
en-mt: Unlike the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.

sourceString: Particularly, pangolin beta-CoVs are highly pathogenic in pangolins.
targetString: Terutama, beta-CoV trenggiling bersifat sangat patogenik dalam trenggiling.
en-mt: In particular, pangolin beta-CoV is highly pathogenic in pangolins.

sourceString: They might be a dead-end host for SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Tenggiling mungkin merupakan inang akhir untuk beta-CoV kerabat SARS-CoV-2, mirip dengan musang dalam kasus SARS-CoV.
en-mt: Pangolins may be the final host for the relative beta-CoV of SARS-CoV-2, similar to the civet in the case of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Several possibilities for interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans have to be ruled in or ruled out in future studies.
targetString: Di studi-studi mendatang, beberapa kemungkinan transmisi SARS-CoV-2 antarspesies dari hewan ke manusia harus diperhitungkan atau dikesampingkan.
en-mt: In future studies, several possibilities for interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans must be considered or ruled out.

sourceString: First, bats could be the reservoir host of a SARS-CoV-2-related virus almost identical to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Pertama, kelelawar bisa saja merupakan inang reservoir untuk virus kerabat SARS-CoV-2 yang hampir identik dengan SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: First, bats could be reservoir hosts for a relative of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which is almost identical to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Humans might share the ecological niche with bats through butchering or coal mining.
targetString: Manusia dapat berbagi relung ekologis dengan kelelawar melalui penyembelihan atau pertambangan batu bara.
en-mt: Humans may share ecological niches with bats through slaughter or coal mining.

sourceString: Second, pangolins could be one of intermediate amplifying host to which a SARS-CoV-2-related virus had been newly introduced.
targetString: Kedua, trenggiling bisa saja merupakan salah satu inang pengamplifikasi perantara untuk virus kerabat SARS-CoV-2 yang baru masuk.
en-mt: Second, pangolins could be one of the intermediate amplifying hosts for the newly introduced SARS-CoV-2 relative virus.

sourceString: Humans contract the virus through butchering and consumption of game meat.
targetString: Manusia mendapat virus melalui penyembelihan dan konsumsi daging buruan.
en-mt: Humans get the virus through the slaughter and consumption of game meat.

sourceString: It is possible that many mammals including domestic animals are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Mungkin saja, banyak mamalia, yang mencakup hewan peliharaan, rentan terhadap SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: It is possible that many mammals, including pets, are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: A survey of domestic and wild animals for antibodies is warranted.
targetString: Survei antibodi terhadap hewan peliharaan dan hewan liar perlu dilakukan.
en-mt: It is necessary to carry out antibody surveys for domestic and wild animals.

sourceString: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 might have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.
targetString: Ketiga, seperti disebutkan di atas, rekombinasi dan adaptasi SARS-CoV-2 mungkin terjadi dalam spesies ketiga yang berkontak baik dengan kelelawar maupun trenggiling.
en-mt: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 may occur in third species that come into contact with both bats and pangolins.

sourceString: The search for the animal origins of SARS-CoV-2 is still on.
targetString: Pencarian asal hewan SARS-CoV-2 masih berlangsung.
en-mt: The search for the animal origin of SARS-CoV-2 is still ongoing.

sourceString: Apart from different types of the animal hosts, three major factors on the viral side are also important in facilitating CoVs to cross species barriers.
targetString: Terlepas dari berbagai jenis inang hewan, tiga faktor utama dari sisi virus juga penting untuk memudahkan CoV melintasi penghalang spesies.
en-mt: Apart from the different types of animal hosts, three main factors from the viral side are also important for facilitating CoV to cross the species barrier.

sourceString: First of all, their relatively high mutation rates in RNA replication.
targetString: Pertama, laju mutasinya yang relatif tinggi dalam replikasi RNA.
en-mt: Firstly, its relatively high mutation rate in RNA replication.

sourceString: In comparison to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs could be regarded as “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate being ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to novel hosts.
targetString: Dibandingkan dengan virus RNA beruntai tunggal lain, perkiraan laju mutasi CoV dapat dianggap “sedang” hingga “tinggi” dengan laju substitusi rata-rata sebesar ~10-4 per tahun per tapak, tergantung fase adaptasi CoV terhadap inang baru.
en-mt: Compared to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rate of CoV can be considered “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate of ~10-4 per year per site, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to the new host.

sourceString: CoVs have a proof-reading exoribonuclease, deletion of which results in exceedingly high mutability and attenuation or even inviability.
targetString: CoV memiliki eksoribonuklease pengoreksi, penghapusan yang mengakibatkan mutabilitas yang sangat tinggi, atenuasi, atau bahkan inviabilitas.
en-mt: CoV has a correcting exoribonuclease, the deletion of which results in very high mutability, attenuation, or even inviability.

sourceString: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Hal yang menarik, analog nukleotida Remdesivir diketahui menekan replikasi CoV melalui inhibisi eksoribunuklease ini dan RNA polimerase tergantung-RNA.
en-mt: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribunuclease and RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.

sourceString: Remdesivir is one of most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.
targetString: Remdesivir adalah salah satu agen anti-SARS-CoV-2 paling menjanjikan yang akan diuji dalam percobaan klinis.
en-mt: Remdesivir is one of the most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.

sourceString: Nevertheless, mutation rates of CoVs are about a million times higher than those of their hosts.
targetString: Meski demikian, laju mutasi CoV sekitar sejuta kali lebih tinggi daripada laju mutasi inangnya.
en-mt: However, the mutation rate of CoV is about a million times higher than that of its host.

sourceString: In addition, mutation rate is often high when CoVs are not well adapted to the host.
targetString: Selain itu, laju mutasi sering kali tinggi saat CoV belum beradaptasi dengan inang.
en-mt: In addition, the mutation rate is often high when the CoV has not yet adapted to the host.

sourceString: Compared to SARS-CoV with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is apparently lower, suggestive of a higher level of adaptation to humans.
targetString: Dibandingkan SARS-CoV yang memiliki laju mutasi tinggi, laju mutasi SARS-CoV-2 sebenarnya lebih rendah, mengisyaratkan tingkat adaptasi yang lebih tinggi dengan manusia.
en-mt: Compared to SARS-CoV, which has a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is actually lower, indicating a higher adaptation rate with humans.

sourceString: Presumably, it has already been adapted to another host close to humans.
targetString: Kemungkinan, SARS-CoV-2 telah beradaptasi dengan inang lain yang berkerabat dekat dengan manusia.
en-mt: It is possible that SARS-CoV-2 has adapted to other hosts that are closely related to humans.

sourceString: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.
targetString: Selain SARS-CoV-2, hal ini juga berlaku pada MERS-CoV yang telah beradaptasi dengan unta Arab.
en-mt: Apart from SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV which has adapted to the Arabian camel.

sourceString: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift would render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective quickly.
targetString: Secara teoritis, kecil kemungkinan bahwa hanyutan genetik akan cepat membuat vaksin dan agen antivirus terhadap SARS-CoV-2 menjadi tidak efektif.
en-mt: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift will quickly render vaccines and antiviral agents against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective.

sourceString: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombination, thereby increasing the probability for interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of novel CoVs when the conditions become appropriate.
targetString: Kedua, genom RNA yang besar dalam CoV memberi kefleksibelan ekstra dalam modifikasi genom, untuk mutasi dan rekombinasi, sehingga meningkatkan probabilitas ko-evolusi antarspesies, yang menguntungkan untuk munculnya CoV baru saat kondisi sesuai.
en-mt: Second, the large RNA genome in CoV affords extra flexibility in genome modification, for mutation and recombination, thereby increasing the probability of interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of new CoVs when conditions are suitable.

sourceString: This is supported by the copious unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3′ end of the genome.
targetString: Hal ini didukung oleh banyaknya rangka baca terbuka unik dan fungsi protein yang disandi ke arah ujung 3′ genom.
en-mt: This is supported by the many unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3′ end of the genome.

sourceString: Third, CoVs randomly and frequently switch templates during RNA replication through a unique “copy-choice” mechanism.
targetString: Ketiga, CoV kerap berganti templat secara acak selama replikasi RNA melalui mekanisme “pilih-salin” unik.
en-mt: Third, CoV frequently switches templates randomly during RNA replication via a unique “select-copy” mechanism.

sourceString: In a host that serves as the mixing vessel, strand switching occurs frequently during CoV RNA transcription.
targetString: Dalam inang yang berfungsi sebagai wadah pencampuran, peralihan untai kerap terjadi selama transkripsi RNA CoV.
en-mt: In hosts that serve as mixing vessels, strand switching frequently occurs during CoV RNA transcription.

sourceString: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic RNAs could recombine to generate new CoVs.
targetString: RNA lengkap dan subgenomik yang sangat homolog dapat mengalami rekombinasi untuk membentuk CoV baru.
en-mt: Highly homologous complete and subgenomic RNAs can undergo recombination to form new CoVs.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in both HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.
targetString: Bukti filogenetik rekombinasi alami telah ditemukan pada HCoV-HKU1 dan HCoV-OC43, begitu pula pada CoV hewan seperti SL-CoV kelelawar dan CoV-HKU9 kelelawar.
en-mt: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as in animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and bat CoV-HKU9.

sourceString: Virus-host interaction in relation to transmission
targetString: Interaksi virus-inang dalam kaitannya dengan transmisi
en-mt: Virus-host interactions in relation to transmission

sourceString: Besides three viral factors stated above, viral interaction with host receptor is another key factor influential on interspecies transmission.
targetString: Selain tiga faktor virus yang disebutkan di atas, interaksi virus dengan reseptor inang adalah faktor utama lain yang memengaruhi transmisi antarspesies.
en-mt: In addition to the three viral factors mentioned above, the interaction of viruses with host receptors is another major factor affecting interspecies transmission.

sourceString: Herein, recombination of SARS-CoV is taken as a typical example, which also showed evidence of positive selection during interspecies transmission events.
targetString: Di sini, rekombinasi SARS-CoV dianggap sebagai contoh khas, yang juga menunjukkan bukti seleksi positif selama kejadian transmisi antarspesies.
en-mt: Here, SARS-CoV recombination is considered as a typical example, which also shows evidence of positive selection during events of interspecies transmission.

sourceString: Based on the comparative analysis between isolates of human and civet SARS-CoVs, SARS-CoV is thought to undergo rapid adaptation in different hosts, particularly with mutations at the RBD of the S protein.
targetString: Berdasarkan analisis komparatif antara isolat SARS-CoV manusia dan musang, SARS-CoV diduga mengalami adaptasi cepat dalam berbagai inang, khususnya dengan mutasi pada RBD protein S.
en-mt: Based on a comparative analysis between human and ferret SARS-CoV isolates, SARS-CoV is thought to have experienced rapid adaptation in various hosts, particularly with mutations in the S protein RBD.

sourceString: Generally, the RBD in the S protein of a CoV interacts with the cellular receptor and is intensely selected by the host antibody response.
targetString: Umumnya, RBD protein S CoV berinteraksi dengan reseptor sel dan secara intensif menjadi target respons antibodi inang.
en-mt: Generally, CoV S protein RBD interacts with cell receptors and intensively becomes the target of host antibody responses.

sourceString: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is in the 318th to 510th amino acids on the S1 fragment, which binds to the human ACE2 as well as its coreceptors for viral entry.
targetString: Pada SARS-CoV, RBD adalah asam amino ke-318 hingga ke-510 pada fragmen S1, yang berikatan dengan ACE2 manusia serta koreseptornya sebagai jalan masuk virus.
en-mt: In SARS-CoV, RBD is the 318th to 510th amino acid in the S1 fragment, which binds to human ACE2 and its coreceptors as a gateway for the virus.

sourceString: The RBD of SARS-CoV is capable of recognizing the ACE2 receptors of various animals, including bat, civet, mouse and raccoon dog, allowing interspecies transmission of the virus.
targetString: RBD SARS-CoV memiliki kemampuan untuk mengenali reseptor ACE2 berbagai hewan, yang mencakup kelelawar, musang, tikus, dan anjing rakun, sehingga memungkinkan transmisi virus antarspesies.
en-mt: The SARS-CoV RBD has the ability to recognize the ACE2 receptor of various animals, which includes bats, raccoons, rats and raccoon dogs, thereby enabling interspecies transmission of the virus.

sourceString: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to be different from human and civet viral isolates in the RBD and 4 of them locate in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Sebenarnya, hanya 6 residu asam amino yang diamati berbeda antara isolat virus manusia dan musang di RBD dan 4 di antaranya berlokasi di motif pengikatan reseptor untuk interaksi dengan reseptor ACE2.
en-mt: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to differ between human and civet virus isolates in RBD and 4 of these were located in the receptor binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: Civet SARS-CoV has K479N and S487T mutations in its RBD, which might increase the affinity of the interaction of spike protein with human ACE2 receptor.
targetString: SARS-CoV musang memiliki mutasi K479N dan S487T di RBD-nya, yang mungkin meningkatkan afinitas interaksi protein tonjolan dengan reseptor ACE2 manusia.
en-mt: The ferret SARS-CoV has mutations K479N and S487T in its RBD, which may increase the interaction affinity of the spike protein with the human ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions might be critical to viral adaption to humans.
targetString: Dengan kata lain, dua substitusi asam amino ini mungkin sangat penting untuk adaptasi virus ke manusia.
en-mt: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions may be critical for the adaptation of viruses to humans.

sourceString: It is noteworthy that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptor with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Perlu dicatat bahwa SARS-CoV-2 memiliki reseptor sel yang sama dengan SARS-CoV.
en-mt: It should be noted that SARS-CoV-2 has the same cell receptors as SARS-CoV.

sourceString: A 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implicates that the binding affinity of its S protein with human ACE2 might have altered.
targetString: Perbedaan sebesar 30% antara SARS-CoV-2 dan SARS-CoV di unit S1 protein S mengimplikasikan afinitas pengikatan protein S dengan ACE2 manusia kemungkinan sudah berubah.
en-mt: The 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implies that the binding affinity of the S protein to human ACE2 may have changed.

sourceString: Indeed, a cryo-EM study indicates a 10- to 20-fold higher affinity of this binding than that between human ACE2 and SARS-CoV S protein.
targetString: Bahkan, sebuah studi cryo-EM menunjukkan afinitas pengikatan ACE2 manusia dan protein S SARS-CoV-2 10 hingga 20 kali lebih tinggi dibandingkan afinitas antara ACE2 manusia dan protein S SARS-CoV.
en-mt: In fact, a cryo-EM study showed the binding affinity of human ACE2 and SARS-CoV-2 S protein 10 to 20 times higher than the affinity between human ACE2 and SARS-CoV S protein.

sourceString: It will also be of interest to determine whether any other coreceptor might be required for SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
targetString: Hal yang juga penting untuk diketahui adalah apakah ada koreseptor lain yang mungkin dibutuhkan untuk transmisi SARS-CoV-2..
en-mt: It is also important to know whether there are other co-receptors that may be needed for the transmission of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Intriguingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but with a different part of S.
targetString: Hal yang menarik, HCoV-NL63 juga berikatan dengan ACE2, tetapi dengan bagian yang berbeda pada S.
en-mt: Interestingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2, but with a different site on S.

sourceString: There exist many other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.
targetString: Ada banyak reseptor HCoV lain, seperti aminopeptidase N untuk HCoV-229E dan asam sialat 9-O-terasetilasi untuk HCoV-OC43.
en-mt: There are many other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.

sourceString: They might also account for successful adaptation of these CoVs in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.
targetString: Reseptor-reseptor ini mungkin juga berperan dalam keberhasilan adaptasi CoV ini dalam manusia setelah transmisi antarspesies dari inang hewannya.
en-mt: These receptors may also play a role in the successful adaptation of CoV in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.

sourceString: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of interspecies transmission of HCoVs is also governed by other host dependency and restriction factors.
targetString: Selain reseptor sel, hasil akhir transmisi HCoV antarspesies juga diatur oleh faktor ketergantungan dan pembatasan inang lainnya.
en-mt: In addition to cell receptors, the ultimate outcome of interspecies transmission of HCoV is also regulated by other host dependency and restriction factors.

sourceString: The divergence of these host proteins between humans and natural reservoir hosts of HCoVs such as bats, dromedary camels and rodents might constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.
targetString: Perbedaan protein inang ini antara manusia dan inang reservoir alami, seperti kelelawar, unta Arab, dan hewan pengerat dapat menjadi penghalang untuk transmisi antarspesies.
en-mt: This host protein difference between humans and natural reservoir hosts, such as bats, Arabian camels, and rodents may be a barrier to interspecies transmission.

sourceString: HCoVs have to usurp host dependency factors and subvert host restriction factors for a successful interspecies transmission.
targetString: HCoV harus mengambil alih faktor ketergantungan inang dan membobol faktor pembatasan inang agar berhasil dalam transmisi antarspesies.
en-mt: HCoV must take over host-dependent factors and break through host-restrictive factors to be successful in interspecies transmission.

sourceString: In this regard, molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.
targetString: Dalam hal ini, penentu molekuler di bidang interaksi virus-inang yang penting ini masih harus diidentifikasi dan dicirikan.
en-mt: In this regard, molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.

sourceString: An unbiased genome-wide screening of host dependency and restriction factors for SARS-CoV-2 using the state-of-the-art technology of CRISPR might be fruitful.
targetString: Penapisan seluruh genom tak bias untuk melihat faktor ketergantungan dan pembatasan inang SARS-CoV-2 menggunakan teknologi CRISPR tercanggih mungkin dapat bermanfaat.
en-mt: Unbiased whole-genome screening for SARS-CoV-2 host dependency and restriction factors using state-of-the-art CRISPR technology may be useful.

sourceString: Emergence of novel HCoVs: back to ground zero
targetString: Munculnya HCoV baru: kembali ke awal wabah
en-mt: Emergence of new HCoV: returning to the beginning of the outbreak

sourceString: The diversity of bat CoVs provides ample opportunities for the emergence of novel HCoVs.
targetString: Keragaman CoV kelelawar memberi peluang besar untuk munculnya HCoV baru.
en-mt: The diversity of bat CoVs provides a great opportunity for the emergence of new HCoVs.

sourceString: In this sense, bat CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoVs.
targetString: Dalam hal ini, CoV kelelawar berfungsi sebagai lungkang gen HCoV.
en-mt: In this case, bat CoV serves as the HCoV gene pool.

sourceString: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive HCoV evolution and serve as two important steps in this process.
targetString: Selain itu, mutasi cepat dan rekombinasi genetik juga menggerakkan evolusi HCoV dan berfungsi sebagai dua langkah penting dalam proses ini.
en-mt: Moreover, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive HCoV evolution and serve as two important steps in this process.

sourceString: For example, the acquisition or loss of novel protein-coding genes has the potential to drastically modify viral phenotypes.
targetString: Sebagai contoh, perolehan atau kehilangan gen penyandi protein baru berpotensi memodifikasi fenotipe virus secara drastis.
en-mt: For example, the gain or loss of new protein-coding genes has the potential to drastically modify viral phenotypes.

sourceString: Among SARS-CoV accessory proteins, ORF8 has been thought to be important in adaptation to humans, as SARS-CoV-related bat viruses were isolated but found to encode divergent ORF8 proteins.
targetString: Di antara protein aksesori SARS-CoV, ORF8 diduga berperan penting dalam adaptasi ke manusia sebab virus kelelawar kerabat-SARS-CoV yang diisolasi ditemukan menyandi beragam protein ORF8.
en-mt: Among the accessory proteins of SARS-CoV, ORF8 is thought to play an important role in adaptation to humans because the isolated bat virus related to SARS-CoV was found to encode various ORF8 proteins.

sourceString: A 29-nucleotide deletion characteristic of SARS-CoVs has been found in strains isolated at the beginning of the human epidemic.
targetString: SARS-CoV dengan ciri khas penghapusan 29 nukleotida ditemukan pada strain yang diisolasi di awal epidemi manusia.
en-mt: SARS-CoV with a characteristic 29-nucleotide deletion was found in a strain isolated early in the human epidemic.

sourceString: This deletion splits ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes the switch of hosts.
targetString: Penghapusan ini memisahkan ORF8 menjadi ORF8a dan ORF8b dan diduga merupakan mutasi adaptif yang mendukung peralihan inang.
en-mt: This deletion segregated ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that favors host switching.

sourceString: Besides, SARS-CoV has a possible recombination history with lineages of alpha- and gamma-CoVs, where a large number of smaller recombinant regions were identified in the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Selain itu, SARS-CoV mungkin memiliki sejarah rekombinasi dengan garis keturunan alfa-CoV dan gamma-CoV, dengan sejumlah besar daerah rekombinan lebih kecil teridentifikasi di RNA polimerase yang tergantung pada RNA.
en-mt: In addition, SARS-CoV may have a history of recombination with the alpha-CoV and gamma-CoV lineages, with a large number of smaller recombinant regions identified in RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.

sourceString: Recombination locations were also identified in the nsp9, most of nsp10, and parts of nsp14.
targetString: Lokasi rekombinasi juga teridentifikasi di nsp9, sebagian besar nsp10, dan sebagian nsp14.
en-mt: Recombination sites were also identified in nsp9, mostly in nsp10, and in part in nsp14.

sourceString: Likewise, it has been shown that the epidemic MERS-CoV experienced recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in dromedary camels in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Begitu pula, kejadian rekombinasi antara berbagai lini keturunan ditunjukkan berlangsung pada epidemi MERS-CoV, yang terjadi dalam unta Arab di Arab Saudi.
en-mt: Similarly, recombination events between various lineages were shown to occur in the MERS-CoV epidemic, which occurred in Arabian camels in Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Besides SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in other HCoVs, in which the HCoVs recombine with other animal CoVs in their non-structural genes.
targetString: Selain SARS-CoV dan MERS-CoV, kejadian rekombinasi juga telah diamati pada HCoV lainnya tempat HCoV mengalami rekombinasi dengan CoV hewan lain dalam gen nonstrukturalnya.
en-mt: Apart from SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in other HCoVs where HCoV undergoes recombination with other animal CoVs in its nonstructural genes.

sourceString: It should also be cautioned that artificial selection can contribute to unintended changes in viral genomes, most likely resulting from relieving viruses from selection pressures exerted, such as by the host immune system.
targetString: Juga harus diwaspadai bahwa seleksi buatan dapat berperan dalam perubahan yang tidak disengaja pada genom viral, kemungkinan besar diakibatkan oleh pembebasan virus dari tekanan seleksi yang dialami, seperti oleh sistem imun inang.
en-mt: It should also be noted that artificial selection may play a role in inadvertent changes to the viral genome, most likely resulting from the release of the virus from selection pressures experienced, such as by the host's immune system.

sourceString: An example of these effects is the loss of a full-length ORF4 in the HCoV-229E prototype strain, owing to a two-nucleotide deletion.
targetString: Contoh efek ini adalah hilangnya ORF4 lengkap pada strain prototipe HCoV-229E akibat penghapusan dua nukleotida.
en-mt: An example of this effect is the complete loss of ORF4 in the prototype strain HCoV-229E due to a two-nucleotide deletion.

sourceString: While intact ORF4 could be observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, the alpaca alpha-CoV displays a single nucleotide insertion, resulting in a frameshift.
targetString: Sementara ORF4 utuh dapat diamati pada virus kelelawar dan unta yang berkerabat dengan HCoV-229E, alfa-CoV alpaka menunjukkan sisipan nukleotida tunggal yang mengakibatkan pergeseran rangka.
en-mt: While intact ORF4 can be observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, alpaca alpha-CoV shows a single nucleotide insertion resulting in a shift in the skeleton.

sourceString: Last but not least, the evolution of novel HCoVs is also driven by the selection pressure in their reservoir hosts.
targetString: Terakhir, evolusi HCoV baru juga digerakkan oleh tekanan seleksi di inang reservoirnya.
en-mt: Lastly, the evolution of new HCoVs is also driven by selection pressures in their reservoir hosts.

sourceString: Asymptomatic or only mild symptoms were detected when bats were infected with CoVs, indicating the mutual adaptation between CoVs and bats.
targetString: Gejala ringan atau tanpa gejala terdeteksi saat kelelawar terinfeksi CoV, yang menunjukkan saling adaptasi antara CoV dan kelelawar.
en-mt: Mild or no symptoms were detected when bats were infected with CoV, indicating mutual adaptation between CoV and bats.

sourceString: It appeared that bats are well adapted to CoVs anatomically and physiologically.
targetString: Tampaknya kelelawar beradaptasi dengan baik dengan CoV secara anatomi dan fisiologi.
en-mt: It appears that bats are well adapted to CoV in anatomy and physiology.

sourceString: For example, defects in the activation of pro-inflammatory response in bats efficiently reduce the pathology triggered by CoVs.
targetString: Sebagai contoh, cacat pada pengaktifan respons proinflamasi pada kelelawar akan menurunkan patologi yang dipicu CoV secara efisien.
en-mt: For example, defects in activating proinflammatory responses in bats would efficiently downgrade CoV-triggered pathology.

sourceString: Besides, the natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to upregulation of inhibitory natural killer cell receptor NKG2/CD94 and low expression level of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules.
targetString: Selain itu, aktivitas sel pembunuh alami pada kelelawar ditekan karena kenaikan regulasi reseptor sel pembunuh alami penghambat NKG2/CD94 dan tingkat ekspresi molekul kompleks histokompatibilitas utama kelas I yang rendah.
en-mt: In addition, natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to upregulation of the inhibitory natural killer cell receptor NKG2/CD94 and low expression levels of class I major histocompatibility complex molecules.

sourceString: Moreover, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) generated from high metabolic activity of bats could both suppress CoV replication and affects proofreading by exoribonuclease, thus providing the selection pressure for the generation of virus strains highly pathogenic when introduced into a new host.
targetString: Selain itu, kadar spesies oksigen reaktif (ROS) yang tinggi dari aktivitas metabolik kelelawar yang tinggi dapat menekan replikasi CoV dan memengaruhi pengoreksian oleh eksoribonuklease sehingga memberi tekanan seleksi untuk pembuatan strain virus yang sangat patogenik saat masuk ke dalam inang baru.
en-mt: In addition, high levels of reactive oxygen species (ROS) from bats' high metabolic activity can suppress CoV replication and affect correction by exoribonucleases, thus providing selection pressure for the creation of highly pathogenic viral strains when introduced into new hosts.

sourceString: More pathogenic CoV strains might also evolve by recombination, leading to the acquisition of novel proteins or protein features for host adaptation.
targetString: Strain CoV yang lebih patogenik mungkin juga berkembang melalui rekombinasi, yang mengakibatkan perolehan protein atau fitur protein baru untuk adaptasi inang.
en-mt: More pathogenic CoV strains might also evolve through recombination, resulting in the acquisition of new proteins or protein features for host adaptation.

sourceString: Thus, it is not by chance that three novel HCoVs have emerged in the past two decades.
targetString: Karena itu, bukan suatu kebetulan bahwa tiga HCoV baru telah muncul dalam dua dasawarsa terakhir.
en-mt: Therefore, it is no coincidence that three new HCoVs have emerged in the last two decades.

sourceString: CoVs are non-pathogenic or cause mild symptoms in their reservoir hosts such as bats and camels.
targetString: CoV bersifat nonpatogenik atau menyebabkan gejala ringan dalam inang reservoirnya, seperti kelelawar dan unta.
en-mt: CoV is nonpathogenic or causes mild symptoms in its reservoir hosts, such as bats and camels.

sourceString: They replicate robustly without eliciting a strong host immune response.
targetString: CoV bereplikasi dengan kuat tanpa memicu respons imun inang yang kuat.
en-mt: CoV replicates vigorously without triggering a strong host immune response.

sourceString: Herein lie the secrets of why asymptomatic carriers are seen and what causes the severe cases in human infection.
targetString: Di sinilah terletak rahasia adanya pembawa tanpa gejala dan penyebab kasus berat pada infeksi manusia.
en-mt: Therein lies the secret of asymptomatic carriers and causes of severe cases of human infection.

sourceString: The severe symptoms are mainly due to the hyperactivation of immune response and the cytokine storm wherein the stronger the immune response, the more severe the lung damage.
targetString: Gejala berat terutama karena pengaktifan respons imun yang berlebihan serta badai sitokin, dengan kerusakan paru yang semakin berat jika respons imun semakin kuat.
en-mt: Severe symptoms are mainly due to over-activation of the immune response as well as cytokine storms, with lung damage that becomes more severe the stronger the immune response.

sourceString: In contrast, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response has been de-coupled from CoV replication.
targetString: Sebaliknya, pada pembawa tanpa gejala, respons imun sudah terlepas dari replikasi CoV.
en-mt: Conversely, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response is already disengaged from CoV replication.

sourceString: The same strategy of delinking the immune response might have beneficial effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.
targetString: Strategi yang sama untuk memutuskan keterkaitan respons imun mungkin bermanfaat dalam terapi anti-SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: The same strategy for disconnecting the immune response may be useful in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.

sourceString: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.
targetString: Respons interferon terutama kuat pada kelelawar.
en-mt: The interferon response was especially strong in bats.

sourceString: Thus, administration of type I interferon at least in the early phase of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.
targetString: Karena itu, pemberian interferon tipe I, setidaknya di fase awal infeksi SARS-CoV-2 pada manusia, seharusnya bermanfaat.
en-mt: Therefore, administering type I interferon, at least in the early phases of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans, should be beneficial.

sourceString: In addition, NLRP3 inflammasome activation in bats is defective.
targetString: Selain itu, pengaktifan inflamasom NLRP3 di kelelawar bersifat defektif.
en-mt: In addition, activation of the NLRP3 inflamasome in bats is defective.

sourceString: By this reasoning, inhibition of NLRP3 inflammasome with MCC950 might be useful in the treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Dengan alasan ini, inhibisi inflamasom NLRP3 dengan MCC950 mungkin bermanfaat dalam penanganan COVID-19.
en-mt: For this reason, inhibition of the NLRP3 inflamasome with MCC950 may be beneficial in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 follows the general theme by which SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV arose.
targetString: Kemunculan SARS-CoV-2 mengikuti alur umum kemunculan SARS-CoV dan MERS-CoV.
en-mt: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 follows the general path of emergence of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Whereas a bat beta-CoV sharing 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV has been found, there also exists a bat-CoV sharing 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Sementara beta-CoV kelelawar yang berbagi 95% homologi nukleotida dengan SARS-CoV telah ditemukan, ada pula CoV kelelawar yang berbagi 96% homologi nukleotida dengan SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: While a bat beta-CoV that shares 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV has been found, there is also a bat CoV that shares 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Whereas civets and other animals in the markets have been found to harbour viruses identical to SARS-CoV, immediate intermediate hosts for SARS-CoV-2 have not been identified.
targetString: Walaupun musang dan hewan lain di pasar tersebut ditemukan membawa virus yang identik dengan SARS-CoV, inang perantara langsung untuk SARS-CoV-2 belum ditemukan.
en-mt: Although ferrets and other animals at the market were found to carry a virus identical to SARS-CoV, a direct intermediate host for SARS-CoV-2 has yet to be found.

sourceString: Pangolin beta-CoVs strikingly homologous to SARS-CoV-2 have been found, indicating that pangolins might serve as one of intermediate hosts or pangolin beta-CoVs could contribute gene fragments to the final version of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Beta-CoV trenggiling yang sangat homolog dengan SARS-CoV-2 telah ditemukan, yang menunjukkan bahwa trenggiling mungkin berperan sebagai salah satu inang perantara atau beta-CoV trenggiling mungkin memberi kontribusi fragmen gen pada versi akhir SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Pangolin beta-CoV that is highly homologous to SARS-CoV-2 has been found, indicating that pangolins may act as one of the intermediate hosts or that pangolin beta-CoV may contribute a gene fragment in the final version of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 is man-made either deliberately or accidentally.
targetString: Walaupun masih dipertanyakan, belum ada bukti bahwa SARS-CoV-2 dibuat oleh manusia baik secara sengaja maupun tidak sengaja.
en-mt: Although it is still questionable, there is no evidence yet that SARS-CoV-2 was made by humans either intentionally or accidentally.

sourceString: CoVs have returned to the limelight due to the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: CoV kembali menjadi pusat perhatian karena wabah SARS-CoV-2 baru-baru ini.
en-mt: CoV is back in the limelight due to the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The study of CoVs in bats and other animals has drastically changed our perception of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal reservoirs of HCoVs in human transmission.
targetString: Studi CoV di kelelawar dan hewan lain telah sangat mengubah persepsi kita tentang pentingnya asal zoonotik dan reservoir hewan untuk HCoV pada transmisi manusia.
en-mt: CoV studies in bats and other animals have greatly changed our perception of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal reservoirs for HCoV in human transmission.

sourceString: Pervasive evidence has shown that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 have a bat origin and are transmitted to humans via intermediate hosts.
targetString: Sangat banyak bukti menunjukkan bahwa SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV, dan SARS-CoV-2 berasal dari kelelawar dan ditransmisikan kepada manusia melalui inang perantara.
en-mt: There is overwhelming evidence that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV, and SARS-CoV-2 originated in bats and were transmitted to humans via an intermediate host.

sourceString: Given that SARS-CoV infection originates from the contact between humans and civets in the markets, closing wet markets and killing civets therein could have effectively ended the SARS epidemic.
targetString: Mengingat bahwa infeksi SARS-CoV berasal dari kontak antara manusia dan musang di pasar basah, mungkin penutupan pasar basah dan pembunuhan semua musang di dalamnya yang mengakhiri epidemi SARS secara efektif.
en-mt: Given that infection with SARS-CoV originated from contact between humans and ferrets in wet markets, it may have been the closure of the wet market and the killing of all the civets in it that effectively ended the SARS epidemic.

sourceString: By the same reasoning, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, in view of the discovery of multiple lineages of pangolin beta-CoVs closely related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Dengan alasan yang sama, trenggiling seharusnya dipindahkan dari pasar basah untuk mencegah transmisi zoonotik, mengingat adanya penemuan beberapa garis keturunan beta-CoV trenggiling yang berkerabat dekat dengan SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: For the same reason, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, given the discovery of several pangolin beta-CoV lineages that are closely related to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, whether and how SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans through pangolins and other mammals remain to be clarified in future investigations.
targetString: Meski demikian, kebenaran dan mekanisme SARS-CoV-2 ditransmisikan kepada manusia melalui trenggiling dan mamalia lainnya masih harus diklarifikasi dalam penelitian di masa mendatang.
en-mt: However, the truth and mechanism by which SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans via pangolins and other mammals remains to be clarified in future studies.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has existed in dromedary camels for a long time.
targetString: Di sisi lain, MERS-CoV sudah lama berada dalam unta Arab.
en-mt: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been in Arabian camels for a long time.

sourceString: These camels serve as an important tool for transportation as well as a main source of meat, milk, leather and wool products for the local people.
targetString: Unta ini berfungsi sebagai alat transportasi penting serta sebagai sumber utama untuk daging, susu, kulit, dan produk wol untuk masyarakat setempat.
en-mt: The camel serves as an important means of transportation as well as a major source of meat, milk, leather, and wool products for the local people.

sourceString: They are widely distributed across the Middle East and Africa.
targetString: Unta Arab tersebar luas di seluruh Timur Tengah dan Afrika.
en-mt: Arabian camels are widespread throughout the Middle East and Africa.

sourceString: It is therefore impossible to sacrifice all camels for the control of MERS, as what was done in wild animal markets in China to prevent the spreading of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Karena itu, kita tidak mungkin membunuh semua unta untuk mengendalikan MERS, seperti yang dilakukan di pasar hewan liar di Tiongkok untuk mencegah penyebaran SARS-CoV dan SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Therefore, it is not possible to kill all the camels to control MERS, as is done in wild animal markets in China to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: To stop the recurrent outbreaks of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be taken to develop effective vaccines against MERS-CoV for camels, in combination with other infection control measures.
targetString: Untuk menghentikan wabah MERS, pendekatan komprehensif harus dilakukan untuk mengembangkan vaksin untuk unta yang efektif terhadap MERS-CoV dan dikombinasikan dengan langkah pengendalian infeksi yang lain.
en-mt: To stop the MERS outbreak, a comprehensive approach must be taken to develop a vaccine for camels that is effective against MERS-CoV and combined with other infection control measures.

sourceString: As we are not able to eliminate these viruses, new genotypes might emerge to cause outbreaks.
targetString: Sebelum kita berhasil menghilangkan virus ini, genotipe baru dapat muncul dan menyebabkan wabah.
en-mt: Before we can eradicate this virus, new genotypes may emerge and cause outbreaks.

sourceString: A variety of zoonotic CoVs are circulating in the wild.
targetString: Berbagai CoV zoonotik beredar di alam liar.
en-mt: Various zoonotic CoV circulating in the wild.

sourceString: Particularly, bat CoVs with zoonotic potential are so diverse.
targetString: Khususnya, CoV kelelawar yang berpotensi zoonotik sangat beragam.
en-mt: In particular, the potentially zoonotic bat CoV is highly diverse.

sourceString: There are plenty of opportunities that these zoonotic CoVs evolve and recombine, resulting in the emergence of new CoVs that are more transmissible and/or deadly in humans in future.
targetString: Ada banyak kemungkinan bagi CoV zoonotik ini untuk berevolusi dan mengalami rekombinasi, yang mengakibatkan munculnya CoV baru yang lebih mudah ditransmisikan dan/atau lebih mematikan bagi manusia di masa depan.
en-mt: There are many possibilities for these zoonotic CoVs to evolve and undergo recombination, resulting in the emergence of new CoVs that are more easily transmitted and/or more lethal to humans in the future.

sourceString: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.
targetString: Budaya memakan hewan liar di beberapa tempat di Tiongkok harus ditinggalkan untuk mengurangi kontak yang tidak perlu antara manusia dan hewan.
en-mt: The culture of eating wild animals in some parts of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.

sourceString: With the ordeals of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.
targetString: Dengan pengalaman pahit SARS, MERS, dan COVID-19, persiapan dan rencana penanggulangan yang lebih baik harus diterapkan.
en-mt: With the bitter experience of SARS, MERS, and COVID-19, better preparations and response plans must be put in place.

sourceString: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.
targetString: Sebenarnya, banyak virus telah ada di planet ini sejak dahulu kala.
en-mt: In fact, many viruses have existed on this planet since time immemorial.

sourceString: They stay in their own natural reservoirs until there is a chance for spillover.
targetString: Virus-virus ini berada di reservoir alaminya sampai ada kesempatan untuk penyebaran.
en-mt: These viruses are in their natural reservoir until there is an opportunity for dissemination.

sourceString: Although bats have many features that favours the spreading of viruses, the chance for humans to be in contact with bats and other wildlife species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from them.
targetString: Walaupun kelelawar memiliki banyak ciri yang mendukung penyebaran virus, peluang manusia berkontak dengan kelelawar dan spesies alam liar lain dapat diminimalkan jika orang diedukasi untuk menjauhi hewan liar.
en-mt: Although bats have many characteristics that favor the spread of viruses, the chances of humans coming into contact with bats and other wild species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from wild animals.

sourceString: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.
targetString: Surveilans berkelanjutan terhadap mamalia perlu dilakukan untuk lebih memahami ekologi CoV dan inang alaminya, yang akan terbukti bermanfaat dalam mencegah transmisi hewan-ke-manusia dan wabah mendatang.
en-mt: Continued surveillance of mammals is necessary to better understand the ecology of CoV and its natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.

sourceString: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.
targetString: Sebagai kesimpulan, cara paling efektif untuk mencegah zoonosis virus adalah manusia harus menjaga jarak dari relung ekologis reservoir alami virus zoonotik.
en-mt: In conclusion, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonoses is for humans to keep their distance from the ecological niches of natural reservoirs of zoonotic viruses.

sourceString: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.
targetString: Beberapa bagian teka-teki asal zoonotik SARS-CoV-2 belum ditemukan.
en-mt: Several pieces of the puzzle of SARS-CoV-2's zoonotic origins have yet to be discovered.

sourceString: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.
targetString: Pertama, jika kelelawar mentransmisikan virus leluhur SARS-CoV-2 ke trenggiling, kondisi ketika kelelawar dan trenggiling berbagi relung ekologis adalah hal yang penting untuk diketahui.
en-mt: First, if bats transmit the ancestral virus SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it is important to know the circumstances under which bats and pangolins share ecological niches.

sourceString: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans get into contact with bats should be determined.
targetString: Kedua, jika kelelawar memiliki peran yang lebih langsung dalam transmisi ke manusia, cara manusia berkontak dengan kelelawar harus ditentukan.
en-mt: Second, if bats have a more direct role in transmission to humans, the way in which humans come into contact with bats must be determined.

sourceString: Third, if a third mammal acts as the true intermediate host, how it interacts with the different species including humans, bats and pangolins has to be clarified.
targetString: Ketiga, jika ada mamalia ketiga yang berperan sebagai inang perantara sebenarnya, cara mamalia itu berinteraksi dengan spesies lain, yang mencakup manusia, kelelawar, dan trenggiling harus diperjelas.
en-mt: Third, if there is a third mammal serving as a true intermediate host, how that mammal interacts with other species, which includes humans, bats and pangolins must be clarified.

sourceString: Finally, since many mammals including domestic animals might be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and experimental infection should be conducted.
targetString: Akhirnya, karena banyak mamalia, termasuk hewan peliharaan yang mungkin rentan terhadap SARS-CoV-2, baik infeksi percobaan dan surveilans harus dilakukan.
en-mt: Finally, because many mammals, including pets, may be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, both experimental and surveillance infections should be carried out.

sourceString: Should it be a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parental viruses that are almost identical will be identified in its natural hosts in future.
targetString: Entah kelelawar, trenggiling, atau mamalia lain, diharapkan bahwa SARS-CoV-2 atau virus induknya yang hampir identik dapat diidentifikasi di inang alaminya di masa mendatang.
en-mt: Whether bats, pangolins or other mammals, it is hoped that SARS-CoV-2 or its nearly identical parent virus can be identified in its natural host in the future.

sourceString: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.
targetString: Penyelidikan berkelanjutan dalam bidang ini akan menguraikan jalur evolusioner SARS-CoV-2 di hewan, dengan implikasi penting dalam pencegahan dan pengendalian COVID-19 pada manusia.
en-mt: Ongoing investigations in this field will decipher the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications for the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.

sourceString: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary
targetString: Pembaruan kriteria diagnostik “kasus terduga” dan “kasus terkonfirmasi” COVID-19 perlu dilakukan
en-mt: It is necessary to update the diagnostic criteria for “suspected cases” and “confirmed cases” for COVID-19

sourceString: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Pada 6 Februari 2020, tim kami mempublikasikan panduan nasihat cepat untuk diagnosis dan penanganan infeksi koronavirus baru 2019 (2019-nCoV). Panduan ini berdasarkan pengalaman kami dan menjadi referensi yang baik untuk melawan pandemi di seluruh dunia.
en-mt: On February 6, 2020, our team published a quick advice guide for diagnosing and treating infection with the novel coronavirus 2019 (2019-nCoV). This guide is based on our experience and makes a good reference for fighting pandemics around the world.

sourceString: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Meski demikian, penyakit koronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) adalah penyakit baru, kesadaran dan pengetahuan kita semakin meningkat berdasarkan temuan riset yang sedang berlangsung dan pengalaman praktis klinis; karena itu, strategi diagnosis dan penanganan juga terus diperbarui.
en-mt: Despite the fact that coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is increasing based on ongoing research findings and practical clinical experiences; Therefore, diagnosis and treatment strategies are also continuously updated.

sourceString: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
targetString: Dalam surat ini, kami menjawab salah satu komentar di panduan kami dan menyediakan kriteria diagnostik terbaru untuk “kasus terduga” dan “kasus terkonfirmasi” berdasarkan Panduan Diagnosis dan Penanganan untuk COVID-19 (versi ketujuh) yang dikeluarkan oleh Komisi Kesehatan Nasional Republik Rakyat Tiongkok.
en-mt: In this letter, we respond to one of the comments in our guide and provide the latest diagnostic criteria for “suspected cases” and “confirmed cases” based on the Diagnosis and Treatment Guide for COVID-19 (seventh version) issued by the National Health Commission of the People's Republic of China.

sourceString: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Pada Desember 2019, koronavirus baru 2019 (2019-nCoV) telah menyebabkan wabah, yang saat ini secara formal disebut penyakit koronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) dan virus tersebut diberi nama koronavirus sindrom pernapasan akut berat 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: In December 2019, the novel coronavirus 2019 (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now formally called coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.
targetString: Pada 11 Maret 2020, WHO menjelaskan COVID-19 sebagai pandemi.
en-mt: On March 11, 2020, WHO declared COVID-19 a pandemic.

sourceString: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.
targetString: Untuk melawan infeksi SARS-CoV-2, tim kami mengembangkan panduan nasihat cepat dan panduan tersebut telah dipublikasikan secara daring di Military Medical Research pada 6 Februari 2020.
en-mt: To fight against SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team developed a quick advice guide and it was published online in Military Medical Research on February 6, 2020.

sourceString: It has attracted a great attention since published.
targetString: Panduan tersebut telah banyak menarik perhatian sejak diterbitkan.
en-mt: The guide has attracted a lot of attention since its publication.

sourceString: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Namun, perlu dicatat bahwa COVID-19 adalah penyakit baru, kesadaran dan pengetahuan kita semakin meningkat berdasarkan temuan riset yang sedang berlangsung serta pengalaman praktis klinis; karena itu, strategi diagnosis dan penanganan juga terus diperbarui.
en-mt: However, it should be noted that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is increasing based on ongoing research findings and practical clinical experience; Therefore, diagnosis and treatment strategies are also continuously updated.

sourceString: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
targetString: Sebagai contoh Panduan Diagnosis dan Penanganan untuk COVID-19 yang dikeluarkan oleh Komisi Kesehatan Nasional Republik Rakyat Tiongkok (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), antara 16 Januari 2020 hingga 3 Maret 2020, komisi ini telah mengeluarkan total tujuh edisi dengan sebagian konteks telah diubah cukup banyak.
en-mt: For example the Diagnosis and Treatment Guide for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Commission of the People's Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), between January 16, 2020 to March 3, 2020, this commission has issued a total of seven issues with some the context has been changed quite a lot.

sourceString: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
targetString: Panduan kami menerima komentar dari Zhou et al., mereka memperkenalkan proposal pemberian skor sederhana berdasarkan pengalaman klinis mereka.
en-mt: Our guide received comments from Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.

sourceString: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Hasil kerja mereka menambahkan bukti baru untuk panduan kami serta menjadi rujukan berharga untuk pandemi ini di seluruh dunia.
en-mt: Their work adds new evidence to our guide and is a valuable reference for this pandemic around the world.

sourceString: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
targetString: Kami mendukung hasil kerja mereka yang signifikan dan mengungkapkan rasa terima kasih kami.
en-mt: We support their significant work and express our gratitude.

sourceString: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
targetString: Meski demikian, hasil kerja mereka juga memerlukan pembaruan berdasarkan Panduan Diagnosis dan Penanganan untuk COVID-19 terbaru (versi ketujuh uji coba) dan studi terbaru.
en-mt: However, their work also requires updating based on the latest Guidelines for Diagnosis and Treatment for COVID-19 (version seven of the trial) and recent studies.

sourceString: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
targetString: Berdasarkan edisi ketujuh (3 Maret 2020), untuk mengonfirmasi kasus terduga diperlukan kombinasi salah satu gambaran riwayat epidemiologis dengan dua manifestasi klinis untuk membuat analisis yang komprehensif, atau diperlukan pemenuhan tiga manifestasi klinis jika tidak ada riwayat epidemiologis yang jelas:
en-mt: Based on the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm a suspected case, it is necessary to combine one of the features of the epidemiological history with two clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or it is necessary to fulfill three clinical manifestations if there is no clear epidemiological history:

sourceString: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
targetString: Riwayat epidemiologis: (1) riwayat perjalanan atau tinggal di kota Wuhan dan daerah sekitarnya, atau komunitas lain tempat kasus COVID-19 telah dilaporkan dalam 14 hari terakhir sebelum awitan gejala; (2) riwayat kontak dengan kasus menular SARS-CoV-2 (dengan uji asam nukleat positif); (3) riwayat kontak dengan pasien yang mengalami demam atau gejala pernapasan dari kota Wuhan dan daerah sekitarnya, atau komunitas lain tempat kasus COVID-19 telah dilaporkan dalam 14 hari terakhir sebelum awitan gejala; (4) riwayat kontak dengan klaster kasus terkonfirmasi (≥ 2 kasus dengan demam dan/atau gejala pernapasan yang terjadi dalam 2 minggu di area kecil, seperti rumah, kantor, kelas sekolah, dll.).
en-mt: Epidemiological history: (1) history of travel or residence in the city of Wuhan and surrounding areas, or other communities where cases of COVID-19 have been reported in the last 14 days prior to the onset of symptoms; (2) history of contact with an infectious case of SARS-CoV-2 (with a positive nucleic acid test); (3) history of contact with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where cases of COVID-19 have been reported in the last 14 days prior to the onset of symptoms; (4) history of contact with a confirmed case cluster (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurring within 2 weeks in a small area, such as home, office, school classroom, etc.).

sourceString: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/ or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
targetString: Manifestasi klinis: (1) demam dan/atau gejala pernapasan; (2) fitur pencitraan infeksi COVID-19; (3) total hitung sel darah putih menunjukkan hitung limfosit normal, menurun, atau berkurang di tahap awitan awal.
en-mt: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/or respiratory symptoms; (2) imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell count shows normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early stages of onset.

sourceString: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.
targetString: Mendiagnosis kasus terkonfirmasi harus didasarkan pada kasus terduga dengan salah satu bukti patogenik atau serologis sebagai berikut: (1) uji PCR real-time positif untuk SARS-CoV-2; (2) sekuensi seluruh genom virus menunjukkan homogenitas tinggi untuk koronavirus baru yang diketahui; (3) positif untuk antibody IgM spesifik dan antibodi IgG terhadap SARS-CoV-2 dalam uji serum; atau perubahan antibodi IgG spesifik-SARS-CoV-2 dari negatif menjadi positif, atau titer meningkat ≥4 lipat pada fase pemulihan di atas kadar pada fase akut.
