en-mt: Diagnosing a confirmed case should be based on a suspected case with one of the following pathogenic or serological evidence: (1) a positive real-time PCR test for SARS-CoV-2; (2) whole viral genome sequences show high homogeneity for known new coronaviruses; (3) positive for specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody against SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change in SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or the titer increased ≥4 fold in the recovery phase above levels in the acute phase.

sourceString: We can see that the real-time PCR test for nucleic acid in respiratory tract or blood samples was added to the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.
targetString: Kita dapat melihat bahwa uji PCR real-time asam nukleat dalam sampel saluran pernapasan atau darah ditambahkan pada edisi kedua (18 Januari 2020) dan ketiga (22 Januari 2020).
en-mt: We can see that the real-time PCR test of nucleic acids in respiratory tract or blood samples was added in the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.

sourceString: The pathogenic detection of blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; and then the serological evidence was added to the seventh edition.
targetString: Deteksi patogenik pada sampel darah ditambahkan pada edisi keempat (27 Januari 2020) dan kelima (8 Februari 2020); lalu, bukti serologis ditambahkan pada edisi ketujuh.
en-mt: Pathogenic detection in blood samples added in fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; later, serological evidence was added in the seventh edition.

sourceString: These modifications based on the researchers continued work that to search for an optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as the samples from respiratory tract including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens, and supported bringing the specific antibody positive result into the confirmed criteria.
targetString: Modifikasi ini berdasarkan penelitian berkelanjutan para peneliti untuk mencari kit deteksi asam nukleat optimal untuk diagnosis cepat, serta sampel dari saluran napas termasuk pengambilan darah, yang meningkatkan ketersediaan berbagai spesimen, dan mendukung penyertaan hasil positif antibodi tertentu ke dalam kriteria terkonfirmasi.
en-mt: This modification is based on the researchers' ongoing work to find the optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as airway sampling including blood sampling, which increases the availability of multiple specimens, and supports the inclusion of positive antibody specific results into the confirmed criteria.

sourceString: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Selain itu, ada semakin banyak bukti yang mengingatkan kita untuk mewaspadai pasien dengan gejala atipis dan tanpa gejala.
en-mt: In addition, there is increasing evidence to alert us to be aware of patients with and without symptoms of atymptoms.

sourceString: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.
targetString: Karena itu, bagan alir Zhou et al. harus diperbarui sebab mereka mengklasifikasikan orang tanpa gejala klinis sebagai “berisiko rendah”.
en-mt: Therefore, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated as they classify people without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.

sourceString: The score system also needs to be verified in further clinical practice and studies.
targetString: Sistem skor juga perlu diverifikasi dalam praktik dan studi klinis di masa mendatang.
en-mt: The scoring system also needs to be verified in practice and future clinical studies.

sourceString: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence coming up and call for readers to provide their comments.
targetString: Sebagai penutup, kami berharap bukti yang lebih langsung akan muncul dan meminta pembaca untuk memberikan komentar.
en-mt: In closing, we hope that more direct evidence will emerge and invite readers to comment.

sourceString: For the diagnosis of “suspected case” and “confirmed case”, we suggest to trace and obey the newest guidelines of their home countries.
targetString: Untuk diagnosis “kasus terduga” dan “kasus terkonfirmasi”, kami menyarankan untuk mengikuti dan mematuhi panduan terbaru di negara masing-masing.
en-mt: For “suspected cases” and “confirmed cases” diagnoses, we recommend following and complying with the latest guidelines in the respective countries.

sourceString: Our team will also timely update our guideline to offer help.
targetString: Tim kami juga akan memperbarui panduan kami secara berkala sebagai bantuan.
en-mt: Our team will also update our guide regularly for assistance.

sourceString: Bangladesh reports five new deaths due to COVID-19, a daily highest
targetString: Bangladesh melaporkan lima kematian baru akibat COVID-19, angka kematian harian tertinggi
en-mt: Bangladesh reports five new deaths from COVID-19, its highest daily death toll

sourceString: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
targetString: Kemarin, Bangladesh mengonfirmasi lima kematian baru akibat COVID-19 pada hari itu.
en-mt: Yesterday, Bangladesh confirmed five new deaths from COVID-19 that day.

sourceString: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
targetString: Ini adalah angka kematian tertinggi dalam satu hari akibat virus itu.
en-mt: This is the highest single-day death toll from the virus.

sourceString: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
targetString: Hingga kemarin, Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) Bangladesh melaporkan jumlah kasus infeksi yang tercatat mencakup 114 kasus aktif dan 33 kasus sembuh yang tinggal di rumah.
en-mt: Until yesterday, the Bangladesh Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded cases of infection included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases living at home.

sourceString: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
targetString: Tercatat total 17 kematian.
en-mt: A total of 17 deaths were recorded.

sourceString: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
targetString: Dalam sebuah taklimat berita daring, direktur IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, mengatakan kematian meliputi empat pria dan seorang wanita.
en-mt: In an online news briefing, the IEDCR director, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the deaths included four men and a woman.

sourceString: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
targetString: Menurut Dr Meerjady, dua kasus berumur di atas 60 tahun, dua kasus antara 51 dan 60 tahun, dan satu kasus antara 41-50 tahun.
en-mt: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were over 60 years old, two cases between 51 and 60 years, and one case between 41-50 years.

sourceString: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
targetString: Ia juga mengatakan dua korban berasal dari Dhaka.
en-mt: He also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
targetString: Pada tanggal 11 Maret 2020, Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia (WHO) menyatakan COVID-19 sebagai pandemi.
en-mt: On March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.

sourceString: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
targetString: Seorang pejabat rumah sakit memberitahu Anadolu Agency, sebuah kantor berita lokal, bahwa salah seorang yang meninggal adalah Jalal Saifur Rahman, direktur Komisi Anti Korupsi Bengali, yang dirawat di Rumah Sakit Kuwait Maitree.
en-mt: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news agency, that one of the dead was Jalal Saifur Rahman, director of the Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was being treated at Kuwait Maitree Hospital.

sourceString: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
targetString: Pada hari Sabtu, dalam sebuah pengumuman video daring, Menteri Transportasi Jalan dan Jembatan, Obaidul Quader mengatakan transportasi umum akan dihentikan lebih lama dari yang semula direncanakan, sampai Sabtu mendatang.
en-mt: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Minister of Roads and Bridges Transport, Obaidul Quader said public transport would be halted longer than originally planned, until next Saturday.

sourceString: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
targetString: Penghentian transportasi umum ini telah dimulai sejak tanggal 26 Maret dan direncanakan berakhir pada hari Sabtu, 4 April.
en-mt: The stoppage of public transportation has started since March 26 and is planned to end on Saturday, April 4.

sourceString: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
targetString: Transportasi barang kebutuhan pokok -- medis, bahan bakar, dan makanan -- masih diizinkan.
en-mt: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- is still permitted.

sourceString: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
targetString: Insiden infeksi COVID-19 yang pertama tercatat di Bangladesh adalah pada tanggal 8 Maret, pada dua orang yang baru pulang dari Italia dan juga istri salah seorang dari mereka.
en-mt: The first recorded incident of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh was on March 8, in two people who had just returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.

sourceString: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
targetString: Pada 19 Maret, tiga orang tersebut telah sembuh.
en-mt: As of March 19, the three people had recovered.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
targetString: Infeksi SARS-CoV-2 melebihi angka satu juta di seluruh dunia
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infections exceed one million worldwide

sourceString: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
targetString: Pada hari Kamis, total jumlah kasus infeksi virus korona SARS-CoV-2 melampaui satu juta di seluruh dunia, menurut data Johns Hopkins University.
en-mt: On Thursday, the total number of cases of infection with the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus surpassed one million worldwide, according to data from Johns Hopkins University.

sourceString: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
targetString: Setidaknya 52 ribu kematian dikaitkan dengan COVID-19, penyakit yang disebabkan oleh virus korona.
en-mt: At least 52 thousand deaths have been attributed to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.

sourceString: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
targetString: Puncaknya terjadi pada hari yang sama ketika Malawi mengonfirmasi infeksi virus korona pertamanya dan Zambia mengalami kematian pertamanya terkait virus korona.
en-mt: The peak came on the same day that Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infection and Zambia experienced its first coronavirus-related death.

sourceString: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
targetString: Korea Utara mengklaim, pada hari Kamis, bahwa negara tersebut adalah salah satu dari sedikit negara yang tetap terbebas dari infeksi virus korona.
en-mt: North Korea claimed, on Thursday, that it is one of the few nations that remains free of coronavirus infection.

sourceString: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
targetString: Hingga kemarin, Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia (WHO) melaporkan 1.051.635 kasus terkonfirmasi, termasuk 79.332 kasus dalam dua puluh empat jam sejak pukul 10 pagi Waktu Eropa Tengah (0800 UTC) pada tanggal 4 April.
en-mt: As of yesterday, the World Health Organization (WHO) reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty-four hours since 10 am Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.

sourceString: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
targetString: Di Amerika Serikat (AS), tercatat ada lebih dari 244 ribu kasus virus korona, yang mengakibatkan setidaknya 5.900 kematian.
en-mt: In the United States (US), there have been more than 244 thousand cases of the corona virus, which have resulted in at least 5,900 deaths.

sourceString: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
targetString: Kantor Berita CBS melaporkan, yang mengutip data Johns Hopkins University, terdapat lebih dari 1.000 kematian di AS yang diakibatkan oleh infeksi virus korona.
en-mt: The CBS News Agency reported, citing data from Johns Hopkins University, that there have been more than 1,000 deaths in the US caused by corona virus infection.

sourceString: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
targetString: Di seluruh dunia, negara-negara mengumumkan tindakan yang lebih ketat untuk menghambat penyebaran penyakit.
en-mt: Around the world, countries are announcing tougher measures to contain the spread of the disease.

sourceString: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
targetString: Pada hari Kamis, Sergei Sobyanin, walikota Moskow, memperpanjang karantina wilayah hingga tanggal 1 Mei.
en-mt: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the lockdown until May 1.

sourceString: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
targetString: Secara Nasional, Presiden Vladimir Putin menyatakan bahwa warga Rusia akan tetap dibayar tanpa perlu pergi bekerja hingga tanggal 30 April.
en-mt: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin stated that Russian citizens will still be paid without going to work until April 30.

sourceString: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
targetString: Parlemen Portugal melakukan pengambilan suara untuk memperpanjang status darurat nasional selama 15 hari; pengambilan suara tersebut lolos dengan 215 suara mendukung, sepuluh suara abstain, dan satu suara menolak.
en-mt: Portugal's parliament votes to extend the state of emergency for 15 days; the voting passed with 215 votes in favour, ten abstentions, and one vote against.

sourceString: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
targetString: Arab Saudi memperpanjang jam malam di kota suci Mekkah dan Madinah hingga sepanjang hari; sebelumnya, jam malam tersebut hanya berlaku antara pukul 3 sore dan 6 pagi.
en-mt: Saudi Arabia extends curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina for the whole day; previously, the curfew only applied between 3pm and 6am.

sourceString: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
targetString: Thailand berencana menerapkan jam malam antara pukul 10 malam dan 4 pagi.
en-mt: Thailand plans to implement a curfew between 10pm and 4am.

sourceString: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
targetString: Gubernur Ohio, Mike DeWine, mengumumkan bahwa negara bagian tersebut telah memperpanjang perintah tinggal di rumah hingga tanggal 1 Mei.
en-mt: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced that the state has extended stay-at-home orders through May 1.

sourceString: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
targetString: Toko-toko di Australia menurunkan batas pembelian tisu toilet per transaksi
en-mt: Shops in Australia lowered the limit on toilet paper purchases per transaction

sourceString: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
targetString: Pada hari Minggu dan Sabtu sore, jaringan toko Australia Woolworth dan Coles masing-masing menurunkan batasan pembelian tisu toilet hingga dua dan satu pak per transaksi di semua toko pada tingkat nasional.
en-mt: On Sunday and Saturday afternoons, Australian store chains Woolworth and Coles lowered their limits on toilet paper purchases to two and one pack per transaction, respectively, across all stores on a national level.

sourceString: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
targetString: ALDI juga menerapkan batasan satu pak, pada hari Senin.
en-mt: ALDI also implemented a one-pack limit, on Monday.

sourceString: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
targetString: Pembatasan ini diumumkan sebagai pesan di kasir dan di halaman Facebook jaringannya.
en-mt: This restriction was announced as a message at the checkout and on the network's Facebook page.

sourceString: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
targetString: Pembeli dilaporkan menumpuk persediaan akibat ketakutan COVID-19 kalau-kalau masyarakat harus melakukan isolasi mandiri.
en-mt: Buyers are reported to have stockpiled supplies due to fears of COVID-19 in case people have to self-isolate.

sourceString: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
targetString: Pada hari Rabu, Woolworths juga membatasi pembelian tisu toilet untuk pengiriman ke rumah hingga satu pak per pesanan.
en-mt: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited purchases of toilet paper for home delivery to one pack per order.

sourceString: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
targetString: Perubahan ini mengikuti pembatasan empat pak per transaksi yang sebelumnya diterapkan Woolworths dan Coles masing-masing pada 4 dan 5 Maret.
en-mt: The changes follow the four-pack limit per transaction that Woolworths and Coles previously implemented on March 4 and 5, respectively.

sourceString: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
targetString: Pada pernyataan medianya tanggal 8 Maret, Coles melaporkan bahwa dengan pemberlakukan pembatasan empat pak tersebut, "banyak toko masih kehabisan dalam satu jam sejak pengiriman", dan menyebut permintaan tersebut "belum pernah terjadi sebelumnya", sementara ALDI, dalam sebuah postingan Facebook pada hari Selasa, menyebutnya "tidak terduga".
en-mt: In a media statement of March 8, Coles reported that with the four-pack limit in place, "many stores were still out of stock within an hour of shipping", calling the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday , calling it "unexpected".

sourceString: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
targetString: Penjualan "meningkat tajam" minggu lalu, menurut salah seorang juru bicara Woolworths.
en-mt: Sales "greatly increased" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.

sourceString: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
targetString: Toko Costco di Canberra juga membatasi jumlah yang diijinkan hingga dua pak minggu lalu.
en-mt: A Costco store in Canberra also capped the allowable quantity to two packs last week.

sourceString: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
targetString: Untuk menghindari kelangkaan, Coles memesan kemasan lebih besar dari pemasok dan meningkatkan frekuensi pengiriman, Woolworths memesan persediaan tambahan, sementara ALDI membuat persediaan untuk kegiatan promosi Rabu istimewa tersedia lebih awal.
en-mt: To avoid shortages, Coles ordered larger packs from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered additional supplies, while ALDI made supplies for its special Wednesday promotional activities available in advance.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman, direktur eksekutif Asosiasi Peritel Australia, mengatakan bahwa peritel mencoba meningkatkan persediaan, tetapi batasan badan pemerintah lokal untuk waktu pengiriman truk membuatnya sulit.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said retailers were trying to increase inventory, but local government agency limits on truck delivery times were making it difficult.

sourceString: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
targetString: Ia mengantisipasi kenaikan biaya produksi, selagi pemasok berusaha memenuhi permintaan, dan lebih sedikit promosi khusus.
en-mt: He anticipates rising production costs, as suppliers try to keep up with demand, and fewer special promotions.

sourceString: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
targetString: Pada hari Selasa, ALDI mengumumkan bahwa karena telah melepas persediaan lebih awal, beberapa toko tidak dapat mengadakan Rabu istimewa.
en-mt: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that due to the early release of supplies, some stores will not be able to have the special Wednesday.

sourceString: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
targetString: Dalam sebuah laporan News.com.au, Dr Gary Mortimer, pakar ritel dari Queensland University of Technology, mengatakan toko mengisi persediaan tiap malam.
en-mt: In a report by News.com.au, Dr Gary Mortimer, a retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said shops stocked up nightly.

sourceString: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
targetString: Ia menekankan bahwa tisu toilet adalah barang yang bervolume besar sehingga jumlah persediaannya rendah dan, jika habis terjual, membuat banyak ruang kosong di rak-rak sehingga kelangkaan barang semakin terasa.
en-mt: He emphasizes that toilet paper is a large-volume item, so inventory is low and, if sold out, leaves a lot of empty space on shelves, exacerbating scarcity.

sourceString: Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
targetString: Coles dan Woolworths berpendapat [bahwa] jika ada banyak barang di rak, jika produk seperti tisu toilet dan penyanitasi dapat [dibeli] dan ada dalam jumlah besar, kepanikan mungkin dapat diminimalkan, ujar Russel Zimmerman melalui Kantor Berita ABC.
en-mt: Coles and Woolworths think [that] if there's a lot of stuff on the shelves, if products like toilet paper and sanitizer can [be bought] and are in large quantities, panic might be minimized, Russell Zimmerman said via ABC News Service.

sourceString: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
targetString: Produsen tisu toilet daur ulang Who Gives a Crap mengatakan pada hari Rabu yang lalu bahwa mereka kehabisan persediaan.
en-mt: Recycled toilet paper manufacturer Who Gives a Crap said last Wednesday it was running out of supplies.

sourceString: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
targetString: Kimberly-Clark, yang membuat Tisu Toilet Kleenex, dan Solaris Paper, yang membuat Sorbent, menekankan mereka bekerja 24/7 untuk menjaga pasokan, menurut laporan News.com.au.
en-mt: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Paper, and Solaris Paper, which makes Sorbent, stress they are working 24/7 to maintain supply, according to a News.com.au report.

sourceString: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
targetString: Domain.com, sebuah situs real estat, melaporkan bahwa beberapa penjual properti menawarkan tisu toilet gratis kepada penawar pertama lelang di Melbourne, saat lebih sedikit lelang diadakan karena pembeli mengambil jeda untuk libur panjang akhir pekan Hari Buruh.
en-mt: Domain.com, a real estate website, reported that some property sellers were offering free toilet paper to the first bidders at the Melbourne auction, when fewer auctions were being held as buyers took a break for the long Labor Day weekend.

sourceString: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
targetString: Edisi Kamis NT News, sebuah harian yang dicetak di Darwin, menyertakan delapan halaman sisipan yang dimaksudkan untuk dipotong dan digunakan sebagai tisu toilet.
en-mt: Thursday's edition of the NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, includes eight insert pages intended to be cut out and used as toilet paper.

sourceString: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
targetString: Toko-toko sebetulnya enggan menerapkan batasan, menurut laporan ABC Australia pada 3 Maret, mereka mengatakan bahwa mereka tidak berencana untuk menerapkan batasan pembelian.
en-mt: Shops have been reluctant to put limits in place, according to a March 3 report by ABC Australia, saying they had no plans to put buying limits in place.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman menambahkan bahwa produk lain juga dalam permintaan tinggi, termasuk masker, penyanitasi, makanan kering, sabun cuci tangan, dan tepung.
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman added that other products were also in high demand, including masks, sanitisers, dry food, hand soap and flour.

sourceString: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
targetString: Begitu pula di luar Australia, pada Minggu sore supermarket daring Inggris Ocado diamati membatasi pembelian tisu toilet Andres hingga dua pak berisi 12 gulung.
en-mt: Likewise outside Australia, on Sunday afternoon British online supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two packs of 12 rolls.

sourceString: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
targetString: Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia (WHO) menyatakan COVID-19 sebagai pandemi
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic

sourceString: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
targetString: Pada hari Rabu, Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia (WHO) menyatakan wabah COVID-19 yang sedang terjadi—penyakit yang disebabkan oleh koronavirus SARS-CoV-2—sebagai pandemi.
en-mt: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19—the disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus—a pandemic.

sourceString: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
targetString: Walaupun kata "pandemi" hanya mengacu pada seberapa luas penyakit telah menyebar, bukan seberapa berbahaya kasus tersebut, WHO mencatat perlunya mendorong pemerintah untuk bertindak:
en-mt: While the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous a case is, the WHO notes the need to encourage governments to act:

sourceString: All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
targetString: Semua negara masih dapat mengubah perjalanan pandemi ini.
en-mt: All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.

sourceString: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response, said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
targetString: Jika negara mendeteksi, menguji, menangani, mengisolasi, dan memobilisasi rakyatnya sebagai respons, ujar Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, Direktur Jendral WHO.
en-mt: If the state detects, tests, treats, isolates and mobilizes its people in response, said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, WHO Director General.

sourceString: We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction.
targetString: Kami sangat waswas baik karena tingkat penyebaran dan keparahan yang menghawatirkan maupun karena tingkat kelambanan tindakan yang mengkhawatirkan.
en-mt: We are deeply concerned both because of the alarming level of spread and severity and because of the alarming level of slowness of action.

sourceString: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
targetString: Menurut Dr. Tom Frieden, mantan direktur Pusat Pengendalian dan Pencegahan Penyakit Amerika Serikat Amerika Serikat, pandemi ini "belum pernah terjadi sebelumnya."
en-mt: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, former director of the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, said the pandemic was "unprecedented."

sourceString: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
targetString: Ia mengatakan, dalam catatan yang dipublikasikan CNN pada bulan Februari, "selain influenza, tidak ada virus saluran pernapasan yang pernah dilacak dari kemunculannya hingga penyebaran global yang berkelanjutan."
en-mt: He said, in a note published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no respiratory virus has ever been traced from its emergence to sustained global distribution."

sourceString: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
targetString: Ghebreyesus menyatakan pandangan serupa, dengan mengatakan "kita belum pernah melihat pandemi yang dipicu oleh koronavirus."
en-mt: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."

sourceString: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
targetString: Ia melanjutkan, "dan kita belum pernah melihat pandemi yang dapat dikendalikan pada waktu yang bersamaan."
en-mt: He continued, "and we've never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."

sourceString: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
targetString: Status baru pandemi mengikuti keputusan WHO pada bulan Januari yang menyatakan wabah ini sebagai suatu kedaruratan kesahatan masyarakat yang meresahkan dunia.
en-mt: The new status of the pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of global concern.

sourceString: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
targetString: Direktur National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease Amerika Serikat, Dr. Anthony Fauci, mengatakan mengenai wabah ini, "intinya, wabah ini akan memburuk."
en-mt: Director of the United States National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "essentially, it's going to get worse."

sourceString: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
targetString: Hingga Kamis, Associated Press melaporkan terdapat setidaknya 126.000 kasus COVID-19 di seluruh dunia, yang mengakibatkan lebih dari 4.600 kematian.
en-mt: As of Thursday, the Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in more than 4,600 deaths.

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Pandemi koronavirus 2019-2020 adalah pandemi penyakit koronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) yang sedang berlanjut dan disebabkan oleh koronavirus sindrom pernapasan akut berat 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: The 2019-2020 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
targetString: Wabah diidentifikasi di Wuhan, Tiongkok, pada Desember 2019, dinyatakan sebagai suatu Kedaruratan Kesehatan Masyarakat yang Meresahkan Dunia pada 30 Januari 2020, dan dinyatakan sebagai pandemi pada 11 Maret 2020.
en-mt: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared a Public Health Emergency of Concern to the World on 30 January 2020, and declared a pandemic on 11 March 2020.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
targetString: Hingga 10 April 2020, sekitar 1,61 juta kasus COVID-19 telah dilaporkan di 210 negara dan wilayah teritorial, yang mengakibatkan sekitar 97.000 kematian.
en-mt: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.

sourceString: About 364,000 people have recovered.
targetString: Sekitar 364.000 orang telah sembuh.
en-mt: About 364,000 people have recovered.

sourceString: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
targetString: Angka fatalitas kasus diperkirakan 4% di Tiongkok, sementara di seluruh dunia berkisar mulai dari 13,04% hingga 0,08% di Selandia Baru.
en-mt: The case fatality rate is estimated at 4% in China, while worldwide it ranges from 13.04% to 0.08% in New Zealand.

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
targetString: Gejala umum meliputi demam, batuk, dan sesak napas.
en-mt: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Komplikasi dapat meliputi pneumonia dan sindrom gawat napas akut.
en-mt: Complications can include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Waktu sejak terpapar hingga awitan gejala pada umumnya sekitar lima hari, tetapi dapat berkisar mulai dari dua hingga empat belas hari.
en-mt: The time from exposure to the onset of symptoms is generally about five days, but can range from two to fourteen days.

sourceString: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
targetString: Belum ada vaksin yang diketahui atau pengobatan antivirus yang spesifik.
en-mt: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.

sourceString: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
targetString: Perawatan utama berupa terapi simptomatik dan suportif. Tindakan preventif yang direkomendasikan meliputi mencuci tangan, menutup mulut saat batuk, menjaga jarak dari orang lain, dan memantau serta isolasi mandiri bagi orang-orang yang diduga terinfeksi.
en-mt: The main treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy. Recommended preventive measures include washing hands, covering mouth when coughing, keeping distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people suspected of being infected.

sourceString: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
targetString: Otoritas di seluruh dunia telah merespons dengan memberlakukan batasan bepergian, karantina, jam malam, pengendalian bahaya tempat kerja, dan penutupan fasilitas.
en-mt: Authorities around the world have responded by imposing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls and facility closures.

sourceString: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
targetString: Pandemi ini telah menyebabkan gangguan sosial ekonomi global yang berat, penundaan atau pembatalan kegiatan budaya, politik, keagamaan, olah raga, dan luasnya kelangkaan pasokan barang yang diperparah dengan pembelian panik.
en-mt: This pandemic has caused severe global socio-economic disruption, delays or cancellations of cultural, political, religious, sporting activities, and widespread shortages in the supply of goods exacerbated by panic buying.

sourceString: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
targetString: Sekolah dan universitas telah ditutup baik di tingkat nasional maupun lokal di 193 negara, yang memengaruhi sekitar 99,4 persen populasi pelajar di seluruh dunia.
en-mt: Schools and universities have closed both nationally and locally in 193 countries, affecting around 99.4 percent of the worldwide student population.

sourceString: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
targetString: Misinformasi mengenai virus ini telah menyebar daring dan ada insiden xenofobia dan diskriminasi terhadap orang Tionghoa, orang dengan keturunan dan penampilan Asia Timur dan Tenggara, dan orang yang berasal dari area dengan kasus virus yang signifikan.
en-mt: Misinformation about the virus has spread online and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, people with East and Southeast Asian ancestry and appearance, and people coming from areas with significant cases of the virus.

sourceString: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
targetString: Akibat pengurangan perjalanan dan penutupan industri berat, polusi udara dan emisi karbon menurun.
en-mt: Due to reduced travel and the closure of heavy industry, air pollution and carbon emissions have decreased.

sourceString: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
targetString: Otoritas kesehatan di Wuhan, Tiongkok (ibukota propinsi Hubei), melaporkan klaster kasus pneumonia dengan penyebab tidak dikenal pada 31 Desember 2019 dan penyelidikan dilakukan pada awal Januari 2020.
en-mt: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (capital of Hubei province), reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on December 31, 2019 and an investigation was conducted in early January 2020.

sourceString: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Kasus-kasus tersebut sebagian besar terkait dengan Pasar Grosir Makanan Laut Huanan dan karena itu virus tersebut diduga memiliki asal zoonotik.
en-mt: The cases were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and the virus is therefore suspected to have a zoonotic origin.

sourceString: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
targetString: Virus yang menyebabkan wabah disebut SARS-CoV-2, virus yang baru ditemukan dan berkerabat dengan koronavirus kelelawar, koronavirus tenggiling, dan SARS-CoV. Orang pertama dengan gejala kemudian diketahui jatuh sakit pada 1 Desember 2019, dan orang tersebut tidak memiliki keterkaitan yang jelas dengan klaster pasar basah yang disebutkan kemudian.
en-mt: The virus that caused the outbreak is called SARS-CoV-2, a recently discovered virus that is related to the bat coronavirus, pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV. The first person with symptoms was later found to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and this person has no clear link to the wet market cluster mentioned later.

sourceString: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
targetString: Di antara klaster kasus awal yang dilaporkan pada Desember 2019, dua-pertiga didapati memiliki kaitan dengan pasar tersebut.
en-mt: Among the initial cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to be linked to that market.

sourceString: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
targetString: Pada 13 Maret 2020, sebuah laporan yang belum terverifikasi dari South China Morning Post memperkirakan bahwa sebuah kasus yang dapat ditelusuri ke tanggal 17 November 2019, pada seorang berusia 55 tahun dari provinsi Hubei, kemungkinan adalah yang pertama. Pada 26 Februari 2020, WHO melaporkan bahwa, dengan kasus baru dilaporkan menurun di Tiongkok, tetapi tiba-tiba meningkat di Italia, Iran, dan Korea Selatan, jumlah kasus baru di luar Tiongkok telah melampaui jumlah kasus baru di dalam Tiongkok untuk pertama kalinya.
en-mt: On March 13, 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post estimated that a case traceable to November 17, 2019, in a 55-year-old man from Hubei province, was likely the first. On February 26, 2020, WHO reported that, with new reported cases declining in China but suddenly increasing in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.

sourceString: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
targetString: Mungkin terdapat sejumlah besar kasus yang tidak dilaporkan, khususnya di antara orang dengan gejala yang lebih ringan.
en-mt: There may be a large number of unreported cases, especially among people with less severe symptoms.

sourceString: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
targetString: Hingga 26 Februari, relatif sedikit jumlah kasus yang dilaporkan di antara pemuda, dengan orang berumur 19 tahun ke bawah membentuk 2,4% kasus di seluruh dunia. Kepala penasihat ilmiah Inggris Raya, Patrick Vallance, memperkirakan bahwa 60% populasi Inggris perlu terinfeksi sebelum kekebalan kelompok dapat tercapai.
en-mt: As of 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youth, with people aged 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide. The UK's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimates that 60% of the UK's population would need to be infected before herd immunity can be achieved.

sourceString: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
targetString: Kasus mengacu pada jumlah orang yang telah diuji COVID-19 dan yang hasil ujinya telah dikonfirmasi positif menurut protokol resmi.
en-mt: Cases refer to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19 and whose test results have been confirmed positive according to official protocols.

sourceString: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
targetString: Hingga 23 Maret, belum ada negara yang menguji lebih dari 3% populasinya, dan banyak negara telah membuat kebijakan resmi untuk tidak menguji orang dengan gejala ringan, seperti Italia, Belanda, Spanyol, dan Swiss.
en-mt: As of March 23, no country has tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have made it official policy not to test people with mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain and Switzerland.

sourceString: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
targetString: Sebuah penelitian yang dipublikasikan pada 16 Maret menemukan bahwa di Tiongkok, hingga 23 Januari, diperkirakan 86% infeksi COVID-19 tidak terdeteksi, dan bahwa infeksi yang tidak terdokumentasi ini adalah sumber infeksi bagi 79% kasus yang terdokumentasi.
en-mt: A study published on March 16 found that in China, as of January 23, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections went undetected, and that this undocumented infection was the source of infection for 79% of documented cases.

sourceString: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
targetString: Sebuah analisis statistik yang dipublikasikan pada 30 Maret memperkirakan bahwa angka infeksi di Italia diperkirakan lebih besar daripada kasus yang dilaporkan.
en-mt: A statistical analysis published on March 30 suggested that Italy's infection rate is expected to be higher than the reported cases.

sourceString: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
targetString: Perkiraan awal dari angka reproduksi dasar (R0) untuk COVID-19 adalah 1,4 hingga 2,4.
en-mt: Preliminary estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 are 1.4 to 2.4.

sourceString: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
targetString: Sebuah penelitian yang dipublikasikan oleh Pusat Pengendalian dan Pencegahan Penyakit Amerika Serikat menyimpulkan bahwa angka tersebut kemungkinan 5,7.
en-mt: A study published by the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention concluded that the number might be 5.7.

sourceString: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
targetString: Kebanyakan penderita COVID-19 sembuh.
en-mt: Most people with COVID-19 recover.

sourceString: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
targetString: Untuk yang tidak sembuh, waktu sejak perkembangan gejala hingga kematian antara 6 dan 41 hari, dengan yang paling umum 14 hari.
en-mt: For those who did not recover, the time from the development of symptoms to death was between 6 and 41 days, with 14 days being the most common.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
targetString: Sejak 10 April 2020, sekitar 97.000 kematian dikaitkan dengan COVID-19.
en-mt: Since 10 April 2020, around 97,000 deaths have been linked to COVID-19.

sourceString: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
targetString: Di Tiongkok, hingga 5 Februari, sekitar 80% kematian terjadi pada orang berusia di atas 60 tahun dan 75% memiliki gangguan kesehatan yang sudah ada sebelumnya, yang meliputi penyakit kardiovaskular dan diabetes. Perhitungan kematian resmi akibat pandemi COVID-19 secara umum mengacu pada orang meninggal yang memberi hasil uji positif untuk COVID menurut protokol resmi.
en-mt: In China, as of February 5, about 80% of deaths occurred in people over 60 years of age and 75% had pre-existing health conditions, including cardiovascular disease and diabetes. The official tally of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refers to dead people who test positive for COVID according to official protocols.

sourceString: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
targetString: Angka fatalitas yang sebenarnya akibat COVID-19 mungkin jauh lebih tinggi, mengingat angka resmi kemungkinan tidak menyertakan orang yang meninggal tanpa diuji, misalnya, di rumah, di rumah perawatan, dsb.
en-mt: The true fatality rate from COVID-19 may be much higher, given that official figures may not include people who died without being tested, for example, at home, in hospice, etc.

sourceString: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
targetString: Data parsial dari Italia menemukan bahwa jumlah kelebihan angka kematian selama pandemi melampaui perhitungan kematian COVID resmi dengan faktor 4-5 kali lipat.
en-mt: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5 times.

sourceString: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
targetString: Seorang juru bicara wanita untuk Pusat Pengendalian dan Pencegahan Penyakit (CDC) AS mengakui, "Kami tahu [jumlah kematian yang diumumkan] itu lebih rendah daripada angka sebenarnya", sebuah pernyataan yang dikuatkan oleh laporan nonilmiah tentang perhitungan terlalu rendah di AS. Perhitungan yang terlalu rendah sering muncul dalam pandemi, seperti pada epidemi flu babi H1N1 tahun 2009. Kematian pertama terkonfirmasi adalah di Wuhan pada 9 Januari 2020.
en-mt: A spokeswoman for the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged, "We know the [declared death toll] is lower than the actual number", a statement corroborated by nonscientific reports of undercounting in the US. Undercounting often occurs in pandemics, such as during the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic. The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on January 9, 2020.

sourceString: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
targetString: Kematian pertama di luar Tiongkok daratan terjadi pada 1 Februari di Filipina, dan kematian pertama di luar Asia adalah di Prancis pada 14 Februari.
en-mt: The first death outside mainland China was on February 1 in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on February 14.

sourceString: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
targetString: Hingga 28 Februari, di luar Tiongkok daratan, lebih dari selusin kematian dicatat masing-masing di Iran, Korea Selatan, dan Italia.
en-mt: As of February 28, outside of mainland China, more than a dozen deaths were recorded in Iran, South Korea and Italy respectively.

sourceString: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: Hingga 13 Maret, lebih dari empat puluh negara dan wilayah teritorial telah melaporkan kematian, di setiap benua, kecuali Antartika. Pada umumnya, beberapa pengukuran digunakan untuk menghitung mortalitas.
en-mt: As of March 13, more than forty countries and territories have reported deaths, on every continent, except Antarctica. In general, several measures are used to calculate mortality.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: Angka ini bervariasi berdasarkan wilayah dan seiring waktu, serta dipengaruhi oleh jumlah pengujian, kualitas sistem perawatan kesehatan, opsi penanganan, waktu sejak wabah pertama, dan karakter populasi seperti usia, jenis kelamin, dan kesehatan secara keseluruhan. Rasio kematian terhadap kasus mencerminkan jumlah kematian dibagi jumlah kasus terdiagnosis dalam suatu interval waktu yang ditentukan.
en-mt: These rates vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the amount of testing, the quality of the health care system, treatment options, time since the first outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health. The death to case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases in a specified time interval.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
targetString: Menurut statistik Johns Hopkins University, rasio kematian terhadap kasus secara global adalah 6,0% (97.039/1.617.204) per 10 April 2020.
en-mt: According to statistics from Johns Hopkins University, the ratio of deaths to cases globally is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.
targetString: Angka ini bervariasi menurut wilayah.
en-mt: This figure varies by region.

sourceString: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: Di Tiongkok, perkiraan rasio kematian terhadap kasus menurun dari 17,3% (untuk orang dengan awitan gejala 1-10 Januari 2020) menjadi 0,7% (untuk orang dengan awitan gejala setelah 1 Februari 2020).Pengukuran lain meliputi angka fatalitas kasus (CFR), yang mencerminkan persentase orang terdiagnosis yang meninggal akibat penyakit tertentu, dan angka fatalitas infeksi (IFR), yang mencerminkan persentase orang terinfeksi (terdiagnosis dan tidak terdiagnosis) yang meninggal akibat penyakit tertentu.
en-mt: In China, the estimated death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for people with onset of symptoms January 1-10, 2020) to 0.7% (for people with onset of symptoms after February 1, 2020). Other measures include the case fatality rate ( CFR), which reflects the percentage of diagnosed people who die from a particular disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percentage of infected people (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a particular disease.

sourceString: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Statistik ini tidak terikat waktu dan mengikuti suatu populasi tertentu mulai dari infeksi hingga resolusi kasus.
en-mt: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection to case resolution.

sourceString: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
targetString: Sejumlah akademisi telah mencoba menghitung angka-angka ini untuk populasi tertentu.
en-mt: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these figures for specific populations.

sourceString: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
targetString: Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine University of Oxford memperkirakan angka fatalitas infeksi untuk pandemi secara keseluruhan antara 0,1% dan 0,39%.
en-mt: The University of Oxford's Center for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole to be between 0.1% and 0.39%.

sourceString: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
targetString: Batas atas rentang perkiraan ini sejalan dengan hasil dari pengujian acak pertama untuk COVID-19 di Jerman dan sebuah penelitan statistik yang menganalisis dampak pegujian pada perkiraan CFR.
en-mt: The upper bound of this forecast range is in line with results from the first randomized testing for COVID-19 in Germany and a statistical study analyzing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.

sourceString: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
targetString: WHO menegaskan bahwa pandemi ini dapat dikendalikan.
en-mt: WHO confirms that this pandemic can be controlled.

sourceString: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
targetString: Puncak dan akhir durasi wabah ini tidak jelas dan mungkin berbeda menurut lokasi.
en-mt: The peak and end of the duration of this outbreak is unclear and may vary by location.

sourceString: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
targetString: Maciej Boni dari Penn State University menyatakan, "Tanpa dikendalikan pun, wabah menular biasanya mendatar dan kemudian mulai menurun saat penyakit itu kehabisan inang yang tersedia.
en-mt: Maciej Boni of Penn State University states, "Even unchecked, infectious outbreaks usually level off and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.

sourceString: But it's almost impossible to make any sensible projection right now about when that will be".
targetString: Namun, hampir tidak mungkin untuk membuat proyeksi yang masuk akal saat ini tentang kapan hal itu terjadi".
en-mt: However, it is nearly impossible to make reasonable projections at this time of when that will happen."

sourceString: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries can be mobilized to follow the WHO's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.
targetString: Penasihat medis senior pemerintah Tiongkok Zhong Nanshan berpendapat bahwa " wabah ini mungkin berakhir Juni" jika seluruh negara dapat dimobilisasi untuk mengikuti saran WHO mengenai langkah-langka untuk menghentikan penyebaran virus.
en-mt: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "the outbreak may end in June" if the entire country could mobilize to follow WHO advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.

sourceString: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is going to be circulating, potentially for a year or two".
targetString: Pada 17 Maret, Adam Kucharski dari London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine menyatakan bahwa SRS-CoV-2 "akan terus beredar, kemungkinan hingga satu atau dua tahun."
en-mt: On March 17, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SRS-CoV-2 "will continue to circulate, probably for a year or two."

sourceString: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
targetString: Menurut penelitian Imperial College yang dipimpin oleh Neil Ferguson, pembatasan fisik dan langkah-langkah lain akan diperlukan "hingga vaksin tersedia (kemungkinan 18 bulan atau lebih)."
en-mt: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be needed "until a vaccine becomes available (18 months or more likely)."

sourceString: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
targetString: William Schaffner dari Vanderbilt University menyatakan, "Saya rasa kecil kemungkinan bahwa koronavirus ini, karena sangat mudah ditransmisikan, dapat menghilang seluruhnya" dan penyakit ini "mungkin berubah menjadi penyakit musiman, yang datang kembali setiap tahun."
en-mt: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it is unlikely that this coronavirus, because it is so easily transmitted, could completely disappear" and that the disease "might turn into a seasonal illness, which returns every year."

sourceString: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
targetString: Virulensi pengulangan akan tergantung pada kekebalan kelompok dan tingkat mutasi.
en-mt: The virulence of the repeat will depend on herd immunity and mutation rate.

sourceString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
targetString: Gejala COVID-19 bisa relatif tidak spesifik dan orang yang terinfeksi bisa tanpa gejala.
en-mt: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and people who are infected can be asymptomatic.

sourceString: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
targetString: Dua gejala paling umum adalah demam (88%) dan batuk kering (68%).
en-mt: The two most common symptoms were fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).

sourceString: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
targetString: Gejala yang kurang umum meliputi kelelahan, produksi sputum pernapasan (flegma), hilangnya daya penciuman, sesak napas, nyeri sendi dan otot, nyeri tenggorokan, sakit kepala, menggigil, muntah, hemoptisis, diare, atau sianosis. WHO menyatakan bahwa sekitar satu di antara enam orang menjadi sakit parah dan mengalami kesulitan bernapas.
en-mt: Less common symptoms include fatigue, production of respiratory sputum (phlegm), loss of smell, shortness of breath, joint and muscle pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, haemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis. WHO states that about one in six people becomes seriously ill and develops difficulty breathing.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
targetString: Pusat Pengendalian dan Pencegahan Penyakit (CDC) AS mencantumkan gejala darurat meliputi kesulitan bernapas, dada tertekan atau nyeri dada menetap, kebingungan mendadak, kesulitan berjalan, dan kebiruan pada wajah dan bibir; perhatian medis segera disarankan jika gejala-gejala ini muncul. Perkembangan penyakit lebih lanjut dapat menjadi pneumonia parah, sindrome gawat napas akut, sepsis, syok septik, dan kematian.
en-mt: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) list emergency symptoms as including difficulty breathing, chest tightness or persistent chest pain, sudden confusion, difficulty walking, and blueness of the face and lips; Immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms appear. Further disease progression can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock, and death.

sourceString: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.
targetString: Beberapa orang yang terinfeksi mungkin asimtomatik, yakni tanpa gejala klinis, tetapi dengan hasil tes yang mengonfirmasi infeksi, karena itu, peneliti menyarankan agar mereka yang kontak dekat dengan orang yang terkonfirmasi terinfeksi harus dipantau ketat dan diperiksa untuk memastikan tidak terinfeksi.
en-mt: Some infected people may be asymptomatic, that is, without clinical symptoms, but with test results confirming infection. Therefore, researchers suggest that those who are in close contact with people who are confirmed to be infected should be closely monitored and examined to ensure they are not infected.

sourceString: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from few to 44%.
targetString: Orang Tionghoa memperkirakan rasio asimtomatik berkisar dari beberapa hingga 44%.
en-mt: The Chinese estimate the asymptomatic ratio to range from a few to 44%.

sourceString: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
targetString: Periode inkubasi (waktu antara infeksi dan awitan gejala) biasanya berkisar antara 1 hingga 14 hari, paling sering 5 hari. Sebagai contoh ketidakpastian, perkiraan jumlah penderita COVID-19 yang kehilangan daya penciuman awalnya 30%, lalu menurun menjadi 15%.
en-mt: The incubation period (time between infection and the onset of symptoms) usually ranges from 1 to 14 days, most commonly 5 days. As an example of uncertainty, the estimated number of people with COVID-19 who have lost their sense of smell was initially 30%, then decreased to 15%.

sourceString: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
targetString: Perincian tentang cara penyakit ini menyebar masih diteliti.
en-mt: Details about how the disease spreads are still being researched.

sourceString: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
targetString: Penyebaran COVID-19 diyakini terutama terjadi pada waktu kontak dekat dan melalui droplet kecil yang dihasilkan sewaktu batuk, bersin, atau berbicara; kontak dekat adalah kontak dalam jarak 1 hingga 2 meter (3 sampai 6 kaki).
en-mt: It is believed that the spread of COVID-19 mainly occurs during close contact and through small droplets produced when coughing, sneezing or talking; close contact is contact within 1 to 2 meters (3 to 6 feet).

sourceString: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
targetString: Penelitian menemukan bahwa batuk yang tidak ditutupi dapat menyebabkan droplet terdorong 4,5 meter (15 kaki) hingga 8,2 meter (27 kaki).
en-mt: Research has found that uncovered coughing can cause droplets to be pushed 4.5 meters (15 feet) to 8.2 meters (27 feet).

sourceString: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.
targetString: Beberapa peneliti memperkirakan virus mungkin juga dapat ditularkan oleh droplet kecil yang bertahan lebih lama di udara dan dihasilkan ketika berbicara. Droplet pernapasan juga dapat dihasilkan saat mengembuskan napas, termasuk saat berbicara, meskipun virus ini umumnya tidak ditularkan melalui udara.
en-mt: Some researchers think the virus may also be transmitted by tiny droplets that last longer in the air and are produced when talking. Respiratory droplets can also be produced when exhaling, including when speaking, although this virus is generally not transmitted through the air.

sourceString: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
targetString: Droplet dapat jatuh di mulut atau hidung orang yang berada di dekatnya atau mungkin terhirup ke dalam paru-paru.
en-mt: Droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or they may be inhaled into the lungs.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Beberapa prosedur medis, seperti intubasi dan resusitasi jantung paru (RJP), bisa membuat sekret pernapasan berubah menjadi aerosol lalu tersebar lewat udara.
en-mt: Some medical procedures, such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), can turn respiratory secretions into aerosols and then disperse through the air.

sourceString: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Penyebaran juga dapat terjadi saat seseorang menyentuh permukaan yang terkontaminasi, termasuk kulit, lalu menyentuh mata, hidung, dan mulut.
en-mt: Spread can also occur when a person touches a contaminated surface, including the skin, and then touches their eyes, nose and mouth.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.
targetString: Walaupun ada kekhawatiran bahwa virus dapat menyebar melalui feses, risiko ini diyakini rendah.
en-mt: While there is concern that the virus could be spread through faeces, the risk is believed to be low.

sourceString: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
targetString: Pemerintah Tiongkok menampik kemungkinan transmisi SARS-CoV-2 secara fekal-oral.Virus paling menular dalam tiga hari pertama setelah awitan gejala, meskipun penyebaran mungkin terjadi sebelum gejala kelihatan dan pada tahap penyakit yang lebih lanjut.
en-mt: The Chinese government has ruled out the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2. The virus is most contagious within the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may occur before symptoms appear and at a more advanced stage of the disease.

sourceString: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
targetString: Orang memberi hasil uji positif hingga tiga hari sebelum awitan gejala, yang mengisyaratkan transmisi mungkin terjadi sebelum adanya gejala yang signifikan.
en-mt: People test positive up to three days before the onset of symptoms, which suggests transmission may have occurred before any significant symptoms.

sourceString: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
targetString: Hanya sedikit laporan kasus asimtomatik yang terkonfirmasi secara laboratorium, tetapi penularan asimtomatik telah diidentifikasi oleh beberapa negara sewaktu penyelidikan penelusuran kontak.
en-mt: There are few laboratory confirmed asymptomatic case reports, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by several countries during contact tracing investigations.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: Pusat Pencegahan dan Pengendalian Penyakit Eropa (ECDC) menyatakan bahwa meskipun belum jelas sepenuhnya seberapa mudah penyakit ini menyebar, satu orang umumnya menginfeksi dua hingga tiga orang lain. Virus ini dapat bertahan di permukaan selama berjam-jam hingga berhari-hari.
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it's not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three other people. The virus can survive on surfaces for hours to days.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.
targetString: Khususnya, ditemukan bahwa virus dapat dideteksi hingga tiga hari pada plastik (polipropilen) dan baja tahan karat 304, satu hari pada kardus, dan lebih dari empat jam pada tembaga.
en-mt: In particular, it was found that the virus was detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, one day on cardboard, and more than four hours on copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.
targetString: Namun, hal ini bervariasi tergantung pada kelembapan dan suhu. Hewan peliharaan dan hewan lainnya telah diuji positif COVID-19.
en-mt: However, this varies depending on humidity and temperature. Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.

sourceString: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
targetString: Tidak ada bukti bahwa hewan dapat menularkan virus kepada manusia, meskipun otoritas Inggris menyarankan untuk mencuci tangan setelah kontak dengan hewan, seperti setelah kontak dengan permukaan yang mungkin sudah disentuh orang yang terinfeksi.
en-mt: There is no evidence that animals can transmit the virus to humans, although UK authorities advise washing hands after contact with animals, such as after contact with surfaces an infected person may have touched.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Koronavirus sindrom pernapasan akut berat 2 (SARS-CoV-2) adalah virus baru, pertama kali diisolasi dari tiga orang penderita pneumonia yang terkait dengan klaster kasus penyakit pernapasan akut di Wuhan.
en-mt: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a new virus, isolated for the first time from three people with pneumonia associated with a cluster of acute respiratory disease cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Semua ciri virus SARS-CoV-2 baru terkait dengan koronavirus di alam. Di luar tubuh manusia, virus ini dapat hancur jika terkena sabun rumah tangga, yang melarutkan amplop pelindungnya. SARS-CoV-2 berkerabat erat dengan SARS-CoV awal.
en-mt: All features of the new SARS-CoV-2 virus are related to coronaviruses in nature. Outside the human body, the virus can be destroyed if it comes in contact with household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope. SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the early SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Virus diperkirakan memiliki asal zoonotik.
en-mt: Viruses are thought to have a zoonotic origin.

sourceString: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.
targetString: Analisis genetik mengungkapkan bahwa koronavirus secara genetik terklaster dengan genus Betacoronavirus, dalam subgenus Sarbecovirus (garis keturunan B) bersama dengan dua galur turunan kelelawar.
en-mt: Genetic analysis revealed that the coronavirus is genetically clustered with the genus Betacoronavirus, in the subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) along with two other bat-lined strains.

sourceString: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).
