targetString: Virus ini memiliki kesamaan 96% di tingkat seluruh genom dengan sampel koronavirus kelelawar lainnya (BatCov RaTG13).
en-mt: The virus shares 96% similarity at the whole genome level to another sample bat coronavirus (BatCov RaTG13).

sourceString: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.
targetString: Pada Februari 2020, peneliti Tionghoa menemukan bahwa hanya ada perbedaan satu asam amino di bagian-bagian tertentu sekuens genom antara virus tenggiling dan virus manusia.
en-mt: In February 2020, Chinese researchers discovered that there is only a one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequence between pangolin viruses and human viruses.

sourceString: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
targetString: Hingga saat ini, perbandingan seluruh genom menemukan paling banyak terdapat 92% kesamaan materi genetik antara koronavirus tenggiling dan SARS-CoV-2, tidak cukup untuk membuktikan bahwa tenggiling adalah inang perantara SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: To date, whole-genome comparisons have found that there is at most 92% similarity in genetic material between the pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, not sufficient to prove that pangolins are the intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.
targetString: Infeksi oleh virus dapat didiagnosis sementara berdasarkan gejala, tetapi konfirmasi pada akhirnya dilakukan melalui reaksi rantai polimerase transkripsi balik (rRT-PCR) pada sekret yang terinfeksi atau memalui pencitraan CT.
en-mt: Infection by a virus can be tentatively diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, but confirmation is ultimately accomplished by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) in infected secretions or by means of CT imaging.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: Sebuah penelitian yang membandingkan antara PCR dengan CT di Wuhan menunjukkan bahwa CT secara signifikan lebih sensitif daripada PCR, tetapi kurang spesifik, dengan banyaknya fitur pencitraan yang tumpang tindih dengan pneumonia dan proses penyakit lainnya.
en-mt: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan showed that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, but less specific, with many imaging features overlapping those of pneumonia and other disease processes.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".
targetString: Pada Maret 2020, American College of Radiology merekomendasikan "CT tidak boleh digunakan untuk penapisan atau sebagai uji lini pertama dalam mendiagnosis COVID-19."
en-mt: In March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommended "CT should not be used for screening or as a first-line test in diagnosing COVID-19."

sourceString: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.
targetString: WHO telah menerbitkan beberapa protokol pengujian RNA untuk SARS-CoV-2, yang diedarkan pertama kali pada 17 Januari.
en-mt: WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, which were first circulated on 17 January.

sourceString: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: Pengujian menggunakan reaksi rantai polimerase transkripsi balik real-time (rRT-PCR).
en-mt: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.
targetString: Pengujian dapat dilakukan pada sampel pernapasan atau darah.
en-mt: Testing can be done on a breath or blood sample.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
targetString: Hasil umumnya tersedia dalam beberapa jam hingga beberapa hari.
en-mt: Results are generally available within a few hours to a few days.

sourceString: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.
targetString: Umumnya, uji ini dilakukan pada usap nasofaring, tetapi usap tenggorokan juga dapat digunakan. Sejumlah laboratorium dan perusahaan sedang mengembangkan uji serologis yang mendeteksi antibodi.
en-mt: Generally, this test is performed on a nasopharyngeal swab, but a throat swab may also be used. A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests that detect antibodies.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.
targetString: Per 6 April 2020, tidak satu pun uji serologis ini terbukti cukup akurat untuk disetujui penggunaannya secara luas.
en-mt: As of April 6, 2020, none of these serological tests has proven sufficiently accurate to warrant widespread approval.

sourceString: In the US a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.
targetString: Di AS, uji serologis yang dikembangkan oleh Cellex telah disetujui untuk penggunaan darurat, hanya oleh laboratorium yang disertifikasi.
en-mt: In the US, the serological tests developed by Cellex have been approved for emergency use only by certified laboratories.

sourceString: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.
targetString: Karakteristik fitur pencitraan radiografi dan tomografi terkomputasi (CT) pada orang yang simtomatik mencakup opasitas ground glass perifer asimetri dan tidak ada efusi pleura.
en-mt: Characteristic radiographic and computed tomographic (CT) imaging features in a symptomatic person include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacity and absence of pleural effusion.

sourceString: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.
targetString: Italian Radiological Society sedang menyusun basis data daring internasional untuk temuan pencitraan pada kasus terkonfirmasi.
en-mt: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings in confirmed cases.

sourceString: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.
targetString: Karena tumpang tindih dengan infeksi lain seperti adenovirus, pencitraan tanpa konfirmasi PCR memiliki spesifisitas terbatas dalam mengidentifikasi COVID-19.
en-mt: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without PCR confirmation has limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.

sourceString: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.
targetString: Sebuah penelitian besar di Tiongkok membandingkan hasil CT dada dengan PCR dan menunjukkan bahwa meskipun kurang spesifik untuk infeksi, pencitraan lebih cepat dan lebih sensitif sehingga disarankan untuk dipertimbangkan sebagai alat penapisan di daerah epidemi.
en-mt: A large study in China compared the results of chest CT with PCR and showed that although it is less specific for infection, imaging is faster and more sensitive and so it is suggested to be considered as a screening tool in epidemic areas.

sourceString: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.
targetString: Jaringan neural konvolusi berbasis kecerdasan buatan telah dikembangkan untuk mendeteksi fitur pencitraan virus dengan radiografi dan CT.
en-mt: An artificial intelligence-based convolution neural network has been developed to detect imaging features of viruses by radiography and CT.

sourceString: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
targetString: Strategi untuk mencegah penularan penyakit ini mencakup menjaga kebersihan pribadi yang baik secara komprehensif, mencuci tangan, menghindari menyentuh mata, hidung, atau mulut sebelum mencuci tangan, dan memakai tisu saat batuk atau bersin serta langsung membuang tisu ke tempat sampah.
en-mt: Strategies to prevent transmission of this disease include maintaining comprehensive good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching eyes, nose or mouth before washing hands, and using a tissue when coughing or sneezing and throwing the tissue immediately in the trash.

sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
targetString: Orang yang mungkin sudah terinfeksi disarankan untuk memakai masker bedah di tempat umum.
en-mt: People who may already be infected are advised to wear a surgical mask in public.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Langkah-langkah pembatasan fisik juga direkomendasikan untuk mencegah penularan. Pemerintah di berbagai wilayah telah membatasi atau mengimbau untuk menghentikan semua perjalanan nonesensial ke dan dari negara dan daerah yang terkena dampak wabah.
en-mt: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission. Governments in various regions have restricted or advised to stop all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
targetString: Namun, virus telah mencapai tahap penyebaran skala masyarakat di sebagian besar wilayah di dunia.
en-mt: However, the virus has reached the stage of community-scale spread in most areas of the world.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: Ini berarti bahwa virus telah menyebar di masyarakat, dan beberapa anggota masyarakat tidak tahu di mana atau bagaimana mereka terinfeksi. Penyedia perawatan kesehatan yang menangani orang yang mungkin terinfeksi disarankan untuk melakukan tindakan pencegahan standar, tindakan pencegahan kontak, dan pelindung mata. Pelacakan kontak merupakan langkah penting bagi otoritas kesehatan untuk menentukan sumber infeksi dan mencegah penularan lebih lanjut.
en-mt: This means that the virus has spread in the community, and some members of the public do not know where or how they got infected. Health care providers treating people who may be infected are advised to take standard precautions, contact precautions and eye protection. Contact tracing is an important step for health authorities to determine the source of infection and prevent further transmission.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: Penggunaan data lokasi dari ponsel oleh pemerintah untuk tujuan ini telah memicu masalah privasi, dengan keluarnya pernyataan dari Amnesty International dan lebih dari 100 organisasi lainnya yang menyerukan pembatasan surveilans semacam ini.
en-mt: The government's use of location data from mobile phones for this purpose has raised privacy concerns, with statements from Amnesty International and more than 100 other organizations calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Berbagai aplikasi seluler telah diimplementasikan atau diusulkan untuk digunakan secara sukarela, dan pada 7 April 2020, lebih dari selusin kelompok pakar mengerjakan solusi ramah privasi, seperti menggunakan Bluetooth untuk mencatat kedekatan jarak pengguna ke ponsel lain.
en-mt: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, more than a dozen expert groups are working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other phones.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: Selanjutnya, pengguna akan menerima pesan jika mereka berdekatan dengan seseorang yang teruji positif untuk COVID-19.Beredar kesalahpahaman tentang cara mencegah infeksi; sebagai contoh, membilas hidung dan berkumur dengan obat kumur tidak efektif.
en-mt: Furthermore, users will receive a message if they are in close proximity to someone who has tested positive for COVID-19. There is a misunderstanding about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and rinsing with mouthwash are not effective.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
targetString: Belum ada vaksin COVID-19, meskipun banyak organisasi sedang bekerja untuk mengembangkannya.
en-mt: There is no COVID-19 vaccine yet, although many organizations are working to develop one.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: Mencuci tangan dianjurkan untuk mencegah penyebaran penyakit.
en-mt: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: CDC merekomendasikan agar orang sering mencuci tangan dengan sabun dan air selama setidaknya dua puluh detik, terutama setelah dari toilet atau ketika tangan terlihat kotor; sebelum makan; serta setelah mengembus hidung, batuk, atau bersin.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that people wash their hands frequently with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before meals; and after blowing the nose, coughing, or sneezing.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: Anjuran ini karena, di luar tubuh manusia, virus dibunuh oleh sabun rumah tangga yang merusak lapisan pelindungnya.
en-mt: This recommendation is because, outside the human body, viruses are killed by household soaps that damage their protective coating.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: Lebih lanjut, CDC merekomendasikan penggunaan penyanitasi tangan berbasis alkohol dengan kandungan alkohol sedikitnya 60% berdasarkan volume ketika sabun dan air tidak tersedia.
en-mt: Furthermore, the CDC recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with an alcohol content of at least 60% by volume when soap and water are not available.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: WHO menganjurkan agar orang tidak menyentuh mata, hidung, atau mulut sebelum mencuci tangan.
en-mt: WHO recommends that people do not touch their eyes, nose or mouth before washing their hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: Permukaan dapat didekontaminasi menggunakan sejumlah larutan (dalam satu menit paparan disinfektan untuk permukaan baja tahan karat), termasuk etanol 62–71%, isopropanol 50–100%, natrium hipoklorit 0,1%, hidrogen peroksida 0,5%, dan povidone-iodine 0,2–7,5%.
en-mt: Surfaces can be decontaminated using a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to a disinfectant for stainless steel surfaces), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and povidone-iodine 0.2–7.5%.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: Larutan lain, seperti benzalkonium klorida dan klorheksidin glukonat, kurang efektif.
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate, are less effective.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: CDC merekomendasikan bahwa jika terdapat kasus COVID terduga atau terkonfirmasi di fasilitas umum, seperti kantor atau tempat penitipan anak, semua area seperti kantor, kamar mandi, area umum, peralatan elektronik bersama seperti tablet, layar sentuh, keyboard, remote control, dan mesin ATM yang digunakan oleh penderita, harus didisinfeksi.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that if there is a suspected or confirmed case of COVID in a public facility, such as an office or daycare, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment such as tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and cash machines that are used by patients, must be disinfected.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: Organisasi kesehatan merekomendasikan agar orang menutupi mulut dan hidung mereka dengan siku yang ditekuk atau menggunakan tisu ketika batuk atau bersin, lalu segera membuang tisu.
en-mt: The health organization recommends that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or use a tissue when coughing or sneezing, then throw the tissue away immediately.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: Masker bedah direkomendasikan bagi orang yang mungkin telah terinfeksi sebab memakai masker dapat membatasi volume dan jarak tempuh droplet ekspiratori yang tersebar saat berbicara, bersin, dan batuk.
en-mt: Surgical masks are recommended for people who may already be infected because wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel of respiratory droplets that are spread when talking, sneezing, and coughing.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: WHO telah mengeluarkan instruksi tentang waktu dan cara pemakaian masker.
en-mt: WHO has issued instructions on when and how to wear a mask.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: Menurut Stephen Griffin, seorang ahli virologi di University of Leeds, "Memakai masker dapat mengurangi kecenderungan orang untuk menyentuh wajah dengan tangan yang tidak cukup bersih, yang merupakan sumber penularan utama."Masker juga direkomendasikan untuk dipakai oleh orang yang merawat orang lain yang mungkin menderita penyakit ini.
en-mt: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the tendency for people to touch their face with inadequately clean hands, which are a major source of transmission." Masks are also recommended for people caring for others who may have this disease.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: WHO merekomendasikan penggunaan masker oleh orang sehat hanya jika mereka berisiko tinggi, seperti orang yang merawat penderita COVID-19, meskipun WHO juga mengakui bahwa memakai masker dapat membantu mencegah orang menyentuh wajah mereka.
en-mt: WHO recommends the use of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as people caring for people with COVID-19, although the WHO also recognizes that wearing masks can help prevent people from touching their faces.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: Beberapa negara sudah mulai mendorong penggunaan masker kepada anggota masyarakat.
en-mt: Several countries have started encouraging the use of masks by members of the public.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: Di AS, CDC merekomendasikan penggunaan masker wajah nonmedis yang terbuat dari kain. Tiongkok secara spesifik merekomendasikan penggunaan masker medis sekali pakai kepada masyarakat yang sehat, terutama ketika berdekatan (1 meter (3 kaki) atau kurang) dengan orang lain.
en-mt: In the US, the CDC recommends the use of non-medical cloth face masks. China specifically recommends the use of disposable medical masks in healthy people, especially when in close proximity (1 meter (3 feet) or less) to other people.

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: Hong Kong merekomendasikan pemakaian masker bedah saat menggunakan angkutan umum atau tinggal di tempat yang ramai.
en-mt: Hong Kong recommends wearing surgical masks when using public transport or staying in crowded places.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: Pejabat kesehatan Thailand menganjurkan orang untuk membuat masker kain di rumah dan mencucinya setiap hari.
en-mt: Thai health officials are advising people to make cloth masks at home and wash them daily.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: Republik Ceko dan Slovakia melarang masyarakatnya keluar ke tempat umum tanpa mengenakan masker atau menutupi hidung dan mulut.
en-mt: The Czech Republic and Slovakia have banned people from going out in public without wearing a mask or covering their nose and mouth.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: Pada 16 Maret, Vietnam meminta semua warganya untuk mengenakan masker wajah saat pergi ke tempat umum untuk melindungi diri sendiri dan orang lain.
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam asked all its citizens to wear face masks when going out in public to protect themselves and others.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: Pemerintah Austria mengharuskan setiap orang yang memasuki toserba untuk mengenakan masker wajah.
en-mt: The Austrian government requires everyone entering a convenience store to wear a face mask.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: Israel meminta semua warganya untuk memakai masker wajah saat berada di tempat umum.
en-mt: Israel asks all its citizens to wear face masks when in public places.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: Taiwan, yang memproduksi sepuluh juta masker per hari sejak pertengahan Maret, mewajibkan penumpang kereta api dan bus antarkota mengenakan masker wajah per 1 April.
en-mt: Taiwan, which has been producing 10 million masks per day since mid-March, made it mandatory for passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks from April 1.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: Panama mewajibkan penggunaan masker wajah setiap kali ke luar rumah, serta merekomendasikan pembuatan masker wajah buatan sendiri bagi mereka yang tidak dapat membeli masker wajah.
en-mt: Panama requires the use of face masks whenever outside the home, and recommends making homemade face masks for those who cannot afford them.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: Masker wajah juga digunakan secara luas di Jepang, Korea Selatan, Malaysia, dan Singapura.
en-mt: Face masks are also widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia and Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: Pembatasan sosial (yang disebut juga pembatasan fisik) merupakan tindakan pengendalian infeksi yang dimaksudkan untuk memperlambat penyebaran penyakit dengan meminimalkan kontak dekat antar individu.
en-mt: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) is an infection control measure intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: Metode pembatasan sosial meliputi karantina; pembatasan perjalanan; serta penutupan sekolah, tempat kerja, stadion, teater, atau pusat perbelanjaan.
en-mt: Social distancing methods include quarantine; travel restrictions; and the closure of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theaters or shopping centers.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: Orang dapat menerapkan metode pembatasan sosial dengan tinggal di rumah, membatasi perjalanan, menghindari daerah ramai, menggunakan salam tanpa kontak, dan menjaga jarak fisik dari orang lain.
en-mt: People can apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using contactless greetings, and maintaining physical distance from other people.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Saat ini, banyak pemerintahan mewajibkan atau mengimbau pembatasan sosial di daerah yang terdampak wabah.
en-mt: Currently, many governments require or encourage social restrictions in areas affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: Jumlah maksimum orang berkumpul yang direkomendasikan oleh badan-badan pemerintah AS dan organisasi kesehatan dengan cepat dikurangi, mulai dari 250 orang (jika tidak diketahui adanya sebaran COVID-19 di suatu wilayah) menjadi 50 orang, dan kemudian menjadi 10 orang.
en-mt: The maximum number of people gathering recommended by US government agencies and health organizations was quickly reduced, from 250 people (if there is no known spread of COVID-19 in an area) to 50 people, and then to 10 people.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: Pada 22 Maret 2020, Jerman melarang pertemuan di area publik yang melibatkan lebih dari dua orang. Lansia dan orang dengan kondisi medis mendasari seperti diabetes, penyakit jantung, penyakit pernapasan, hipertensi, dan sistem imun terganggu yang memiliki risiko penyakit serius dan komplikasi lebih tinggi disarankan CDC untuk sebisa mungkin di rumah saja di daerah yang mengalami wabah di tingkat masyarakat. Pada akhir Maret 2020, WHO dan badan kesehatan lainnya mulai mengganti penggunaan istilah "pembatasan sosial" menjadi "pembatasan fisik", untuk memperjelas bahwa tujuannya adalah untuk mengurangi kontak fisik dengan tetap menjaga hubungan sosial, baik secara virtual atau dari jarak jauh.
en-mt: On March 22, 2020, Germany banned gatherings in public areas of more than two people. The elderly and people with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems who are at higher risk of serious illness and complications are advised by the CDC to stay at home as much as possible in areas experiencing community-level outbreaks. In late March 2020, WHO and other health agencies began changing the term "social distancing" to "physical distancing", to make it clear that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social contact, whether virtually or remotely.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: Penggunaan istilah "pembatasan sosial" memberi kesan bahwa orang harus mengisolasi diri sepenuhnya secara sosial dan tidak mendorong orang untuk tetap berhubungan dengan orang lain melalui cara-cara alternatif. Beberapa otoritas telah mengeluarkan pedoman kesehatan seksual untuk digunakan selama masa pandemi.
en-mt: The use of the term "social distancing" suggests that people should completely isolate themselves socially and discourage people from staying in contact with others through alternative means. Several authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: Rekomendasi ini mencakup anjuran untuk berhubungan seks hanya dengan orang yang tinggal bersama Anda dan tidak memiliki virus atau gejala virus.
en-mt: These recommendations include advice to have sex only with people you live with and who do not have the virus or symptoms of a virus.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: Isolasi mandiri di rumah direkomendasikan bagi orang yang didiagnosis menderita COVID-19 dan orang yang diduga terinfeksi.
en-mt: Self-isolation at home is recommended for people diagnosed with COVID-19 and people suspected of being infected.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: Badan-badan kesehatan telah mengeluarkan instruksi terperinci untuk isolasi mandiri yang benar. Banyak pemerintah mewajibkan atau merekomendasikan karantina mandiri untuk seluruh populasi yang tinggal di daerah yang terdampak.
en-mt: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation. Many governments require or recommend self-quarantine for the entire population living in affected areas.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: Instruksi karantina mandiri paling ketat dikeluarkan bagi orang-orang yang termasuk kelompok berisiko tinggi.
en-mt: The strictest self-quarantine instructions are issued for people belonging to high-risk groups.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: Orang yang mungkin terpapar penderita COVID-19 dan orang yang baru-baru ini bepergian ke negara atau wilayah dengan penyebaran COVID-19 yang luas disarankan untuk melakukan karantina mandiri selama 14 hari sejak waktu kemungkinan paparan terakhir.
en-mt: People who may have been exposed to COVID-19 and people who have recently traveled to countries or regions with widespread transmission of COVID-19 are advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: Strategi dalam pengendalian wabah adalah pembendungan atau supresi, serta mitigasi.
en-mt: The strategy for controlling outbreaks is containment or suppression, as well as mitigation.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: Pembendungan dilakukan pada tahap awal wabah dan bertujuan untuk melacak dan mengisolasi orang yang terinfeksi serta melakukan langkah-langkah lain untuk pengendalian infeksi dan vaksinasi yang bertujuan menghentikan penyebaran penyakit ke seluruh populasi.
en-mt: Containment is carried out in the early stages of an outbreak and aims to trace and isolate infected people as well as carry out other measures of infection control and vaccination aimed at stopping the spread of the disease throughout the population.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: Ketika tidak mungkin lagi untuk membendung penyebaran penyakit, upaya selanjutnya beralih ke tahap mitigasi: langkah-langkah ini diambil untuk memperlambat penyebaran dan mengurangi dampaknya pada sistem perawatan kesehatan dan masyarakat.
en-mt: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of a disease, efforts then move on to the mitigation phase: these steps are taken to slow its spread and reduce its impact on the health care system and society.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: Kombinasi tindakan pembendungan dan mitigasi dapat dilakukan pada saat yang bersamaan.
en-mt: A combination of containment and mitigation measures can be implemented at the same time.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: Supresi membutuhkan langkah-langkah yang lebih ekstrem untuk membalikkan pandemi dengan mengurangi angka reproduksi dasar menjadi kurang dari 1.Bagian dari pengelolaan wabah penyakit menular adalah berusaha untuk menurunkan puncak epidemi, yang dikenal dengan melandaikan kurva epidemi.
en-mt: Suppression requires more extreme measures to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1. Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to lower the peak of the epidemic, which is known as flattening the epidemic curve.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: Hal ini menurunkan risiko kewalahan pada layanan kesehatan dan memberikan lebih banyak waktu untuk pengembangan vaksin dan pengobatan.
en-mt: This lowers the risk of being overwhelmed by health services and allows more time for vaccine and treatment development.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: Intervensi nonfarmasi untuk menangani wabah meliputi tindakan pencegahan individu, seperti kebersihan tangan, memakai masker wajah, dan karantina mandiri; langkah-langkah di tingkat masyarakat yang ditujukan untuk pembatasan fisik, seperti menutup sekolah dan membatalkan acara pertemuan massal; pelibatan masyarakat untuk mendorong penerimaan dan partisipasi dalam intervensi semacam ini; serta langkah-langkah di tingkat lingkungan, seperti pembersihan permukaan. Tindakan drastis lainnya yang bertujuan untuk membendung wabah dilakukan di Tiongkok saat keparahan wabah semakin nyata, seperti mengarantina seluruh kota dan memberlakukan larangan perjalanan yang ketat.
en-mt: Non-pharmaceutical interventions to manage outbreaks include individual precautions, such as hand hygiene, wearing face masks and self-quarantine; community-level measures aimed at physical distancing, such as closing schools and canceling mass gatherings; community engagement to encourage acceptance of and participation in such interventions; as well as measures at the environmental level, such as surface cleaning. Other drastic measures aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China as the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: Negara-negara lain juga menerapkan berbagai langkah yang bertujuan untuk membatasi penyebaran virus.
en-mt: Other countries are also implementing various measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: Korea Selatan memperkenalkan penapisan massal dan karantina setempat, serta mengeluarkan peringatan tentang pergerakan orang yang terinfeksi.
en-mt: South Korea introduced mass screening and local quarantines, and issued warnings about the movement of infected people.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: Singapura memberikan dukungan finansial bagi orang terinfeksi yang melakukan karantina mandiri dan mengenakan denda besar bagi orang yang gagal melakukannya.
en-mt: Singapore provides financial support for infected people who self-quarantine and imposes hefty fines for those who fail to do so.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: Taiwan meningkatkan produksi masker wajah dan menghukum penimbun persediaan medis. Simulasi untuk Inggris dan Amerika Serikat menunjukkan bahwa mitigasi (memperlambat, tetapi tidak menghentikan penyebaran epidemi) dan supresi (membalikkan pertumbuhan epidemi) memiliki tantangan besar.
en-mt: Taiwan ramped up production of face masks and punished hoarders of medical supplies. Simulations for the UK and US show that both mitigation (slowing, but not stopping the spread of the epidemic) and suppression (reversing the growth of the epidemic) pose major challenges.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: Kebijakan mitigasi yang optimal dapat mengurangi puncak permintaan akan perawatan kesehatan hingga 2/3 dan kematian hingga setengahnya, tetapi masih mengakibatkan ratusan ribu kematian dan sistem kesehatan yang kewalahan.
en-mt: Optimal mitigation policies can reduce peak health care demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and overstretched health systems.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: Supresi bisa dipilih, tetapi perlu dipertahankan selama virus masih beredar di populasi manusia (atau sampai vaksin tersedia, jika ini yang pertama dicapai), karena jika tidak, penularan akan melonjak kembali dengan cepat saat langkah-langkah supresi dikendurkan.
en-mt: Suppression is optional, but needs to be maintained as long as the virus is still circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if this is the first achieved), otherwise transmission will spike back quickly when suppression measures are relaxed.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: Intervensi jangka panjang untuk menekan pandemi membawa dampak pada sosial dan ekonomi.
en-mt: Long-term interventions to suppress the pandemic have social and economic impacts.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: Belum ada obat antivirus spesifik yang disetujui untuk COVID-19, tetapi upaya pengembangan sedang dilakukan, yang mencakup pengujian obat yang sudah ada.
en-mt: There are no specific antiviral drugs approved for COVID-19 yet, but development efforts are under way, which includes testing existing drugs.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: Mengonsumsi obat flu yang dijual bebas, minum cukup air, dan istirahat dapat membantu meringankan gejala.
en-mt: Taking over-the-counter cold medicines, drinking enough water, and getting rest can help relieve symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: Tergantung pada tingkat keparahan, terapi oksigen, cairan intravena, dan dukungan pernapasan mungkin dibutuhkan.
en-mt: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and respiratory support may be needed.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: Penggunaan steroid dapat memperburuk kondisi pasien.
en-mt: The use of steroids can worsen the patient's condition.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: Beberapa senyawa yang sebelumnya disetujui untuk pengobatan penyakit virus lain sedang diteliti untuk digunakan dalam mengobati COVID-19.
en-mt: Several compounds previously approved for the treatment of other viral diseases are being studied for use in treating COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: WHO juga menyatakan bahwa beberapa "pengobatan tradisional dan rumahan" dapat meredakan gejala yang disebabkan oleh SARS-CoV-19.
en-mt: The WHO also states that some "traditional and home remedies" can relieve symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: WHO mengatakan bahwa meningkatkan kapasitas dan mengadaptasi layanan kesehatan untuk kebutuhan pasien COVID-19 merupakan langkah dasar dalam merespon wabah.
en-mt: WHO says that increasing capacity and adapting health services to the needs of COVID-19 patients are fundamental steps in responding to the outbreak.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: ECDC dan kantor WHO regional Eropa telah mengeluarkan pedoman untuk rumah sakit dan layanan kesehatan primer supaya mengalihkan sumber daya di berbagai tingkatan, termasuk memfokuskan layanan laboratorium untuk pengujian COVID-19, jika memungkinkan membatalkan prosedur elektif, memisahkan dan mengisolasi pasien positif COVID-19, serta meningkatkan kemampuan perawatan intensif dengan melatih personel serta meningkatkan jumlah ventilator dan tempat tidur.
en-mt: The ECDC and the European regional WHO office have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary health care to redirect resources at various levels, including focusing laboratory services on testing for COVID-19, canceling elective procedures where possible, segregating and isolating positive COVID-19 patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of ventilators and beds.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: Ada berbagai teori tentang asal kasus pertama (yang disebut pasien nol).
en-mt: There are various theories about the origin of the first case (the so-called patient zero).

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: Kasus koronavirus baru yang pertama diketahui dapat ditelusuri ke tanggal 1 Desember 2019 di Wuhan, Hubei, Tiongkok.
en-mt: The first known case of the new coronavirus can be traced to December 1, 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: Dalam sebulan, jumlah kasus koronavirus di Hubei meningkat secara bertahap.
en-mt: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei increased gradually.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Kasus-kasus ini sebagian besar terkait dengan Pasar Grosir Makanan Laut Huanan, yang juga menjual hewan hidup, dan satu teori mengatakan bahwa virus berasal dari salah satu jenis hewan ini; atau, dengan kata lain, virus memiliki asal zoonotik. Sebuah klaster pneumonia dengan penyebab tidak dikenal teramati pada 26 Desember dan ditangani oleh dokter Zhang Jixian di Rumah Sakit Provinsi Hubei, yang memberi tahu CDC Jianghan Wuhan pada 27 Desember.
en-mt: These cases are mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sells live animals, and one theory is that the virus originated in one of these types of animals; or, in other words, viruses have a zoonotic origin. A cluster pneumonia of unknown cause was observed on December 26 and treated by doctor Zhang Jixian at the Hubei Provincial Hospital, who notified the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on December 27.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: Pada 30 Desember, sekelompok dokter di Rumah Sakit Pusat Wuhan memberi tahu rekan mereka tentang "koronavirus mirip SARS".
en-mt: On December 30, a group of doctors at the Central Hospital of Wuhan informed their colleagues about the "SARS-like coronavirus".

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: Delapan dari dokter ini, termasuk Li Wenliang, diperingatkan oleh polisi karena menyebarkan desas-desus palsu, dan yang lain, Ai Fen, ditegur oleh atasannya karena peringatan yang dikeluarkannya.
en-mt: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were warned by the police for spreading false rumors, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by his superiors for his warning.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: Komisi Kesehatan Kota Wuhan kemudian mengeluarkan pengumuman kepada publik pada 31 Desember dan memberi tahu WHO.
en-mt: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission then issued a public announcement on December 31 and notified WHO.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: Cukup banyak kasus pneumonia tidak dikenal dilaporkan kepada otoritas kesehatan di Wuhan yang kemudian memicu penyelidikan pada awal Januari. Pada tahap awal wabah, jumlah kasus meningkat dua kali lipat setiap tujuh setengah hari.
en-mt: A number of cases of unidentified pneumonia were reported to health authorities in Wuhan which prompted an investigation in early January. In the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled every seven and a half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: Pada awal dan pertengahan Januari 2020, virus menyebar ke provinsi-provinsi Tiongkok yang lain, didukung oleh migrasi saat Tahun Baru Imlek dan karena Wuhan merupakan pusat transportasi dan tempat transit kereta api utama.
en-mt: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, supported by migration during the Lunar New Year and because Wuhan is a transportation hub and a major rail transit point.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: Pada 20 Januari, Tiongkok melaporkan hampir 140 kasus baru dalam sehari, termasuk dua orang di Beijing dan satu orang di Shenzhen.
en-mt: On January 20, China reported nearly 140 new cases in a day, including two people in Beijing and one person in Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: Data resmi selanjutnya menunjukkan bahwa 6.174 orang telah mengalami gejala pada 20 Januari 2020.Per 26 Maret, Amerika Serikat telah melampaui Tiongkok dan Italia dengan jumlah kasus terkonfirmasi tertinggi di dunia. Hingga 9 April 2020, lebih dari 1,61 juta kasus telah dilaporkan di seluruh dunia; lebih dari 97.000 orang meninggal dunia dan lebih dari 364.000 sembuh.
en-mt: Further official data shows that 6,174 people have developed symptoms as of January 20, 2020. As of March 26, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world. As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people died and more than 364,000 recovered.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: Sekitar 200 negara dan wilayah teritorial memiliki setidaknya satu kasus.
en-mt: About 200 countries and territories have at least one case.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: Karena pandemi di Eropa, banyak negara di Wilayah Schengen membatasi pergerakan bebas dan membuat kontrol perbatasan.
en-mt: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area are restricting free movement and establishing border controls.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: Tanggapan nasional meliputi langkah-langkah pembendungan, seperti karantina (dikenal sebagai perintah tinggal di rumah, perintah berlindung di tempat, atau karantina wilayah) dan jam malam. Pada 2 April, hampir 300 juta orang, atau sekitar 90% populasi, berada dalam sejenis karantina wilayah di Amerika Serikat, lebih dari 50 juta orang dikarantina wilayah di Filipina, sekitar 59 juta orang dikarantina wilayah di Afrika Selatan, dan 1,3 miliar orang dikarantina wilayah di India.
en-mt: National responses have included containment measures, such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdowns) and curfews. As of April 2, nearly 300 million people, or approximately 90% of the population, were in some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people were in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people were in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people lockdown in India.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: Pada 26 Maret, 1,7 miliar orang di seluruh dunia berada dalam sejenis kondisi karantina wilayah, yang meningkat menjadi 2,6 miliar orang dua hari kemudian, yakni sekitar sepertiga dari populasi dunia.
en-mt: On March 26, 1.7 billion people worldwide were in some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later, which is about a third of the world's population.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: Kasus COVID-19 terkonfirmasi pertama dapat ditelusuri kembali ke tanggal 1 Desember 2019 di Wuhan; satu laporan yang belum terkonfirmasi menunjukkan kasus paling awal pada 17 November.
en-mt: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 can be traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report points to the earliest case on 17 November.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Dokter Zhang Jixian mengamati klaster kasus pneumonia dengan penyebab tidak dikenal pada 26 Desember; pengamatan ini diberitahukan rumah sakitnya kepada CDC Jianghan pada 27 Desember.
en-mt: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on December 26; this observation notified her hospital to the Jianghan CDC on December 27.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: Pengujian genetik awal sampel pasien pada 27 Desember 2019 mengindikasikan adanya koronavirus mirip SARS.
en-mt: Preliminary genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: Pengumuman kepada publik dirilis oleh Komisi Kesehatan Kota Wuhan pada 31 Desember.
en-mt: A public announcement was made by the Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on December 31.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: WHO diberi tahu pada hari yang sama.
en-mt: WHO was notified the same day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: Ketika pemberitahuan ini dilaksanakan, dokter di Wuhan diperingatkan oleh polisi karena "menyebarkan desas-desus" tentang wabah tersebut.
en-mt: When this notification was carried out, doctors in Wuhan were warned by the police for "spreading rumors" about the outbreak.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Komisi Kesehatan Nasional Republik Rakyat Tiongkok pada awalnya mengklaim bahwa tidak ada "bukti jelas" penularan dari manusia ke manusia.
en-mt: The National Health Commission of the People's Republic of China initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Pada akhir Januari, pemerintah Tiongkok meluncurkan kampanye radikal yang kemudian dijelaskan oleh sekretaris jenderal Partai Komunis Tiongkok Xi Jinping sebagai "perang rakyat" untuk membendung penyebaran virus.
en-mt: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign that was later described by Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to stem the spread of the virus.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: Dalam karantina yang disebut sebagai "karantina terbesar dalam sejarah manusia", cordon sanitaire atau pembatas kebersihan diumumkan pada 23 Januari untuk menghentikan perjalanan masuk dan keluar Wuhan, dan diperluas ke total 15 kota di Hubei, yang memengaruhi total sekitar 57 juta orang.
en-mt: In a quarantine billed as "the largest quarantine in human history", the cordon sanitaire or hygiene barrier was announced on January 23 to stop travel in and out of Wuhan, and was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: Penggunaan kendaraan pribadi dilarang di dalam kota.
en-mt: The use of private vehicles is prohibited in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: Perayaan Tahun Baru Imlek (25 Januari) dibatalkan di banyak tempat.
en-mt: Chinese New Year (January 25) celebrations were canceled in many places.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: Pihak berwenang juga mengumumkan pembangunan rumah sakit sementara, Rumah Sakit Huoshenshan, yang selesai dalam waktu 10 hari.
en-mt: Authorities also announced construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, to be completed within 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: Rumah sakit lain juga dibangun setelahnya, Rumah Sakit Leishenshan, untuk menangani pasien tambahan.
en-mt: Another hospital was built later, Leishenshan Hospital, to treat additional patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: Selain rumah sakit yang baru dibangun, Tiongkok juga mengubah 14 fasilitas lain di Wuhan, seperti pusat konvensi dan stadion, menjadi rumah sakit sementara. Pada 26 Januari, pemerintah menyusun langkah-langkah lebih lanjut untuk membendung wabah COVID-19, termasuk mengeluarkan deklarasi kesehatan untuk para turis dan memperpanjang liburan Festival Musim Semi.
en-mt: As well as the newly built hospital, China is also converting 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as a convention center and stadium, into temporary hospitals. On January 26, the government laid out further steps to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing a health declaration for tourists and extending the Spring Festival holiday.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: Seluruh universitas dan sekolah di dalam negeri juga ditutup.
en-mt: All universities and schools in the country are also closed.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: Wilayah Hong Kong dan Makau menerapkan beberapa langkah, khususnya dalam hal sekolah dan universitas.
en-mt: The Hong Kong and Macau regions are implementing several measures, particularly in terms of schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: Langkah-langkah untuk bekerja dari jarak jauh diterapkan di beberapa daerah di Tiongkok.
en-mt: Measures to work remotely are implemented in some areas of China.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: Pembatasan perjalanan diberlakukan di dalam dan di luar Hubei.
en-mt: Travel restrictions are in place inside and outside Hubei.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: Angkutan umum dimodifikasi dan museum di seluruh Tiongkok ditutup sementara.
en-mt: Public transport was modified and museums across China were temporarily closed.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: Pengendalian terhadap pergerakan publik diterapkan di banyak kota, dan diperkirakan sekitar 760 juta orang (lebih dari separuh populasi) menghadapi semacam pembatasan di luar rumah. Setelah wabah memasuki fase global pada bulan Maret, otoritas Tiongkok mengambil langkah-langkah ketat untuk mencegah "mengimpor" virus dari negara lain.
en-mt: Controls on public movement are in place in many cities, and it is estimated that around 760 million people (more than half of the population) face some form of restriction outside the home. After the outbreak entered the global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent "importing" the virus from other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: Sebagai contoh, Beijing memberlakukan karantina wajib 14 hari untuk semua turis internasional yang masuk kota. Pada 23 Maret, satu-satunya kasus Tiongkok daratan ditransmisikan di dalam negeri lima hari sebelumnya, dalam hal ini melalui seorang turis yang kembali ke Guangzhou dari Istanbul.
en-mt: For example, Beijing enforces a mandatory 14-day quarantine for all international tourists entering the city. On March 23, the mainland China's only case was transmitted domestically five days earlier, in this case via a tourist returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: Pada 24 Maret 2020, Perdana Menteri Tiongkok Li Keqiang melaporkan bahwa penyebaran kasus yang ditransmisikan di dalam negeri pada dasarnya telah diblokir dan wabah telah dikendalikan di Tiongkok.
en-mt: On March 24, 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases had been basically blocked and the outbreak had been brought under control in China.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: Pembatasan perjalanan pada hari yang sama dilonggarkan di Hubei, selain dari Wuhan, dua bulan setelah karantina wilayah diberlakukan. Kementrian Luar Negeri Republik Rakyat Tiongkok mengumumkan pada 26 Maret 2020 bahwa entri untuk pemegang visa atau izin tinggal akan ditangguhkan mulai 28 Maret dan seterusnya, tanpa ada perincian spesifik tentang waktu kebijakan ini akan berakhir.
en-mt: Same-day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China announced on March 26, 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders will be suspended from March 28 onwards, without making any specific details on when this policy will end.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: Orang yang ingin masuk ke Tiongkok harus mengajukan visa di kedutaan atau konsulat Tiongkok.
en-mt: People wishing to enter China must apply for a visa at the Chinese embassy or consulate.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: Pada 30 Maret, pemerintah Tiongkok mendorong bisnis dan pabrik untuk buka kembali dan menyediakan paket stimulus moneter untuk perusahaan. Dewan Negara mengumumkan hari berkabung dengan memulai tiga menit mengheningkan cipta nasional pada 4 April pukul 10:00, bertepatan dengan Festival Qingming, meskipun pemerintah pusat meminta keluarga untuk memberikan penghormatan secara daring dengan memperhatikan pembatasan fisik untuk menghindari wabah COVID-19 yang baru.
en-mt: On March 30, the Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to reopen and provided a monetary stimulus package for companies. The State Council declared a day of mourning by commencing a three-minute national silence on April 4 at 10:00 a.m., coinciding with the Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing to avoid a new COVID-19 outbreak.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: Pada 20 Januari 2020, COVID-19 dikonfirmasi telah menyebar ke Korea Selatan dari Tiongkok.
en-mt: On January 20, 2020, COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea from China.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: Pada 20 Februari, badan kesehatan negara melaporkan peningkatan kasus terkonfirmasi yang signifikan, sebagian besar disebabkan oleh pertemuan gerakan keagamaan baru di Daegu, yang dikenal sebagai Gereja Yesus Shincheonji.
en-mt: On February 20, the state health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases, largely due to the gathering of a new religious movement in Daegu, known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: Para penganut Shincheonji yang mengunjungi Daegu dari Wuhan diduga merupakan asal wabah tersebut.
en-mt: Shincheonji adherents who visited Daegu from Wuhan are thought to be the origin of the outbreak.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: Per tanggal 22 Februari, di antara 9.336 pengikut gereja, 1.261 atau sekitar 13% telah melaporkan gejala. Korea Selatan menyatakan tingkat siaga tertinggi pada 23 Februari 2020.
en-mt: As of February 22, among 9,336 church followers, 1,261 or about 13% have reported symptoms. South Korea declared its highest alert level on 23 February 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: Pada 28 Februari, lebih dari 2.000 kasus terkonfirmasi dilaporkan di Korea, yang meningkat menjadi 3.150 pada 29 Februari.
en-mt: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, which increased to 3,150 on 29 February.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: Semua pangkalan militer Korea Selatan dikarantina setelah pengujian mengonfirmasi bahwa tiga tentara positif terkena virus.
en-mt: All South Korean military bases are quarantined after testing confirmed that three soldiers tested positive for the virus.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: Jadwal penerbangan juga terpengaruh dan diubah. Korea Selatan memperkenalkan program yang dianggap sebagai program terbesar dan terorganisir paling baik di dunia untuk menapis virus di populasi, mengisolasi setiap orang yang terinfeksi, serta melacak dan mengarantina orang yang kontak dengan mereka.
en-mt: Flight schedules are also affected and changed. South Korea introduced what is considered the world's largest and best-organized program to screen the virus in the population, isolate everyone who is infected, and trace and quarantine those they come into contact with.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: Metode penapisan termasuk kewajiban melaporkan gejala secara mandiri oleh orang yang baru datang dari luar negeri melalui aplikasi seluler, pengujian virus lantatur atau drive-thru dengan hasil tersedia pada hari berikutnya, dan peningkatan kemampuan pengujian hingga lebih dari 20.000 orang setiap hari.
en-mt: Screening methods include mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by people who have just arrived from abroad via a mobile app, drive-thru or virus testing with results available the next day, and increasing testing capabilities to more than 20,000 people daily.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Program Korea Selatan dianggap berhasil dalam mengendalikan wabah meskipun tidak mengarantina seluruh kota. Pada awalnya, pandangan masyarakat Korea Selatan terbagi mengenai tanggapan Presiden Moon Jae-in terhadap krisis ini.
en-mt: The South Korean program was deemed successful in controlling the outbreak even though it did not quarantine the entire city. Initially, the South Korean public was divided on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: Banyak warga Korea menandatangani petisi menyerukan pemakzulan terhadap Presiden Moon atas klaim mereka bahwa pemerintah melakukan kesalahan dalam menangani wabah, atau sebaliknya, memuji reaksi presiden.
en-mt: Many Koreans signed the petition calling for the impeachment of President Moon over their claims that the government mishandled the outbreak, or conversely, praised the president's reaction.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: Pada 23 Maret, Korea Selatan dilaporkan memiliki total kasus satu hari terendah dalam empat minggu.
en-mt: On March 23, South Korea reported having its lowest one-day total of cases in four weeks.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Pada 29 Maret, dilaporkan bahwa mulai 1 April semua orang yang baru datang dari luar negeri akan dikarantina selama dua minggu.
en-mt: On March 29, it was reported that from April 1 all new arrivals from abroad will be quarantined for two weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: Menurut laporan media pada 1 April, Korea Selatan telah menerima permintaan bantuan pengujian virus dari 121 negara.
en-mt: According to media reports on April 1, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 countries.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: Iran melaporkan kasus infeksi SARS-CoV-2 terkonfirmasi pertama pada 19 Februari di Qom dan, menurut Kementerian Kesehatan dan Pendidikan Kedokteran, dua orang meninggal pada hari itu.
en-mt: Iran reported its first confirmed case of SARS-CoV-2 infection on February 19 in Qom and, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died that day.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: Langkah awal yang diumumkan pemerintah mencakup pembatalan konser dan acara budaya lainnya, acara olahraga, dan salat Jumat, serta penutupan universitas, lembaga pendidikan tinggi, dan sekolah.
en-mt: Initial steps announced by the government include canceling concerts and other cultural events, sporting events and Friday prayers, as well as closing universities, higher education institutions and schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: Iran mengalokasikan lima triliun real untuk memerangi virus ini.
en-mt: Iran allocated five trillion rials to fight this virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: Presiden Hassan Rouhani mengatakan pada 26 Februari 2020 bahwa tidak ada rencana untuk mengarantina wilayah yang terdampak wabah, hanya individu yang akan dikarantina.
en-mt: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there are no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, only individuals will be quarantined.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: Rencana untuk membatasi perjalanan antarkota diumumkan pada bulan Maret, meskipun lalu lintas padat antarkota menjelang Tahun Baru Persia berlanjut.
en-mt: Plans to limit intercity travel were announced in March, although heavy intercity traffic ahead of the Persian New Year continues.
