targetString: Kapasitas pengujiannya hingga beberapa ratus sampel dalam beberapa jam, jadi jauh lebih cepat daripada pemeriksaan PCR konvensional terhadap RNA virus.
en-mt: Its testing capacity is up to several hundred samples in a few hours, so it is much faster than conventional PCR assays of viral RNA.

sourceString: The antibodies are usually detectable 14 days after the onset of the infection.In early April, the UK found none of the antibody test kits it purchased were sufficiently good to use.
targetString: Antibodi biasanya terdeteksi 14 hari setelah awitan infeksi. Pada awal April, Inggris Raya mendapati bahwa tidak satu pun alat uji antibodi yang dibelinya cukup bagus untuk digunakan.
en-mt: Antibodies are usually detectable 14 days after the onset of infection. In early April, Great Britain found that none of the antibody test kits it had purchased were good enough to use.

sourceString: Hong Kong has set up a scheme where suspected patients can stay home, "emergency department will give a specimen tube to the patient", they spit into it, send it back and get a test result a while after.The British NHS has announced that it is piloting a scheme to test suspected cases at home, which removes the risk of a patient infecting others if they come to a hospital or having to disinfect an ambulance if one is used.In drive-through testing for COVID-19 for suspected cases, a healthcare professional takes sample using appropriate precautions.
targetString: Hong Kong menyusun skema agar pasien terduga dapat tinggal di rumah, "departemen gawat darurat akan memberikan tabung spesimen kepada pasien," mereka meludah ke dalamnya, mengirimnya kembali, dan mendapatkan hasil uji beberapa saat kemudian. NHS Inggris mengumumkan bahwa NHS sedang merintis skema pengujian kasus terduga di rumah sehingga menghilangkan risiko pasien menulari orang lain jika mereka datang ke rumah sakit atau harus mendisinfeksi ambulans jika digunakan. Pada pengujian lantatur untuk kasus terduga COVID-19, seorang tenaga kesehatan profesional akan mengambil sampel menggunakan tindakan pencegahan yang sesuai.
en-mt: Hong Kong set up a scheme where suspected patients can stay at home, "the emergency department will give the patient a specimen tube," they spit into it, send it back, and get the test results a short time later. NHS England announced that it is piloting a scheme for testing suspected cases at home eliminating the risk of patients infecting others if they come to hospital or having to disinfect ambulances if used. In dilution testing for suspected cases of COVID-19, a healthcare professional will take a sample using the appropriate precautions.

sourceString: Drive-through centers have helped South Korea do some of the fastest, most-extensive testing of any country.In Germany, the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians said on 2 March, that it had a capacity for about 12,000 tests per day in the ambulatory setting and 10.700 had been tested in the prior week.
targetString: Pusat pengujian lantatur telah membantu Korea Selatan melakukan pengujian tercepat dan terluas dibandingkan negara mana pun. Pada 2 Maret, National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians Jerman mengatakan bahwa Jerman memiliki kapasitas sekitar 12.000 uji per hari dalam tatanan rawat jalan dan 10.700 pengujian telah dilakukan pada minggu sebelumnya.
en-mt: The dissolution testing center has helped South Korea carry out the fastest and most widespread testing of any country. On March 2, Germany's National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians said that Germany had a capacity of around 12,000 tests per day in outpatient settings and that 10,700 tests had been carried out in the previous week.

sourceString: Costs are borne by the health insurance when the test is ordered by a physician.
targetString: Biaya ditanggung oleh asuransi kesehatan jika uji diminta oleh dokter.
en-mt: The cost is covered by health insurance if the test is requested by the doctor.

sourceString: According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has an overall capacity for 160,000 tests per week.
targetString: Menurut presiden Robert Koch Institute, Jerman memiliki kapasitas keseluruhan sebanyak 160.000 uji per minggu.
en-mt: According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has an overall capacity of 160,000 tests per week.

sourceString: As of 19 March drive in tests were offered in several large cities.
targetString: Pada 19 Maret, uji lantatur ditawarkan di beberapa kota besar.
en-mt: On March 19th, dilution tests were offered in several major cities.

sourceString: As of 26 March 2020 the total number of tests performed in Germany was unknown, because only positive results are reported.
targetString: Per 26 Maret 2020, jumlah uji yang dilakukan di Jerman tidak diketahui karena hanya hasil positif yang dilaporkan.
en-mt: As of 26 March 2020, the number of tests carried out in Germany is unknown as only positive results have been reported.

sourceString: A first lab survey revealed that as of calendar week 12/2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested up to and including week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.In Israel, researchers at Technion and Rambam Hospital developed and tested a method for testing samples from 64 patients simultaneously, by pooling the samples and only testing further if the combined sample is found to be positive.In Wuhan a makeshift 2000-sq-meter emergency detection laboratory named "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in English) was opened on 5 February 2020 by BGI, which can process over 10,000 samples a day.
targetString: Sebuah survei laboratorium pertama mengungkapkan bahwa, secara total, setidaknya 483.295 sampel telah diuji hingga dan termasuk minggu 12/2020 dan 33.491 sampel (6,9%) teruji positif untuk SARS-CoV-2.Di Israel, para peneliti di Rumah Sakit Technion dan Rambam mengembangkan dan menguji metode untuk menguji sampel dari 64 pasien secara bersamaan, dengan menggabungkan sampel dan hanya menguji lebih lanjut jika sampel gabungan ditemukan positif. Di Wuhan, laboratorium pendeteksi darurat sebesar 2.000 meter persegi bernama "Huo-Yan" (bahasa Mandarin: 火 眼, atau "Mata Api" dalam bahasa Indonesia) dibuka pada 5 Februari 2020 oleh BGI, yang dapat memproses lebih dari 10.000 sampel sehari.
en-mt: A first laboratory survey revealed that, in total, at least 483,295 samples had been tested up to and including week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2. In Israel, researchers at Technion Hospital and Rambam developed and tested a method to test samples from 64 patients simultaneously, by combining the samples and only testing further if the combined sample was found to be positive. In Wuhan, a 2,000 square meter makeshift detection laboratory named "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in Indonesian) was opened on 5 February 2020 by BGI, which can process more than 10,000 samples a day.

sourceString: With the construction overseen by BGI-founder Wang Jian and taking 5-days, modelling has show cases in Hubei would have been 47% higher and the corresponding cost of the tackling the quarantine would have doubled if this testing capacity hadn't come on line.
targetString: Dengan konstruksinya diawasi oleh pendiri BGI Wang Jian dan memakan waktu 5 hari, pemodelan menunjukkan bahwa kasus di Hubei bisa 47% lebih tinggi dan biaya terkait untuk penanganan karantina bisa dua kali lipat jika kapasitas pengujian ini tidak ada.
en-mt: With construction overseen by BGI founder Wang Jian and taking 5 days, modeling suggests that cases in Hubei could be 47% higher and the associated costs for handling quarantine could be doubled if this testing capacity were not there.

sourceString: The Wuhan Laboratory has been promptly followed by Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai, in a total of 12 cities across China.
targetString: Laboratorium Wuhan segera diikuti oleh laboratorium Huo-Yan di Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, dan Shanghai, di total 12 kota di seluruh Tiongkok.
en-mt: The Wuhan lab was quickly followed by the Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing and Shanghai, in a total of 12 cities across China.

sourceString: By 4 March 2020 the daily throughput totals were 50,000 tests per day.Open source, multiplexed designs released by Origami Assays have been released that can test as many as 1122 patient samples for COVID19 using only 93 assays .  These balanced designs can be run in small laboratories without the need for robotic liquid handlers.
targetString: Per 4 Maret 2020, total kapasitas hariannya sebesar 50.000 uji per hari. Desain multipleks sumber terbuka yang dirilis oleh Origami Assays dapat menguji sebanyak 1.222 sampel pasien untuk COVID-19 dengan hanya menggunakan 93 pemeriksaan.  Desain seimbang ini dapat dijalankan di laboratorium kecil tanpa perlu penangan cairan robotik.
en-mt: As of March 4, 2020, the total daily capacity is 50,000 tests per day. The open source multiplex design released by Origami Assays can test as many as 1,222 patient samples for COVID-19 using only 93 assays. This balanced design can run in small laboratories without the need for robotic fluid handlers.

sourceString: By March, shortages and insufficient amounts of reagent has become a bottleneck for mass testing in the EU and UK and the US.
targetString: Hingga bulan Maret, kekurangan dan jumlah reagen yang tidak mencukupi telah menjadi hambatan untuk pengujian massal di Uni Eropa, Inggris Raya, dan Amerika Serikat.
en-mt: Until March, shortages and insufficient quantities of reagents had been a barrier to mass testing in the European Union, United Kingdom and United States.

sourceString: This has led some authors to explore sample preparation protocols that involve heating samples at 98 °C (208 °F) for 5 minutes to release RNA genomes for further testing.On 31 March it was announced United Arab Emirates was now testing more of its population for Coronavirus per head than any other country, and was on track to scale up the level of testing to reach the bulk of the population.
targetString: Karena hal tersebut, sejumlah peneliti berusaha mengeksplorasi protokol penyiapan sampel yang melibatkan pemanasan sampel pada 98 °C (208 °F) selama 5 menit untuk melepaskan genom RNA untuk pengujian lebih lanjut. Pada 31 Maret, Uni Emirat Arab dilaporkan melakukan lebih banyak pengujian koronavirus per kapita populasi dibandingkan negara mana pun, dan siap meningkatkan skala pengujian untuk mencapai sebagian besar populasi.
en-mt: Because of this, a number of investigators are exploring sample preparation protocols that involve heating the sample at 98 °C (208 °F) for 5 minutes to release the genomic RNA for further testing. As of March 31, the United Arab Emirates was reported to be carrying out more coronavirus testing per capita population than any other country, and was ready to scale up testing to reach the majority of the population.

sourceString: This was through a combination of drive-through capability, and purchasing a population-scale mass-throughput laboratory from Group 42 and BGI (based on their "Huo-Yan" emergency detection laboratories in China).
targetString: Hal ini dicapai melalui kombinasi pengujian lantatur dan pembelian laboratorium hasil massal berskala populasi dari Grup 42 dan BGI (berdasarkan pada laboratorium deteksi darurat "Huo-Yan" di Tiongkok).
en-mt: This was achieved through a combination of dispersion testing and the purchase of a population-scale mass production laboratory from Group 42 and BGI (based on China's "Huo-Yan" emergency detection laboratory).

sourceString: Constructed in 14 days, the lab is capable of conducting tens of thousands RT-PCR tests per day and is the first in the world of this scale to be operational outside of China.
targetString: Dibangun dalam 14 hari, laboratorium ini mampu melakukan puluhan ribu uji RT-PCR per hari dan merupakan laboratorium pertama yang memiliki skala ini di luar Tiongkok.
en-mt: Built in 14 days, the lab is capable of performing tens of thousands of RT-PCR tests per day and is the first laboratory of this scale outside China.

sourceString: Different testing recipes targeting different parts of the coronavirus genetic profile were developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, and the United States.
targetString: Berbagai resep pengujian yang menargetkan berbagai bagian profil genetik koronavirus dikembangkan di Tiongkok, Prancis, Jerman, Hong Kong, Jepang, dan Amerika Serikat.
en-mt: Testing recipes targeting different parts of the coronavirus' genetic profile were developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan and the United States.

sourceString: The World Health Organization adopted the German recipe for manufacturing kits sent to low-income countries without the resources to develop their own.
targetString: Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia mengadopsi resep Jerman untuk produksi alat uji yang dikirim ke negara-negara berpenghasilan rendah tanpa sumber daya untuk mengembangkan sendiri.
en-mt: The World Health Organization adopted a German recipe for the production of test kits which are sent to low-income countries without the resources to develop their own.

sourceString: The German recipe was published on 17 January 2020; the protocol developed by the United States Centers for Disease Control was not available until 28 January, delaying available tests in the U.S.China and the United States had problems with the reliability of test kits early in the outbreak, and these countries and Australia were unable to supply enough kits to satisfy demand and recommendations for testing by health experts.
targetString: Resep Jerman dipublikasikan pada 17 Januari 2020; protokol yang dikembangkan oleh Pusat Pengendalian Penyakit Amerika Serikat tidak tersedia hingga 28 Januari sehingga memperlambat pengujian yang tersedia di AS. Di awal wabah, Tiongkok dan Amerika Serikat bermasalah dengan keandalan alat uji; dua negara ini dan Australia tidak dapat menyediakan cukup alat uji untuk memenuhi permintaan dan rekomendasi pengujian pakar kesehatan.
en-mt: German recipe published on January 17, 2020; the protocol developed by the US Centers for Disease Control was not available until January 28, slowing down the testing available in the US. Early in the outbreak, China and the United States had problems with test kit reliability; these two countries and Australia cannot provide enough testing kits to meet the demands and recommendations of health experts' testing.

sourceString: In contrast, experts say South Korea's broad availability of testing helped reduce the spread of the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Sebaliknya, pakar mengatakan bahwa ketersediaan pengujian yang luas di Korea Selatan membantu mengurangi penyebaran koronavirus baru.
en-mt: Instead, experts say that the wide availability of testing in South Korea helps reduce the spread of the new coronavirus.

sourceString: Testing capacity, largely in private sector labs, was built up over several years by the South Korean government.
targetString: Kapasitas pengujian, sebagian besar di laboratorium sektor swasta, dibangun dalam beberapa tahun oleh pemerintah Korea Selatan.
en-mt: Testing capacity, mostly in private sector laboratories, was built up over the years by the South Korean government.

sourceString: On 16 March, the World Health Organization called for ramping up the testing programmes as the best way to slow the advance of COVID-19 pandemic.High demand for testing due to wide spread of the virus caused backlogs of hundreds of thousands of tests at private U.S. labs, and supplies of swabs and chemical reagents became strained.
targetString: Pada 16 Maret, Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia menyerukan peningkatan program pengujian sebagai cara terbaik untuk memperlambat peningkatan pandemi COVID-19. Permintaan yang tinggi untuk pengujian karena penyebaran virus yang luas menyebabkan ratusan ribu pengujian menunggu pengerjaan di laboratorium swasta AS, dan persediaan alat usap serta reagen kimia menjadi genting.
en-mt: On March 16, the World Health Organization called for an increase in testing programs as the best way to slow the progress of the COVID-19 pandemic. High demand for testing due to the wide spread of the virus has left hundreds of thousands of tests pending in private US labs, and supplies of swabs and chemical reagents are critical.

sourceString: In March 2020 China reported problems with accuracy in their test kits.
targetString: Pada Maret 2020, Tiongkok melaporkan masalah akurasi pada alat uji mereka.
en-mt: In March 2020, China reported accuracy issues with their test kits.

sourceString: In the United States, the test kits developed by the CDC had "flaws;" the government then removed the bureaucratic barriers that had prevented private testing.Spain purchased test kits from Chinese firm  Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, but found that results were inaccurate.
targetString: Di Amerika Serikat, alat uji yang dikembangkan oleh CDC memiliki "cacat"; pemerintah kemudian menghapus halangan birokrasi yang mencegah pengujian oleh swasta. Spanyol membeli alat uji dari perusahaan Tiongkok Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, tetapi mendapati bahwa hasilnya tidak akurat.
en-mt: In the United States, test kits developed by the CDC are "flawed"; the government then removed the bureaucratic barriers that prevented private testing. Spain bought test kits from Chinese company Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, but found the results to be inaccurate.

sourceString: The firm explained that the incorrect results may be a result of a failure to collect samples or use the kits correctly.
targetString: Perusahaan tersebut menjelaskan bahwa hasil yang tidak benar mungkin akibat kegagalan dalam mengumpulkan sampel atau menggunakan alat uji dengan benar.
en-mt: The company explained that incorrect results may be the result of failure to collect samples or use the test equipment properly.

sourceString: The Spanish ministry said it will withdraw the kits that returned incorrect results, and would replace them with a different testing kit provided by Shenzhen Bioeasy.80% of test kits the Czech Republic purchased from China gave wrong results.Slovakia purchased 1.2 million test kits from China which were found to be inaccurate.
targetString: Kementrian Spanyol mengatakan bahwa mereka akan menarik peralatan yang memberi hasil tidak benar, dan menggantinya dengan alat uji lain yang disediakan oleh Shenzhen Bioeasy.80% alat uji yang dibeli Republik Ceko dari Tiongkok memberi hasil yang tidak benar. Slovakia membeli 1,2 juta alat uji dari Tiongkok yang ternyata tidak akurat.
en-mt: The Spanish ministry said that they would recall the kits that gave incorrect results, and replace them with another test kit provided by Shenzhen Bioeasy. 80% of the test kits that the Czech Republic purchased from China gave incorrect results. Slovakia bought 1.2 million test kits from China which were found to be inaccurate.

sourceString: Prime Minister Matovič suggested these be dumped into the Danube.Ateş Kara of the Turkish Health Ministry said the test kits Turkey purchased from China had a "high error rate" and did not "put them into use."The UK purchased 3.5 million test kits from China but in early April 2020 announced these were not usable.
targetString: Perdana Menteri Matovič menyarankan agar alat uji ini dibuang ke sungai Danube. Ateş Kara dari Kementrian Kesehatan Turki mengatakan alat uji yang dibeli Turki dari Tiongkok memiliki "tingkat kesalahan tinggi" dan mereka tidak "menggunakannya".Inggris Raya membeli 3,5 juta alat uji dari Tiongkok, tetapi di awal April 2020, mereka mengumumkan bahwa alat uji ini tidak dapat digunakan.
en-mt: Prime Minister Matovič suggested that these test kits be thrown into the Danube river. Ateş Kara of the Turkish Ministry of Health said the test kits Turkey bought from China had a "high error rate" and they did not "use them". The UK bought 3.5 million test kits from China, but in early April 2020, they announced that the test it cannot be used.

sourceString: Testing, followed with quarantine of those who tested positive and tracing of those with whom the SARS-CoV-2 positive people had had contact, resulted in positive outcomes.
targetString: Pengujian, yang diikuti dengan karantina orang yang teruji positif dan pelacakan orang yang kontak dengan orang yang positif SARS-CoV-2, memberi hasil akhir yang positif.
en-mt: Testing, followed by quarantine of those who tested positive and tracing contacts of those who tested positive for SARS-CoV-2, resulted in a positive final result.

sourceString: Researchers working in the Italian town of Vò, the site of the first COVID-19 death in Italy, conducted two rounds of testing on the entire population of about 3,400 people, about ten days apart.
targetString: Peneliti yang bekerja di kota Vò Italia, lokasi kematian pertama akibat COVID-19 di Italia, melakukan dua putaran pengujian pada seluruh populasi yang terdiri atas 3.400 orang, dengan jarak sekitar 10 hari.
en-mt: Researchers working in the Italian city of Vò, site of the first death from COVID-19 in Italy, conducted two rounds of testing on the entire population of 3,400 people, about 10 days apart.

sourceString: About half the people testing positive had no symptoms, and all discovered cases were quarantined.
targetString: Sekitar separuh dari orang yang teruji positif tidak memiliki gejala, dan semua kasus yang ditemukan dikarantina.
en-mt: About half of the people who have tested positive have no symptoms, and all cases found are under quarantine.

sourceString: With travel to the commune restricted, this eliminated new infections completely.
targetString: Dengan pembatasan perjalanan ke komunitas ini, infeksi baru ditiadakan sama sekali.
en-mt: With these restrictions on travel to the community, new infections are completely eliminated.

sourceString: With aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, the 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Singapore has proceeded much more slowly than in other developed countries, but without extreme restrictions like forced closure of restaurants and retail establishments.
targetString: Dengan pelacakan kontak yang agresif, pembatasan perjalanan masuk, pengujian, dan karantina, pandemi koronavirus 2020 di Singapura berkembang jauh lebih lambat dibandingkan negara-negara maju lainnya meski tanpa pembatasan ekstrem, seperti penutupan paksa restoran dan perusahaan ritel.
en-mt: With aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing and quarantine, the 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Singapore progressed much more slowly than in other developed countries even without extreme restrictions, such as the forced closure of restaurants and retail establishments.

sourceString: Many events have been cancelled, and Singapore did start advising residents to stay at home on 28 March, but schools reopened on time after holiday break on 23 March.
targetString: Banyak acara dibatalkan, dan Singapura menyarankan penduduk untuk tinggal di rumah pada 28 Maret, tetapi sekolah-sekolah dibuka kembali tepat waktu setelah liburan pada 23 Maret.
en-mt: Many events were cancelled, and Singapore advised residents to stay home on 28 March, but schools reopened in time after the holiday on 23 March.

sourceString: Several other countries have also managed the pandemic with aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, but with less aggressive lock-downs, such as Iceland and South Korea.
targetString: Beberapa negara lain juga menangani pandemik dengan pelacakan kontak yang agresif, pembatasan perjalanan masuk, pengujian, dan karantina, tetapi dengan karantina wilayah yang tidak terlalu agresif, seperti Islandia dan Korea Selatan.
en-mt: Several other countries have also handled the pandemic with aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantines, but with less aggressive lockdowns, such as Iceland and South Korea.

sourceString: A statistical study has found that countries that have tested more, relative to the number of deaths, have much lower case fatality rates, probably because these countries are better able to detect those with only mild or no symptoms.
targetString: Sebuah studi statistik menemukan bahwa negara-negara yang menguji lebih banyak, relatif terhadap jumlah kematian, memiliki angka fatalitas kasus yang jauh lebih rendah, mungkin karena negara-negara ini lebih mampu mendeteksi orang yang memiliki gejala ringan atau tanpa gejala.
en-mt: One statistical study found that countries that tested more, relative to the number of deaths, had significantly lower case-fatality rates, perhaps because these countries were better able to detect people who had mild or no symptoms.

sourceString: WHO recommends that countries that do not have testing capacity and national laboratories with limited experience on COVID-19 send their first five positives and the first ten negative COVID-19 samples to one of the 16 WHO reference laboratories for confirmatory testing.
targetString: WHO merekomendasikan agar negara-negara yang tidak memiliki kapasitas pengujian, dan laboratorium nasional dengan pengalaman COVID-19 yang terbatas, mengirim lima sampel positif COVID-19 pertama dan sepuluh sampel negatif pertama ke salah satu dari 16 laboratorium rujukan WHO untuk pengujian konfirmasi.
en-mt: WHO recommends that countries without testing capacity, and national laboratories with limited COVID-19 experience, send the first five positive COVID-19 samples and the first ten negative samples to one of WHO's 16 referral laboratories for confirmatory testing.

sourceString: Out of the 16 reference laboratories, 7 are in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in Australia.
targetString: Dari 16 laboratorium rujukan, 7 ada di Asia, 5 di Eropa, 2 di Afrika, 1 di Amerika Utara, dan 1 di Australia.
en-mt: Of the 16 reference laboratories, 7 are in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America, and 1 in Australia.

sourceString: In the following chart, the column “Positive as % of tests” is influenced by the country's testing policy.
targetString: Di bagan berikut ini, kolom "% Hasil positif pengujian" dipengaruhi oleh kebijakan pengujian negara tersebut.
en-mt: In the following chart, the "% Test positive results" column is affected by that country's testing policy.

sourceString: A country that only tests people admitted to hospitals will have a higher positive as % of tests than a country that tests all citizens, whether or not they are showing symptoms, other things being equal.
targetString: Negara yang hanya menguji orang yang dirawat di rumah sakit akan memiliki % hasil positif lebih tinggi dibandingkan negara yang menguji semua penduduknya, entah mereka menunjukkan gejala atau tidak, dengan faktor lain sama.
en-mt: Countries that only test people who are hospitalized will have a higher % of positive results than countries that test all residents, whether they have symptoms or not, other factors being equal.

sourceString: Hand washing (or handwashing), also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning one's hands for the purpose of removing soil, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.
targetString: Mencuci tangan,yang disebut juga dengan kebersihan tangan, adalah tindakan membersihkan tangan seseorang yang bertujuan menghilangkan kotoran, minyak, mikroorganisme, atau zat lain yang tidak diinginkan.
en-mt: Hand washing, which is also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning one's hands with the aim of removing dirt, grease, microorganisms or other unwanted substances.

sourceString: Hand washing with soap consistently at certain "critical moments" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example diarrhoea and cholera, which are transmitted through fecal–oral route.
targetString: Mencuci tangan dengan sabun secara konsisten pada "saat kritis" tertentu sepanjang hari mencegah penyebaran banyak penyakit, misalnya diare dan kolera, yang ditularkan melalui rute fekal-oral.
en-mt: Consistent hand washing with soap at certain "critical moments" throughout the day prevents the spread of many diseases, such as diarrhea and cholera, which are transmitted by the faecal-oral route.

sourceString: People can also become infected with respiratory diseases such as influenza or the common cold, for example, if they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (i.e., mucous membranes).
targetString: Orang juga bisa tertular penyakit pernapasan, seperti influenza atau selesma, jika mereka tidak mencuci tangan sebelum menyentuh mata, hidung, atau mulut (yaitu, membran mukosa).
en-mt: People can also catch respiratory illnesses, such as influenza or a cold, if they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (ie, mucous membranes).

sourceString: The five critical moments during the day where washing hands with soap is important include: before and after defecation, after cleaning a child's bottom or changing nappies, before feeding a child, before eating and before and after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: Lima saat kritis sepanjang hari yang sangat penting untuk mencuci tangan dengan sabun adalah: sebelum dan sesudah buang air besar, setelah membersihkan pantat anak atau mengganti popok, sebelum menyuapi anak, sebelum makan serta sebelum dan sesudah menyiapkan makanan atau mengolah daging, ikan, atau unggas mentah.
en-mt: The five critical moments throughout the day that are especially important for washing hands with soap are: before and after defecating, after cleaning a child's bottom or changing a diaper, before feeding a child, before eating and before and after preparing food or preparing meat, fish, or poultry raw.

sourceString: If water and soap are not available, hands can be cleaned with ash.The World Health Organization recommends washing hands:
targetString: Jika air dan sabun tidak ada, tangan bisa dibersihkan dengan abu. Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia menyarankan mencuci tangan:
en-mt: If soap and water are not available, hands can be cleaned with ashes. The World Health Organization advises washing hands:

sourceString: Before, during, and after preparing food.
targetString: Sebelum, ketika, dan setelah menyiapkan makanan.
en-mt: Before, during and after preparing food.

sourceString: Before and after caring for a sick person.
targetString: Sebelum dan setelah merawat orang sakit.
en-mt: Before and after caring for the sick.

sourceString: After changing the diapers or cleaning up a child who has used the toilet.
targetString: Setelah mengganti popok atau membersihkan anak yang baru saja menggunakan toilet.
en-mt: After changing diapers or cleaning up a child who has recently used the toilet.

sourceString: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Setelah membersihkan hidung, batuk, atau bersin.
en-mt: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: After touching animal, animal feed, or animal waste.
targetString: Setelah menyentuh hewan, makanan hewan, atau kotoran hewan.
en-mt: After touching animals, pet food or animal waste.

sourceString: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices related to medical procedures.
targetString: Kebersihan tangan medis mengacu pada praktik kebersihan yang berhubungan dengan prosedur medis.
en-mt: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices associated with medical procedures.

sourceString: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.
targetString: Mencuci tangan sebelum memberikan obat atau perawatan medis dapat mencegah atau mengurangi penyebaran penyakit.
en-mt: Washing your hands before giving medicine or medical treatment can prevent or reduce the spread of disease.

sourceString: The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.
targetString: Tujuan medis utama mencuci tangan adalah membersihkan tangan dari patogen (bakteri, virus, atau mikroorganisme lain yang dapat menyebabkan penyakit) dan bahan kimia yang dapat menyebabkan bahaya atau penyakit.
en-mt: The main medical goal of hand washing is to clean hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals that can cause harm or disease.

sourceString: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.
targetString: Hal ini terutama penting bagi orang yang menangani makanan atau bekerja di bidang medis, tetapi juga merupakan praktik yang penting bagi masyarakat umum.
en-mt: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but it is also an important practice for the general public.

sourceString: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious causes of diarrhea; decreasing respiratory infections;
targetString: Mencuci tangan memiliki banyak manfaat kesehatan, termasuk meminimalkan penyebaran influenza, virus korona, dan penyakit menular lainnya; mencegah penyebab diare yang menular; mengurangi infeksi pernapasan;
en-mt: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus and other infectious diseases; prevent infectious causes of diarrhea; reduces respiratory infections;

sourceString: and reducing infant mortality rate at home birth deliveries.
targetString: serta mengurangi angka mortalitas bayi pada persalinan di rumah.
en-mt: and reduce infant mortality in home births.

sourceString: A 2013 study showed that improved hand washing practices may lead to small improvements in the length growth in children under five years of age.
targetString: Studi yang dilakukan pada tahun 2013 menunjukkan bahwa peningkatan praktik mencuci tangan dapat sedikit meningkatkan pertumbuhan tinggi anak balita.
en-mt: A study conducted in 2013 showed that an increase in hand washing practices could slightly increase the height of children under five.

sourceString: In developing countries, childhood mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes, such as hand washing with soap.
targetString: Di negara berkembang, angka mortalitas anak akibat penyakit pernapasan dan diare dapat dikurangi dengan memperkenalkan perubahan perilaku sederhana, seperti mencuci tangan dengan sabun.
en-mt: In developing countries, child mortality from respiratory diseases and diarrhea can be reduced by introducing simple behavior changes, such as washing hands with soap.

sourceString: This simple action can reduce the rate of mortality from these diseases by almost 50%.
targetString: Tindakan sederhana ini dapat mengurangi angka mortalitas akibat penyakit tersebut hingga hampir 50%.
en-mt: This simple action can reduce mortality from the disease by nearly 50%.

sourceString: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce diarrhoea episodes by about a third, and this is comparable to providing clean water in low income areas.
targetString: Intervensi yang menggalakkan cuci tangan dapat mengurangi kasus diare hingga sekitar sepertiganya; intervensi ini dapat dilakukan dengan menyediakan air bersih di daerah berpenghasilan rendah.
en-mt: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce cases of diarrhea by about a third; this intervention can be done by providing clean water in low-income areas.

sourceString: 48% of reductions in diarrhoea episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap.Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities worldwide.
targetString: 48% pengurangan kasus diare dapat dikaitkan dengan cuci tangan dengan sabun. Mencuci tangan dengan sabun adalah satu-satunya cara yang paling efektif dan murah untuk mencegah diare dan infeksi saluran pernapasan akut (ISPA), sebagai perilaku bawah sadar yang dilakukan di rumah, sekolah, dan masyarakat di seluruh dunia.
en-mt: A 48% reduction in cases of diarrhea can be attributed to hand washing with soap. Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as a subconscious behavior carried out in homes, schools and communities around the world.

sourceString: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of mortality among children under five years old, taking the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.
targetString: Pneumonia, yang merupakan ISPA utama, adalah penyebab nomor satu kematian anak balita; penyakit ini menyebabkan kematian sekitar 1,8 juta anak per tahun.
en-mt: Pneumonia, which is the main ARI, is the number one cause of death for children under five; This disease causes the death of around 1.8 million children per year.

sourceString: Diarrhea and pneumonia together account for almost 3.5 million child deaths annually.
targetString: Diare dan pneumonia menyebabkan kematian hampir 3,5 juta anak setiap tahun.
en-mt: Diarrhea and pneumonia kill nearly 3.5 million children each year.

sourceString: According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter.
targetString: Menurut UNICEF, membuat cuci tangan dengan sabun sebelum makan dan setelah menggunakan toilet menjadi kebiasaan yang tertanam dapat menyelamatkan lebih banyak nyawa alih-alih vaksin atau tindakan medis apa pun, serta mengurangi kematian akibat diare hingga hampir setengahnya dan kematian akibat infeksi saluran pernapasan akut hingga seperempatnya.
en-mt: According to UNICEF, making an ingrained habit of washing hands with soap before eating and after using the toilet can save more lives than vaccines or any other medical measure, and reduce deaths from diarrhea by nearly half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by up to a quarter. .

sourceString: Hand washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.
targetString: Mencuci tangan biasanya digabungkan bersama dengan tindakan sanitasi lainnya sebagai bagian dari program air, sanitasi, dan kebersihan (WASH).
en-mt: Hand washing is usually combined with other sanitation measures as part of a water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) program.

sourceString: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.
targetString: Mencuci tangan juga melindungi diri dari impetigo yang ditularkan melalui kontak fisik secara langsung.
en-mt: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.

sourceString: A small detrimental effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.
targetString: Efek samping kecil mencuci tangan adalah pencucian tangan yang sering dilakukan dapat menyebabkan kerusakan kulit akibat pengeringan kulit.
en-mt: A small side effect of washing hands is that frequent hand washing can cause skin damage due to skin drying.

sourceString: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, flaky skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among health-care workers.
targetString: Studi yang dilakukan pada tahun 2012 di Denmark menemukan bahwa mencuci tangan secara berlebihan dapat menyebabkan kondisi kulit gatal dan bersisik, yang dikenal sebagai eksim tangan atau dermatitis tangan, yang terutama banyak terjadi di kalangan petugas kesehatan.
en-mt: A 2012 study conducted in Denmark found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, scaly skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among healthcare workers.

sourceString: Too frequent hand washing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
targetString: Mencuci tangan terlalu sering juga dilihat sebagai salah satu gejala gangguan obsesif-kompulsif (OCD).
en-mt: Washing hands too often is also seen as a symptom of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

sourceString: There are five critical times during the day where washing hands with soap is important to reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease: after using the bathroom (urination, defecation), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing nappies), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: Ada lima saat kritis sepanjang hari ketika mencuci tangan dengan sabun adalah penting guna mengurangi penularan penyakit secara fekal-oral, yaitu: sebelum dan sesudah menggunakan toilet (buang air kecil, buang air besar), setelah membersihkan pantat anak (mengganti popok), sebelum menyuapi anak, sebelum makan dan sebelum/sesudah menyiapkan makanan atau mengolah daging, ikan, atau unggas mentah.
en-mt: There are five critical moments throughout the day when washing hands with soap is important to reduce faecal-oral transmission of disease, namely: before and after using the toilet (urinating, defecating), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing diapers), before feeding children, before eating and before/after preparing food or processing raw meat, fish or poultry.

sourceString: Other occasions when correct handwashing technique should be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching garbage.
targetString: Saat lain yang penting untuk menerapkan teknik mencuci tangan yang benar guna mencegah penularan penyakit adalah sebelum dan sesudah merawat luka; setelah bersin, batuk, atau meniup hidung; setelah menyentuh kotoran hewan atau menangani hewan; dan setelah menyentuh sampah.
en-mt: Another important time to apply proper hand washing techniques to prevent disease transmission is before and after treating wounds; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching the trash.

sourceString: In many countries, there is a low rate of hand washing with soap.
targetString: Di banyak negara, tingkat mencuci tangan dengan sabun masih rendah.
en-mt: In many countries, handwashing rates with soap are still low.

sourceString: A study of hand washing in 54 countries in 2015 found that on average, 38.7% of households practiced hand washing with soap.A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest rate of 97 percent; the United States near the middle with 77 percent; and China with the lowest rate of 23 percent.Several behaviour change methodologies now exist to increase uptake of the behaviour of hand washing with soap at the critical times.Group hand washing for school children at set times of the day is one option in developing countries to engrain hand washing in children's behaviors.
targetString: Sebuah studi tentang mencuci tangan di 54 negara pada tahun 2015 menemukan bahwa rata-rata 38,7% rumah tangga mempraktikkan cuci tangan dengan sabun. Sebuah studi tahun 2014 menunjukkan bahwa Arab Saudi memiliki tingkat tertinggi dengan 97 persen; Amerika Serikat hampir di tengah dengan 77 persen; dan Tiongkok pada tingkat terendah dengan 23 persen. Sekarang tersedia beberapa metodologi perubahan perilaku untuk meningkatkan adopsi kebiasaan perilaku mencuci tangan dengan sabun pada saat kritis. Mencuci tangan berkelompok untuk pelajar pada waktu yang telah ditentukan merupakan salah satu pilihan di negara-negara berkembang untuk membiasakan cuci tangan dalam perilaku anak.
en-mt: A study on hand washing in 54 countries in 2015 found that an average of 38.7% of households practice hand washing with soap. A 2014 study shows that Saudi Arabia has the highest rate with 97 percent; The United States is almost in the middle with 77 percent; and China at the lowest level with 23 percent. There are now several behavior change methodologies available to increase adoption of the habit of handwashing with soap at critical times. Group hand washing for students at a predetermined time is one option in developing countries to get used to washing hands in children's behavior.

sourceString: The "Essential Health Care Program" implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of at scale action to promote children's health and education.
targetString: Program Perawatan Kesehatan Mendasar yang diterapkan Departemen Pendidikan di Filipina merupakan contoh tindakan berskala tepat untuk mendukung kesehatan dan pendidikan anak.
en-mt: The Basic Health Care Program implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of scale-appropriate action to support children's health and education.

sourceString: Deworming twice a year, supplemented with washing hands daily with soap, brushing teeth daily with fluoride, is at the core of this national program.
targetString: Pemberian obat cacing dua kali setahun, ditambah dengan mencuci tangan setiap hari dengan sabun dan menyikat gigi setiap hari dengan fluorida, adalah inti dari program nasional ini.
en-mt: Twice a year deworming, coupled with daily hand washing with soap and daily tooth brushing with fluoride, is the essence of this national program.

sourceString: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.
targetString: Program ini juga berhasil diterapkan di Indonesia.
en-mt: This program has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.

sourceString: Removal of microorganisms from skin is enhanced by the addition of soaps or detergents to water.
targetString: Pembersihan mikroorganisme dari kulit diperkuat dengan penambahan sabun atau deterjen ke air.
en-mt: Cleaning of microorganisms from the skin is strengthened by adding soap or detergent to the water.

sourceString: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce barriers to solution, and increase solubility.
targetString: Kerja utama sabun dan deterjen adalah mengurangi penghalang untuk larutan dan meningkatkan daya larut.
en-mt: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce the barrier to solutions and increase solubility.

sourceString: Water alone is an inefficient skin cleanser because fats and proteins, which are components of organic soil, are not readily dissolved in water.
targetString: Air saja merupakan pembersih kulit yang tidak efisien karena lemak dan protein, yang merupakan komponen kotoran organik, tidak mudah larut dalam air.
en-mt: Water alone is an inefficient skin cleanser because fats and proteins, which are components of organic impurities, do not dissolve easily in water.

sourceString: Cleansing is, however, aided by a reasonable flow of water..
targetString: Kendati demikian, pembersihan lemak dan protein dibantu oleh aliran air yang cukup.
en-mt: However, cleaning fat and protein is assisted by sufficient water flow.

sourceString: Solid soap, because of its reusable nature, may hold bacteria acquired from previous uses.
targetString: Sabun padat, karena sifatnya yang dapat digunakan kembali, mungkin dapat mengandung bakteri yang didapatkan dari penggunaan sebelumnya.
en-mt: Solid soap, because of its reusability, may contain bacteria acquired from previous use.

sourceString: A small number of studies which have looked at the bacterial transfer from contaminated solid soap have concluded transfer is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed off with the foam.
targetString: Sejumlah kecil studi yang meneliti pemindahan bakteri dari sabun padat terkontaminasi menyimpulkan bahwa pemindahan tidak mungkin terjadi karena bakteri terbilas dengan busa.
en-mt: A small number of studies examining the transfer of bacteria from contaminated solid soaps concluded that removal was impossible because the bacteria were rinsed off with the suds.

sourceString: The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".
targetString: Meski demikian, CDC tetap menyatakan "sabun cair yang pengeluarannya dari wadah tanpa disentuh tangan lebih disukai."
en-mt: However, the CDC still states "liquid soap that dispenses from the container without touching hands is preferred."

sourceString: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.
targetString: Sabun antibakeri digalakkan secara besar-besaran kepada masyarakat yang sadar kesehatan.
en-mt: Antibacterial soap is being promoted massively to a health conscious public.

sourceString: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.
targetString: Sampai saat ini, belum ada bukti bahwa penggunaan antiseptik atau disinfektan yang direkomendasikan lebih baik untuk organisme yang tahan antibiotik di alam.
en-mt: To date, there is no evidence that the recommended use of antiseptics or disinfectants is better for organisms that are resistant to antibiotics in nature.

sourceString: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.
targetString: Namun, sabun antibakteri mengandung agen antibakeri umum seperti triklosan, yang memiliki daftar strain organisme berdaya tahan yang luas.
en-mt: However, antibacterial soaps contain common anti-bacterial agents such as triclosan, which has a broad list of resistant strains of organisms.

sourceString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
targetString: Jadi, sekalipun strain yang tahan antibiotik tidak ditargetkan oleh sabun antibakteri, sabun ini mungkin tidak seefektif yang dipasarkan.
en-mt: So even if antibiotic-resistant strains are not targeted by antibacterial soaps, they may not be as effective as marketed.

sourceString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.
targetString: Selain surfaktan dan zat pelindung kulit, formulasi yang canggih dapat mengandung asam (asam asetat, asam askorbat, asam laktat) sebagai pengatur pH, asam benzoat sebagai antimikroba aktif, dan kondisioner kulit lebih lanjut (lidah buaya, vitamin, mentol, ekstrak tumbuhan).Sebuah analisis komprehensif dari Fakultas Kesehatan Masyarakat Universitas Oregon menunjukkan bahwa sabun biasa sama efektifnya dengan sabun antibakteri tingkat konsumen yang mengandung triklosan dalam mencegah penyakit dan membersihkan bakteri dari tangan.
en-mt: In addition to surfactants and skin protecting agents, advanced formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH adjusters, benzoic acid as active antimicrobials, and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts). A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health shows that plain soap is as effective as consumer-grade antibacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing disease and cleaning bacteria from hands.

sourceString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
targetString: Air hangat yang nyaman untuk mencuci tangan tidak cukup panas untuk membunuh bakteri.
en-mt: The pleasantly warm water for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.

sourceString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
targetString: Bakteri tumbuh lebih cepat pada suhu tubuh (37 °C).
en-mt: Bacteria grow faster at body temperature (37°C).

sourceString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
targetString: Air hangat bersabun lebih efektif dibandingkankan dengan air dingin bersabun dalam menghilangkan minyak alami yang menahan kotoran dan bakteri.
en-mt: Warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing the natural oils that hold dirt and bacteria.

sourceString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
targetString: Namun, bertolak belakang dengan keyakinan banyak orang, studi ilmiah menunjukkan bahwa penggunaan air hangat tidak memiliki efek dalam mengurangi jumlah mikroba di tangan.
en-mt: However, contrary to what many people believe, scientific studies show that the use of warm water has no effect in reducing the number of microbes on the hands.

sourceString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
targetString: Penyanitasi tangan atau antiseptik tangan adalah agen kebersihan yang tidak berbasis air.
en-mt: Hand sanitizers or hand antiseptics are cleaning agents that are not water based.

sourceString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.
targetString: Pada akhir tahun 1990-an dan awal abad ke-21, agen kebersihan tangan berupa penggosok alkohol yang tidak berbasis air (disebut juga penggosok tangan berbasis alkohol, penggosok tangan antiseptik, atau penyanitasi tangan) mulai dikenal.
en-mt: In the late 1990s and early 21st century, hand hygiene agents in the form of non-water-based alcohol rubs (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) became popular.

sourceString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.
targetString: Sebagian besar agen kebersihan ini berbasis isopropil alkohol atau etanol yang diformulasikan bersama dengan bahan pengental seperti Carbomer (polimer asam akrilat) menjadi gel atau bersama humektan seperti gliserin menjadi cairan atau busa agar mudah digunakan dan untuk mengurangi efek mengeringkan dari alkohol.
en-mt: Most of these cleaning agents are isopropyl alcohol or ethanol based which are formulated with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (acrylic acid polymer) to form a gel or with a humectant such as glycerin to form a liquid or foam for ease of use and to reduce the drying effect of alcohol.

sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: Penambahan hidrogen peroksida encer meningkatkan aktivitas antimikroba lebih lanjut. Penyanitasi tangan yang mengandung setidaknya 60-95% alkohol merupakan pembunuh kuman yang efisien.
en-mt: Addition of dilute hydrogen peroxide enhances the antimicrobial activity further. Hand sanitizer that contains at least 60-95% alcohol is an efficient germ killer.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: Penyanitasi alkohol gosok membunuh bakteri, bakteri yang tahan terhadap banyak obat (MRSA dan VRE), bakteri tuberkulosis, sejumlah virus (mencakup HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, dan hepatitis), dan jamur.
en-mt: Rubbing alcohol sanitizer kills bacteria, multidrug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis bacteria, a number of viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis), and fungi.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: Penyanitasi alkohol yang mengandung 70% alkohol membunuh 99,97% (pengurangan log 3,5, mirip dengan pengurangan 35 desibel) bakteri di tangan 30 detik setelah pemakaian dan 99,99% hingga 99,999% (pengurangan log 4 hingga 5) bakteri di tangan 1 menit setelah pemakaian. Penyanitasi tangan paling efektif terhadap bakteri dan kurang efektif terhadap beberapa virus.
en-mt: Alcohol sanitizer containing 70% alcohol kills 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of bacteria on hands 1 minute after use. Hand sanitizer is most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: Penyanitasi tangan berbasis alkohol hampir seluruhnya tidak efektif terhadap virus tipe norovirus (atau Norwalk), penyebab paling umum untuk gastroenteritis menular. Antiseptik tangan atau penggosok alkohol dalam jumlah memadai harus digunakan untuk membasahi atau menutupi dua tangan secara menyeluruh.
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost completely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) strains, the most common cause of infectious gastroenteritis. An adequate amount of hand sanitizer or rubbing alcohol should be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: Bagian depan dan belakang dua tangan serta di sela-sela dan ujung semua jari digosok sekitar 30 detik hingga cairan, busa, atau gel kering.
en-mt: Rub the front and back of both hands and between and tips of all fingers for about 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel dries.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: Ujung jari juga harus dicuci dengan baik dengan menggosoknya di dua telapak tangan. Pusat Pengendalian dan Pencegahan Penyakit AS lebih menyarankan cuci tangan alih-alih penyanitasi tangan gosok, terutama ketika tangan terlihat kotor.
en-mt: The fingertips should also be washed well by rubbing them in the palms of both hands. The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends washing hands instead of rubbing hand sanitizer, especially when hands are visibly dirty.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: Meningkatnya penggunaan agen penyanitasi karena kemudahan penggunaan dan aktivitas pembunuhan yang cepat terhadap mikroorganisme; namun, agen penyanitasi seharusnya tidak digunakan sebagai pengganti cuci tangan yang benar, kecuali sabun dan air tidak tersedia.
en-mt: Increasing use of sanitizing agents because of their ease of use and rapid killing activity of microorganisms; however, sanitizing agents should not be used as a substitute for proper hand washing, unless soap and water are not available.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: Pengunaan penyanitasi tangan berbasis alkohol secara sering dapat menyebabkan kulit kering, kecuali jika emolien dan/atau pelembab kulit ditambahkan ke formula.
en-mt: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can dry out the skin unless skin emollients and/or moisturizers are added to the formula.

sourceString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.
targetString: Efek mengeringkan dari alkohol dapat dikurangi atau dihilangkan dengan menambahkan gliserin dan/atau emolien lain ke formula.
en-mt: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.

sourceString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.
targetString: Dalam uji klinis, penyanitasi tangan berbasis alkohol yang mengandung emolien menyebabkan iritasi dan kekeringan kulit jauh lebih rendah dibandingkan sabun dan deterjen antimikroba.
en-mt: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused significantly less skin irritation and dryness than antimicrobial soaps and detergents.

sourceString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.
targetString: Dermatitis kontak alergik, sindrom urtikaria kontak, atau hipersensitivitas terhadap alkohol atau zat aditif dalam penggosok tangan alkohol jarang terjadi.
en-mt: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticarial syndrome, or hypersensitivity to alcohol or the additives in alcohol hand rubs are rare.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.
targetString: Kecenderungan lebih rendah menyebabkan dermatitis kontak yang mengganggu menjadi daya tarik produk ini dibandingkan mencuci tangan dengan air dan sabun.
en-mt: The lower tendency to cause annoying contact dermatitis is the appeal of this product compared to washing hands with water and soap.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: Meskipun efektif, agen non-air tidak membersihkan tangan dari bahan organik, tetapi hanya mendisinfeksinya.
en-mt: While effective, non-aqueous agents do not clean hands of organic matter, they only disinfect them.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: Karena alasan inilah, pembersih tangan tidak seefektif sabun dan air dalam mencegah penyebaran banyak patogen sebab patogen masih ada di tangan.
en-mt: For this reason, hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water in preventing the spread of many pathogens because the pathogens are still on the hands.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: Kemanjuran penyanitasi tangan bebas alkohol sangat tergantung pada bahan dan formulasinya, dan menurut sejarah, produk ini secara signifikan berkinerja lebih buruk dibandingkan alkohol dan penggosok alkohol.
en-mt: The efficacy of alcohol-free hand sanitizers is highly dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically these products have significantly worse performance than alcohol and alcohol rubs.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: Baru-baru ini, formulasi yang menggunakan benzalkonium klorida terbukti memiliki aktivitas antimikroba yang terus-menerus dan kumulatif setelah pemakaian, tidak seperti alkohol, yang kemanjurannya terbukti berkurang setelah penggunaan berulang, mungkin karena reaksi efek samping yang progresif.
en-mt: Recently, formulations using benzalkonium chloride were shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, whose efficacy was shown to diminish after repeated use, possibly due to progressive side-effect reactions.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
targetString: Banyak orang di komunitas berpenghasilan rendah tidak mampu membeli sabun dan menggunakan abu atau tanah sebagai gantinya.
en-mt: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or earth instead.

sourceString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.
targetString: Abu atau tanah mungkin lebih efektif dibandingkan air saja, tetapi kurang efektif dibandingkan sabun.
en-mt: Ash or earth may be more effective than water alone, but less so than soap.

sourceString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.
targetString: Salah satu yang dikhawatirkan adalah, jika terkontaminasi dengan mikroorganisme, tanah atau abu mungkin akan meningkatkan penyebaran penyakit alih-alih menguranginya.
en-mt: One concern is that, if contaminated with microorganisms, the soil or ash might increase the spread of the disease instead of reducing it.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: Seperti sabun, abu juga merupakan agen desinfektan karena, jika kontak dengan air, abu akan membentuk larutan alkalin.
en-mt: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because, in contact with water, ash forms an alkaline solution.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: WHO merekomendasikan abu dan pasir sebagai alternatif sabun ketika sabun tidak tersedia.
en-mt: WHO recommends ash and sand as an alternative to soap when soap is not available.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: Teknik mencuci tangan yang benar berdasarkan rekomendasi Pusat Pengendalian Penyakit AS untuk pencegahan penularan penyakit mencakup langkah-langkah berikut:
en-mt: Proper hand washing techniques based on recommendations by the US Centers for Disease Control for the prevention of disease transmission include the following steps:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: Basahi tangan dengan air hangat atau dingin yang mengalir.
en-mt: Wet your hands with warm or cold running water.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: Air mengalir direkomendasikan sebab baskom yang didiamkan mungkin terkontaminasi, sedangkan suhu air tampaknya tidak berpengaruh.
en-mt: Running water is recommended because the basin in which it sits may be contaminated, whereas the temperature of the water does not appear to have any effect.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: Busakan tangan dengan menggosoknya dengan sabun yang banyak, termasuk punggung tangan, di sela-sela jari, dan di bawah kuku.
en-mt: Lather your hands by scrubbing them with plenty of soap, including the backs of your hands, between your fingers and under your fingernails.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: Sabun mengangkat kuman dari kulit, dan studi menunjukkan bahwa orang cenderung mencuci tangan lebih saksama saat menggunakan sabun dibandingkan saat menggunakan air saja.
en-mt: Soap removes germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly with soap than with water alone.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Gosok setidaknya selama 20 detik.
en-mt: Rub for at least 20 seconds.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: Menggosok menciptakan gesekan, yang membantu menghilangkan kuman dari kulit, dan menggosok lebih lama menghilangkan lebih banyak kuman.
en-mt: Rubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from the skin, and longer scrubbing removes more germs.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: Bilas secara saksama di bawah air mengalir.
en-mt: Rinse thoroughly under running water.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: Membilas di dalam baskom bisa membuat tangan terkontaminasi kembali.
en-mt: Rinsing in the basin can contaminate hands again.

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: Keringkan dengan lap kering atau biarkan mengering di udara.
en-mt: Dry with a dry cloth or let air dry.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: Tangan yang basah dan lembab lebih mudah terkontaminasi kembali. Daerah yang sering terlewat adalah jempol, pergelangan tangan, daerah di antara jari, dan di bawah kuku.
en-mt: Wet and damp hands are more easily contaminated again. Areas that are often missed are the thumbs, wrists, the area between the fingers, and under the nails.

sourceString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.
targetString: Kuku buatan dan cat kuku yang terkelupas dapat menyimpan mikroorganisme.
en-mt: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish can harbor microorganisms.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: Losion berpelembab sering direkomendasikan untuk menjaga agar tangan tidak mengering; kulit kering dapat menyebabkan kerusakan kulit yang dapat meningkatkan risiko penularan infeksi.
en-mt: Moisturizing lotions are often recommended to keep hands from drying out; dry skin can cause skin breakdown which can increase the risk of infection transmission.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: Berbagai pilihan berbiaya rendah dapat dibuat untuk memfasilitasi mencuci tangan saat air keran dan/atau sabun tidak tersedia, misalnya, mengalirkan air dari jerigen atau botol yang digantung dan dilubangi dan/atau menggunakan abu, jika perlu, di negara berkembang. Dalam situasi ketika pasokan air terbatas (seperti sekolah atau daerah pedesaan di negara berkembang), ada solusi hemat air, seperti "tippy-tap", serta pilihan berbiaya rendah lainnya.
en-mt: A variety of low-cost options can be devised to facilitate hand washing when tap water and/or soap is not available, for example, draining water from jerry cans or bottles that are hung and perforated and/or using ash, where necessary, in developing countries. In situations where water supply is limited (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-saving solutions, such as "tippy-tap", as well as other low-cost options.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: Keran tippy adalah teknologi sederhana yang menggunakan botol air yang digantung dengan tali, tuas yang dioperasikan oleh kaki untuk menuangkan sedikit air ke tangan, dan sebatang sabun.
en-mt: A tippy faucet is a simple technology that uses a water bottle suspended from a string, a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water into your hand, and a bar of soap.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: Pengeringan tangan yang efektif adalah bagian penting dalam proses kebersihan tangan, tetapi ada perdebatan tentang bentuk pengeringan tangan paling efektif di toilet umum.
en-mt: Effective hand drying is an important part of hand hygiene, but there is debate about the most effective form of hand drying in public restrooms.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: Semakin banyak penelitian menunjukkan bahwa lap kertas jauh lebih bersih dibandingkan pengering tangan listrik yang ditemukan di banyak toilet.
en-mt: A growing body of research shows that paper towels are much cleaner than the electric hand dryers found in many restrooms.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: Pada tahun 2008, sebuah studi dilakukan oleh Universitas Westminster, London, dan disponsori oleh industri lap kertas European Tissue Symposium, untuk membandingkan tingkat kebersihan lap kertas, pengering tangan udara hangat, dan pengering tangan udara jet yang lebih moderen.
en-mt: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the European Tissue Symposium paper towel industry, to compare the cleanliness of paper towels, warm air hand dryers, and the more modern jet air hand dryers.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: Setelah mencuci dan mengeringkan tangan dengan pengering udara hangat, jumlah total bakteri ditemukan meningkat rata-rata 194% di buku-buku jari dan 254% di telapak tangan.
en-mt: After washing and drying hands with a warm air dryer, the total count of bacteria was found to increase by an average of 194% in the knuckles and 254% in the palms.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: Mengeringkan dengan pengering udara jet menyebabkan kenaikan jumlah total bakteri rata-rata 42% di buku-buku jari dan 15% di telapak tangan.
en-mt: Drying with a jet air dryer led to an average increase in total bacterial counts of 42% on the knuckles and 15% on the palms.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: Setelah mencuci dan mengeringkan tangan dengan lap kertas, jumlah total bakteri berkurang rata-rata 76% di buku-buku jari dan 77% di telapak tangan.Ilmuwan juga melakukan pengujian untuk menentukan potensi kontaminasi silang pada pengguna toilet lain dan lingkungan toilet akibat tiap-tiap jenis metode pengeringan.
en-mt: After washing and drying hands with paper towels, the total count of bacteria was reduced by an average of 76% on the knuckles and 77% on the palms. type of drying method.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.
targetString: Pengering udara jet, yang mengembuskan udara dari unit dengan kecepatan yang diklaim 180 m/s (650 km/jam; 400 mph), mampu meniup mikroorganisme dari tangan dan unit dan berpotensi mencemari pengguna toilet lain dan lingkungan toilet hingga sejauh 2 meter.
en-mt: The jet air dryer, which blows air from the unit at a claimed speed of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), is capable of blowing microorganisms off hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other toilet users and the toilet environment up to 2 meters.

sourceString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.
targetString: Penggunaan pengering tangan udara hangat menyebarkan mikroorganisme hingga 0,25 meter dari pengering.
en-mt: Use of a warm air hand dryer disperses microorganisms up to 0.25 meters from the dryer.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.
targetString: Lap kertas tidak menunjukkan penyebaran mikroorganisme yang signifikan. Pada tahun 2005, dalam studi yang dilakukan oleh TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, berbagai metode pengeringan tangan dievaluasi.
en-mt: Paper towels did not show significant spread of microorganisms. In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, various methods of hand drying were evaluated.

sourceString: The following changes in the bacterial count after drying the hands were observed:
targetString: Setelah pengeringan tangan, perubahan jumlah bakteri berikut diamati:
en-mt: After hand drying, the following changes in bacterial counts were observed:

sourceString: Many different hand dryer manufacturers exist, and hand driers have been compared against drying with paper towels.
targetString: Ada banyak manufaktur pengering tangan, dan pengering tangan telah dibandingkan dengan pengeringan dengan menggunakan lap kertas.
en-mt: There are many manufacturers of hand dryers, and hand dryers have been compared to drying with paper towels.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.
targetString: Mencuci tangan dengan menggunakan tisu penyanitasi tangan adalah alternatif selama berpergian jika tidak ada sabun dan air.
en-mt: Washing hands using hand sanitizer is an alternative when traveling if soap and water are not available.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.
targetString: Penyanitasi tangan berbasis alkohol harus mengandung setidaknya 60% alkohol.
