en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer must contain at least 60% alcohol.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: Pencucian tangan medis diwajibkan jauh setelah ahli fisika Hungaria Ignaz Semmelweis menemukan keefektifannya (pada tahun 1846) dalam mencegah penyakit di lingkungan rumah sakit.
en-mt: Medical hand washing became mandatory long after the Hungarian physicist Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: Ada perangkat elektronik yang menyediakan umpan balik untuk mengingatkan karyawan rumah sakit untuk mencuci tangan jika mereka lupa.
en-mt: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital employees to wash their hands if they forget.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: Satu studi menemukan bahwa tingkat infeksi menurun dengan penggunaan perangkat tersebut.
en-mt: One study found that infection rates decreased with use of the devices.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: Pencucian tangan medis dilakukan selama minimal 15 detik, dengan menggunakan sabun dan air dalam jumlah banyak atau gel untuk menyabuni dan menggosok setiap bagian tangan.
en-mt: Medical hand washing is performed for at least 15 seconds, using large amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub every part of the hands.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: Tangan harus digosok satu sama lain dengan jari-jari saling bertautan.
en-mt: Hands should be rubbed against each other with fingers interlocked.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: Jika ada kotoran di bawah kuku, sikat bulu dapat digunakan untuk menghilangkannya.
en-mt: If there is dirt under the nails, a bristle brush can be used to remove it.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: Karena kuman dapat bertahan dalam air yang ada di tangan, tangan perlu dibilas dengan saksama dan dikeringkan dengan lap bersih.
en-mt: Because germs can survive in water on hands, hands need to be rinsed thoroughly and dried with a clean cloth.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).
targetString: Setelah kering, lap kertas digunakan untuk mematikan keran air (dan membuka pintu keluar jika perlu).
en-mt: Once dry, a paper towel is used to turn off the water faucet (and open the outlet if necessary).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: Tindakan ini menghindari rekontaminasi tangan dari permukaan tersebut.
en-mt: This avoids recontamination of hands from these surfaces.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: Tujuan mencuci tangan dalam tatanan perawatan kesehatan adalah untuk menghilangkan mikroorganisme patogen ("kuman") dan menghindari penularannya.
en-mt: The purpose of hand washing in healthcare settings is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: The New England Journal of Medicine melaporkan bahwa kurangnya mencuci tangan masih pada tingkat yang tidak dapat diterima di sebagian besar lingkungan medis, dengan sejumlah besar dokter dan perawat terus lupa mencuci tangan sebelum menyentuh pasien sehingga menularkan mikroorganisme.
en-mt: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that the lack of hand washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical settings, with large numbers of doctors and nurses continuing to forget to wash their hands before touching patients and thus transmitting microorganisms.

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
targetString: Satu studi menunjukkan bahwa mencuci tangan yang benar dan prosedur sederhana lainnya dapat menurunkan tingkat infeksi aliran darah terkait kateter hingga 66 persen. Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia telah menerbitkan lembaran yang menunjukkan standar cuci tangan dan gosok tangan di sektor perawatan kesehatan.
en-mt: One study showed that proper hand washing and other simple procedures can reduce the rate of catheter-associated bloodstream infections by up to 66 percent. The World Health Organization has published a sheet showing handwashing and handrubbing standards in the health care sector.

sourceString: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website for public comment.
targetString: Pedoman konsep kebersihan tangan WHO juga dapat dilihat di situs webnya untuk komentar publik.
en-mt: The WHO's hand hygiene concept guidelines are also available on its website for public comment.

sourceString: A relevant review was conducted by Whitby et al.
targetString: Tinjauan yang relevan dilakukan oleh Whitby et al.
en-mt: A relevant review was carried out by Whitby et al.

sourceString: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.
targetString: Perangkat komersil dapat mengukur dan memvalidasi kebersihan tangan jika demonstrasi kepatuhan terhadap peraturan diperlukan.
en-mt: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.

sourceString: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
targetString: Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia memiliki "Lima Saat" untuk mencuci tangan:
en-mt: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:

sourceString: after exposure to blood/body fluids
targetString: setelah terpapar ke darah/cairan tubuh
en-mt: after exposure to blood/body fluids

sourceString: before an aseptic task, and
targetString: sebelum tugas aseptik, dan
en-mt: before aseptic duty, and

sourceString: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
targetString: setelah perawatan pasien. Penambahan bahan kimia antiseptik ke sabun (sabun "obat" atau "antimikroba") berfungsi membunuh bahan cuci tangan.
en-mt: after patient care. The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicinal" or "antimicrobial" soaps) kills the hand washing agent.

sourceString: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
targetString: Fungsi membunuh tersebut mungkin diinginkan sebelum melakukan bedah atau dalam situasi ketika organisme yang tahan antibiotik sangat lazim. Untuk 'menggosok' tangan sebelum operasi bedah, diperlukan keran yang dapat dinyalakan dan dimatikan tanpa menyentuh, pencuci klorheksidin atau yodium, lap steril untuk mengeringkan tangan setelah mencuci, dan sikat steril untuk menggosok serta instrumen steril lainnya untuk membersihkan bawah kuku.
en-mt: Such killing function may be desirable before performing surgery or in situations where antibiotic resistant organisms are very common. To 'rub' hands before surgery, a tap that can be turned on and off without touching, chlorhexidine or iodine washes, a sterile cloth to dry hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and other sterile instruments to clean under the nails.

sourceString: All jewelry should be removed.
targetString: Semua perhiasan harus dilepaskan.
en-mt: All jewelry must be removed.

sourceString: This procedure requires washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.
targetString: Prosedur ini mensyaratkan mencuci tangan dan lengan bawah sampai ke siku, biasanya 2–6 menit.
en-mt: This procedure involves washing hands and forearms up to the elbows, usually 2–6 minutes.

sourceString: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are not necessary.
targetString: Waktu penggosokan yang lama (10 menit) tidak diperlukan.
en-mt: Long scrubbing times (10 minutes) are not required.

sourceString: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from running back to the hands.
targetString: Ketika membilas, air di lengan bawah harus dicegah agar tidak mengalir kembali ke tangan.
en-mt: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from flowing back into the hands.

sourceString: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.
targetString: Setelah selesai mencuci tangan, tangan dikeringkan dengan kain steril dan jubah bedah dikenakan.
en-mt: After washing hands, hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is put on.

sourceString: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.
targetString: Untuk mengurangi penyebaran kuman, lebih baik mencuci tangan atau menggunakan penyanitasi tangan sebelum dan setelah menangani orang sakit.
en-mt: To reduce the spread of germs, it's better to wash your hands or use hand sanitizer before and after handling sick people.

sourceString: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.
targetString: Untuk pengendalian infeksi stafilokokus di rumah sakit, ditemukan bahwa manfaat terbesar membersihkan tangan berasal dari 20% pertama pencucian, dan bahwa manfaat tambahan yang didapatkan sangat sedikit saat frekuensi pembersihan tangan ditingkatkan di atas 35%.
en-mt: For the control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it was found that the greatest benefit of hand hygiene came from the first 20% of washing, and that the additional benefit was minimal when the frequency of hand cleaning was increased above 35%.

sourceString: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
targetString: Mencuci dengan sabun biasa mengakibatkan lebih dari tiga kali lipat penularan penyakit infeksi ke makanan dibandingkan mencuci dengan sabun antibakteri. Pembandingan antara menggosok tangan dengan larutan berbasis alkohol dan mencuci tangan dengan sabun antibakteri dengan waktu median masing-masing 30 detik menunjukkan bahwa penggosok tangan berbasis alkohol mengurangi kontaminasi bakteri 26% lebih banyak daripada sabun antibakteri.
en-mt: Washing with ordinary soap results in more than three times the transmission of infectious diseases to food compared to washing with antibacterial soap. A comparison between rubbing hands with an alcohol-based solution and washing hands with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that alcohol-based hand rubs reduced bacterial contamination by 26% more than antibacterial soaps.

sourceString: But soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands.Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.
targetString: Namun, sabun dan air lebih efektif daripada penggosok tangan berbasis alkohol untuk mengurangi virus influenza A H1N1 dan spora Clostridium difficile dari tangan. Intervensi untuk meningkatkan kebersihan tangan di tatanan perawatan kesehatan dapat melibatkan pendidikan untuk staf tentang mencuci tangan, meningkatkan ketersediaan penggosok tangan berbasis alkohol, dan pengingat tertulis serta lisan kepada staf.
en-mt: However, soap and water were more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing influenza A H1N1 virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands. Interventions to improve hand hygiene in health care settings could involve education for staff about hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rubs, and written and verbal reminders to staff.

sourceString: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
targetString: Diperlukan lebih banyak penelitian untuk mengetahui intervensi yang paling efektif di berbagai tatanan perawatan kesehatan.
en-mt: More research is needed to find out which interventions are most effective in various health care settings.

sourceString: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.
targetString: Di negara berkembang, mencuci tangan dengan sabun diakui sebagai cara mendasar yang hemat biaya untuk mencapai kesehatan yang baik dan bahkan nutrisi yang baik.
en-mt: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a fundamental, cost-effective way to achieve good health and even good nutrition.

sourceString: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.
targetString: Namun, kurangnya pasokan air yang dapat diandalkan, sabun, atau fasilitas cuci tangan di rumah penduduk, sekolah, dan tempat kerja membuat sasaran untuk mencapai perilaku cuci tangan yang universal menjadi sebuah tantangan.
en-mt: However, the lack of a reliable supply of water, soap or handwashing facilities in people's homes, schools and workplaces makes the goal of achieving universal handwashing a challenge.

sourceString: For example, in most of rural Africa hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheap options exist to build hand washing stations.
targetString: Sebagai contoh, di sebagian besar daerah pedesaan di Afrika, keran cuci tangan di dekat toilet pribadi atau toilet umum jarang ada, meskipun tersedia opsi untuk membuat tempat cuci tangan yang murah.
en-mt: For example, in most rural areas of Africa, handwashing faucets near private or public toilets are rare, although there are options for inexpensive handwashing stations.

sourceString: However, low hand washing rates rather can also be the result of engrained habits rather than due to a lack of soap or water.
targetString: Bagaimana pun, rendahnya tingkat pencucian tangan dapat juga terjadi karena kebiasaan yang telah tertanam dan bukan karena kurangnya sabun atau air.
en-mt: However, low levels of hand washing can also be due to ingrained habits and not to a lack of soap or water.

sourceString: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.
targetString: Dorongan dan anjuran mencuci tangan dengan sabun dapat memengaruhi keputusan kebijakan, meningkatkan kesadaran tentang manfaat cuci tangan, dan menghasilkan perubahan perilaku populasi jangka panjang.
en-mt: Encouragement and encouragement of handwashing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of handwashing, and produce long-term changes in population behavior.

sourceString: For this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.
targetString: Agar berjalan efektif, pengawasan dan evaluasi diperlukan.
en-mt: To be effective, monitoring and evaluation is necessary.

sourceString: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective.One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.
targetString: Tinjauan sistematik terhadap 70 studi menemukan bahwa pendekatan berbasis komunitas efektif dalam meningkatkan cuci tangan di LMIC, sementara kampanye pemasaran sosial kurang efektif. Salah satu contoh penggalakan cuci tangan di sekolah adalah "Pendekatan Tiga Bintang" oleh UNICEF yang mendorong sekolah untuk mengambil langkah-langkah sederhana dan murah untuk memastikan siswa mencuci tangan dengan sabun, di antara persyaratan kebersihan lainnya.
en-mt: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches were effective in increasing handwashing at LMIC, while social marketing campaigns were less effective. One example of promoting handwashing in schools is the “Three Star Approach” by UNICEF which encourages schools to take simple and inexpensive steps to ensure students wash their hands with soap, among other hygiene requirements.

sourceString: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from one to ultimately three stars.
targetString: Saat standar minimum tercapai, sekolah dapat bergerak dari satu bintang hingga akhirnya ke tiga bintang.
en-mt: When minimum standards are met, schools can move from one star to finally three stars.

sourceString: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and child mortality.
targetString: Membangun tempat cuci tangan bisa menjadi bagian dari kampanye penggalakan cuci tangan yang dilakukan guna mengurangi penyakit dan kematian anak.
en-mt: Building a handwashing station can be part of a campaign to promote handwashing to reduce child illness and death.

sourceString: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change.As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the adoption of a handwashing emoji.
targetString: Hari Mencuci Tangan Sedunia adalah contoh lain kampanye peningkatan kesadaran yang mencoba mencapai tujuan perubahan perilaku. Akibat pandemi virus korona 2019-2020, UNICEF menggalakkan pemakaian emoji cuci tangan.
en-mt: World Handwashing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign trying to achieve behavior change goals. As a result of the 2019-2020 corona virus pandemic, UNICEF is promoting the use of the hand washing emoji.

sourceString: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.
targetString: Beberapa studi meneliti keefektifan biaya mencuci tangan secara keseluruhan di negara-negara berkembang dalam kaitannya dengan penghindaran Disability-adjusted Life Year (DALY) atau ukuran tahun yang hilang akibat sakit.
en-mt: Several studies have examined the overall cost-effectiveness of handwashing in developing countries in relation to disability-adjusted life year (DALY) avoidance or a measure of years lost due to illness.

sourceString: However, one review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.
targetString: Satu tinjauan menunjukkan bahwa menggalakkan cuci tangan dengan sabun secara signifikan lebih hemat biaya alih-alih intervensi air dan sanitasi lainnya.
en-mt: One review showed that promoting handwashing with soap was significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.

sourceString: The importance of hand washing for human health – particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances like mothers who had just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".
targetString: Pentingnya mencuci tangan untuk kesehatan manusia, terutama bagi orang dalam keadaan rentan, seperti ibu yang baru melahirkan atau tentara yang terluka di rumah sakit, pertama kali dikenali pada pertengahan abad ke-19 oleh dua pelopor kebersihan tangan: dokter Hungaria Ignaz Semmelweis yang bekerja di Wina, Austria, dan Florence Nightingale, "pendiri keperawatan moderen" di Inggris.
en-mt: The importance of hand washing for human health, especially for people in vulnerable situations, such as mothers who have just given birth or soldiers who are injured in a hospital, was first recognized in the mid-19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna. , Austria, and Florence Nightingale, "founder of modern nursing" in England.

sourceString: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul odors called miasmas.
targetString: Pada saat itu, banyak orang masih percaya bahwa infeksi disebabkan oleh bau busuk yang disebut miasma atau udara buruk.
en-mt: At that time, many people still believed that infection was caused by a bad smell called miasma or bad air.

sourceString: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.
targetString: Pada tahun 1980-an, wabah yang ditularkan melalui makanan dan infeksi yang berhubungan dengan perawatan kesehatan membuat Pusat Pengendalian dan Pencegahan Penyakit Amerika Serikat lebih aktif mendorong kebersihan tangan sebagai cara penting untuk mencegah penyebaran infeksi.
en-mt: In the 1980s, outbreaks of food-borne and healthcare-related infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to become more active in promoting hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.

sourceString: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect oneself from such infectious diseases.
targetString: Wabah flu babi pada tahun 2009 dan pandemi COVID-19 pada tahun 2020 meningkatkan kesadaran di banyak negara akan pentingnya mencuci tangan dengan sabun untuk melindungi diri dari penyakit menular tersebut.
en-mt: The swine flu outbreak in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 raised awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect against this infectious disease.

sourceString: For example, posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.
targetString: Sebagai contoh, poster "teknik mencuci tangan yang benar" digantung di sebelah wastafel cuci tangan di toilet umum serta di toilet gedung perkantoran dan bandara di Jerman.
en-mt: For example, posters on "correct hand washing techniques" are hung next to handwashing sinks in public restrooms as well as in toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.

sourceString: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something, means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share complicity in it.
targetString: Ungkapan "mencuci tangan dari" sesuatu berarti menyatakan keengganan seseorang untuk bertanggung jawab atas sesuatu atau ikut terlibat dalam sesuatu.
en-mt: The expression "wash one's hands of" something implies one's unwillingness to take responsibility for something or get involved in something.

sourceString: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.
targetString: Ungkapan itu berasal dari pasal Alkitab di kitab Matius ketika Pontius Pilatus mencuci tangan atas keputusan untuk menyalibkan Yesus Kristus, tetapi telah menjadi ungkapan yang dipakai luas di komunitas Inggris.
en-mt: The expression originates from the Bible passage in the book of Matthew when Pontius Pilate washed his hands over the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a widely used phrase in the British community.

sourceString: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain, representing her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.
targetString: Dalam karya Shakespeare, Macbeth, Lady Macbeth mulai mencuci tangannya terus menerus untuk membersihkan noda imajiner; tindakan yang menunjukkan rasa bersalahnya atas kejahatan yang dia lakukan dan karena telah membujuk suaminya agar melakukannya.
en-mt: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth starts washing her hands over and over again to wash away imaginary stains; an act that shows her guilt for the crime she committed and for having persuaded her husband to commit it.

sourceString: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others, and tend to value hand washing equipment more.
targetString: Juga telah diketahui bahwa, setelah mengingat atau merenungkan tindakan yang tidak etis, orang cenderung lebih sering mencuci tangan dan cenderung lebih menghargai peralatan mencuci tangan.
en-mt: It has also been found that, after remembering or contemplating an unethical act, people tend to wash their hands more frequently and tend to value handwashing equipment more.

sourceString: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.
targetString: Lebih lanjut, orang yang dibiarkan mencuci tangan setelah perenungan tersebut memiliki kemugkinan lebih kecil terlibat dalam tindakan kompensasi yang "membersihkan", seperti menjadi sukarelawan.
en-mt: Furthermore, people who were allowed to wash their hands after the rumination were less likely to engage in "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.

sourceString: Religions prescribe hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes.Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.
targetString: Agama memerintahkan pencucian tangan untuk tujuan kebersihan dan simbolis. Pencucian tangan simbolis, yang menggunakan air, tetapi tanpa sabun untuk mencuci tangan, adalah bagian ritual mencuci tangan dalam banyak agama, termasuk Kepercayaan Bahá'í, Hindu, tevilah dan netilat yadayim dalam Yahudi, Lavabo dalam Kristen, dan Wudhu dalam Islam. Agama juga memerintahkan pencucian tangan untuk kebersihan, terutama setelah tindakan tertentu.
en-mt: Religion commands hand washing for hygienic and symbolic purposes. Symbolic hand washing, which uses water, but no soap to wash hands, is a ritual part of hand washing in many religions, including the Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudu in Islam. Religion also commands hand washing for cleanliness, especially after certain acts.

sourceString: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.
targetString: Agama Hindu, Yahudi, dan Islam mewajibkan cuci tangan setelah menggunakan toilet.
en-mt: Hindu, Jewish and Islamic religions require washing hands after using the toilet.

sourceString: And, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.
targetString: Selain itu, agama Hindu, Buddha, Sikh, Yahudi, dan Islam mewajibkan cuci tangan sebelum dan sesudah makan.
en-mt: In addition, Hindu, Buddhist, Sikh, Jewish and Islamic religions require washing hands before and after eating.

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
targetString: Pengendalian bahaya tempat kerja untuk COVID-19
en-mt: Control of workplace hazards for COVID-19

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Pengendalian bahaya tempat kerja untuk COVID-19 adalah penerapan metodologi keselamatan dan kesehatan kerja untuk pengendalian bahaya guna pencegahan penyakit koronavirus 2019 (COVID-19).
en-mt: Workplace hazard control for COVID-19 is the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard control for the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.
targetString: Pengendalian bahaya yang tepat di tempat kerja tergantung pada lokasi kerja dan tugas pekerjaan, yang didasarkan pada penilaian risiko sumber paparan, tingkat keparahan penyakit di masyarakat, dan faktor risiko masing-masing pekerja yang mungkin rentan tertular COVID-19.
en-mt: Appropriate control of hazards in the workplace depends on the work location and job duties, which are based on an assessment of the risk of the source of exposure, the severity of disease in the community, and individual worker risk factors that may be susceptible to contracting COVID-19.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Menurut Administrasi Keselamatan dan Kesehatan Kerja (OSHA) AS, pekerjaan berisiko paparan rendah memiliki kontak pekerjaan yang minimal dengan publik dan rekan kerja lainnya; untuk pekerjaan ini, dianjurkan langkah-langkah pencegahan infeksi dasar, yang mencakup mencuci tangan, mendorong pekerja untuk tinggal di rumah jika sakit, etika pernapasan, dan melakukan pembersihan serta disinfeksi lingkungan kerja secara rutin.
en-mt: According to the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), low exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other co-workers; for these jobs, basic infection prevention measures are recommended, which include hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if sick, respiratory etiquette, and regular cleaning and disinfection of the work environment.

sourceString: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
targetString: Pekerjaan berisiko paparan sedang mencakup pekerjaan yang membutuhkan kontak dekat atau sering dengan orang yang tidak diketahui atau diduga menderita COVID-19, tetapi mungkin terinfeksi karena penularan di masyarakat yang sedang berlangsung atau perjalanan internasional.
en-mt: Moderate exposure risk includes work that requires close or frequent contact with people who are not known or suspected of having COVID-19, but who may become infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.

sourceString: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
targetString: Kelompok ini termasuk pekerja yang memiliki kontak dengan masyarakat umum seperti di sekolah, lingkungan kerja dengan kepadatan populasi tinggi, dan tatanan ritel volume tinggi.
en-mt: This group includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, work environments with high population densities, and high-volume retail settings.

sourceString: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
targetString: Pengendalian bahaya untuk kelompok ini, selain langkah-langkah pencegahan infeksi dasar, mencakup ventilasi menggunakan saringan udara efisiensi tinggi, pelindung terhadap bersin, dan menyediakan alat pelindung diri apabila bertemu dengan penderita COVID-19.
en-mt: Hazard control for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, includes ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, protection against sneezing, and providing personal protective equipment when meeting people with COVID-19.

sourceString: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
targetString: OSHA menganggap tenaga kesehatan dan kamar mayat yang terpapar pada orang yang diketahui atau diduga menderita COVID-19 berisiko paparan tinggi, yang meningkat menjadi berisiko paparan sangat tinggi jika pekerja melakukan prosedur penghasil aerosol pada, atau mengambil atau menangani spesimen dari, orang yang diketahui atau diduga menderita COVID-19.
en-mt: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to people known or suspected to have COVID-19 at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, people known or suspected suffering from COVID-19.

sourceString: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
targetString: Pengendalian bahaya yang sesuai untuk pekerja ini mencakup pengendalian teknik, seperti ruang ventilasi bertekanan negatif, dan alat pelindung diri yang sesuai dengan tugas pekerjaan.
en-mt: Appropriate hazard controls for these workers include engineering controls, such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to job duties.

sourceString: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
targetString: Wabah COVID-19 dapat memiliki beberapa dampak di tempat kerja.
en-mt: The COVID-19 outbreak can have several impacts in the workplace.

sourceString: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
targetString: Pekerja mungkin tidak datang bekerja karena sakit, perlu merawat orang lain, atau karena takut akan kemungkinan paparan.
en-mt: Workers may not come to work because they are sick, need to care for someone else, or because they are afraid of possible exposure.

sourceString: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
targetString: Pola perdagangan dapat berubah, baik dalam hal jenis barang yang diminta maupun cara memperoleh barang-barang ini (seperti berbelanja di luar jam sibuk, melalui pengiriman, atau lantatur).
en-mt: Trade patterns are subject to change, both in terms of the types of goods demanded and the ways in which these goods are obtained (such as off-peak shopping, through delivery, or drift).

sourceString: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
targetString: Akhirnya, pengiriman barang dari wilayah geografis yang sangat terdampak COVID-19 dapat terganggu. Kesiapsiagaan dan rencana penanggulangan penyakit infeksi dapat digunakan untuk memandu tindakan perlindungan.
en-mt: Finally, the delivery of goods from geographic areas that are heavily affected by COVID-19 may be disrupted. Infectious disease preparedness and control plans can be used to guide protective measures.

sourceString: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
targetString: Rencana mempertimbangkan tingkat risiko yang terkait dengan berbagai tempat kerja dan tugas pekerjaan, mencakup sumber paparan, faktor risiko yang timbul dari tatanan rumah dan masyarakat, serta faktor risiko masing-masing pekerja, seperti usia tua atau kondisi medis kronis.
en-mt: The plan considers the level of risk associated with various workplaces and job duties, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and individual worker risk factors, such as old age or chronic medical conditions.

sourceString: They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
targetString: Rencana juga menguraikan pengendalian yang diperlukan untuk mengatasi risiko tersebut dan rencana darurat untuk situasi yang mungkin timbul sebagai akibat dari wabah.
en-mt: The plan also outlines the controls needed to address those risks and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of an outbreak.

sourceString: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
targetString: Kesiapsiagaan dan rencana penanggulangan penyakit menular mungkin tunduk pada rekomendasi nasional atau subnasional.
en-mt: Communicable disease preparedness and control plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.

sourceString: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
targetString: Tujuan penanggulangan wabah mencakup mengurangi penularan di antara staf, melindungi orang yang berisiko lebih tinggi untuk komplikasi kesehatan yang buruk, mempertahankan operasi bisnis, dan meminimalkan efek buruk pada entitas lain dalam rantai pasokan.
en-mt: Outbreak management goals include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in the supply chain.

sourceString: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
targetString: Tingkat keparahan penyakit di komunitas tempat bisnis berada memengaruhi tindakan penanggulangan yang diambil.
en-mt: The severity of the disease in the community where the business is located influences the response actions taken.

sourceString: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
targetString: Hirarki pengendalian bahaya adalah kerangka kerja yang banyak digunakan dalam keselamatan dan kesehatan kerja untuk mengelompokkan pengendalian bahaya berdasarkan keefektifannya.
en-mt: The hazard control hierarchy is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to classify hazard controls based on their effectiveness.

sourceString: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
targetString: Apabila bahaya COVID-19 tidak dapat dihilangkan, pengendalian paling efektif adalah pengendalian teknis, diikuti pengedalian administratif, dan terakhir alat pelindung diri.
en-mt: If the COVID-19 hazard cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are technical controls, followed by administrative controls, and finally personal protective equipment.

sourceString: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
targetString: Pengendalian teknis meliputi mengisolasi karyawan dari bahaya terkait pekerjaan tanpa bergantung pada perilaku pekerja dan dapat menjadi solusi paling hemat biaya untuk diterapkan.
en-mt: Technical controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards regardless of worker behavior and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.

sourceString: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
targetString: Pengendalian administratif adalah perubahan dalam kebijakan atau prosedur kerja yang memerlukan tindakan pekerja atau pemberi kerja.
en-mt: Administrative controls are changes in work policies or procedures that require the action of workers or employers.

sourceString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
targetString: Alat pelindung diri (APD) dianggap kurang efektif dibandingkan pengendalian teknik dan administratif, tetapi dapat membantu mencegah sebagian paparan.
en-mt: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but may help prevent some exposures.

sourceString: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
targetString: Semua jenis APD harus dipilih berdasarkan bahaya pada pekerja, dipasang dengan benar sebagaimana berlaku (misalnya, respirator), dikenakan secara konsisten dan benar, diperiksa, dirawat, dan diganti secara berkala, jika perlu, dan dilepas, dibersihkan, dan disimpan dengan benar atau dibuang untuk menghindari kontaminasi.
en-mt: All types of PPE must be selected based on the hazard to the worker, fitted properly as applicable (e.g. respirators), worn consistently and correctly, inspected, maintained and replaced periodically, if necessary, and removed, cleaned and stored properly or disposed of to avoid contamination.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
targetString: Menurut Administrasi Keselamatan dan Kesehatan Kerja (OSHA) AS, pekerjaan berisiko paparan rendah memiliki kontak pekerjaan yang minimal dengan publik dan rekan kerja lainnya.
en-mt: According to the US Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), low exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other co-workers.

sourceString: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Langkah-langkah pencegahan infeksi dasar yang direkomendasikan untuk semua tempat kerja termasuk sering mencuci tangan secara saksama, mendorong pekerja untuk tinggal di rumah jika sakit, etika pernapasan mencakup menutupi batuk dan bersin, menyediakan jaringan dan wadah sampah, mempersiapkan kerja dari jarak jauh atau giliran kerja dengan waktu kedatangan/kepulangan bertahap, jika diperlukan, memberi tahu pekerja untuk tidak menggunakan alat dan perlengkapan orang lain, dan melakukan pembersihan dan disinfeksi lingkungan kerja secara rutin.
en-mt: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for remote work or shift work with gradual arrival/return times, if necessary, notify workers not to use other people's tools and equipment, and carry out routine cleaning and disinfection of the work environment.

sourceString: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
targetString: Identifikasi yang cepat dan isolasi terhadap individu yang berpotensi menularkan adalah langkah penting dalam melindungi pekerja, pelanggan, pengunjung, dan orang lain di tempat kerja.
en-mt: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is an important step in protecting workers, customers, visitors and others in the workplace.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.
targetString: Pusat Pengendalian dan Pencegahan Penyakit (CDC) AS merekomendasikan agar karyawan yang memiliki gejala penyakit pernapasan akut harus tinggal di rumah hingga mereka bebas dari demam, tanda-tanda demam, dan gejala lainnya selama setidaknya 24 jam tanpa menggunakan obat penurun demam atau obat pengubah gejala lainnya, dan agar kebijakan cuti sakit bersifat fleksibel sehingga memungkinkan karyawan untuk tinggal di rumah untuk merawat anggota keluarga yang sakit, dan agar karyawan mengetahui kebijakan ini.
en-mt: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees with symptoms of acute respiratory illness stay home until they are free of fever, signs of fever, and other symptoms for at least 24 hours without taking fever-reducing or other symptom-modifying medications. , and for sick leave policies to be flexible to allow employees to stay home to care for sick family members, and for employees to be aware of these policies.

sourceString: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.
targetString: Menurut OSHA, pekerjaan berisiko paparan sedang mencakup pekerjaan yang membutuhkan kontak dekat atau sering dalam jarak enam kaki (1,8 meter) dengan orang yang tidak diketahui atau diduga menderita COVID-19, tetapi mungkin terinfeksi dengan SARS-CoV-2 karena penularan di masyarakat sekitar lokasi bisnis, atau karena seseorang baru melakukan perjalanan internasional ke lokasi dengan penularan COVID-19 yang luas.
en-mt: According to OSHA, moderate exposure risk occupations include work that requires close or frequent contact within six feet (1.8 meters) of people who are not known or suspected to have COVID-19, but who may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to community transmission around a business location, or because someone has recently traveled internationally to a location with widespread transmission of COVID-19.

sourceString: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.
targetString: Kelompok ini termasuk pekerja yang memiliki kontak dengan masyarakat umum seperti di sekolah, lingkungan kerja dengan kepadatan populasi tinggi, dan tatanan ritel volume tinggi. Pengendalian teknik untuk kelompok ini dan kelompok berisiko tinggi mencakup memasang filter udara efisiensi tinggi, meningkatkan tingkat ventilasi, memasang penghalang fisik seperti plastik bening penjaga bersin, dan memasang jendela drive-thru atau lantatur untuk layanan pelanggan. Pengendalian administratif untuk kelompok ini dan kelompok berisiko tinggi mencakup mendorong pekerja yang sakit untuk tinggal di rumah, mengganti pertemuan tatap muka dengan komunikasi virtual, membuat giliran kerja dengan waktu kedatangan/kepulangan bertahap, menghentikan perjalanan nonesensial ke lokasi yang sedang mengalami wabah COVID-19, mengembangkan rencana komunikasi darurat mencakup forum untuk menjawab keprihatinan pekerja, memperlengkapi pekerja dengan pendidikan dan pelatihan terkini tentang faktor risiko COVID-19 dan perilaku protektif, melatih pekerja yang perlu menggunakan pakaian dan alat pelindung tentang cara menggunakannya, menyediakan sumber daya dan lingkungan kerja yang mendukung higiene pribadi dan mengharuskan mencuci tangan secara teratur, membatasi akses pelanggan dan publik ke tempat kerja, dan memasang penanda peringatan tentang mencuci tangan dan langkah perlindungan COVID-19 lainnya. Bergantung pada tugas kerja, pekerja dengan setidaknya risiko paparan sedang mungkin perlu memakai alat pelindung diri mencakup kombinasi sarung tangan, jubah, perisai wajah atau masker wajah, atau kacamata pelindung.
en-mt: This group includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, work environments with high population densities, and high volume retail settings. Engineering controls for this group and high-risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing drive-thru windows for customer service. Administrative controls for this group and high-risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communication, creating shifts with gradual arrival/departure times, stopping non-essential travel to locations experiencing an outbreak of COVID-19, developing an emergency communications plan including forums to respond to workers' concerns, equipping workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behavior, training workers who need to wear protective clothing and equipment on how to use them, providing resources and a work environment that supports hygiene private and require regular hand washing, limit customer and public access to the workplace, and post signs warning about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures. Depending on the job task, workers with at least moderate exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including a combination of gloves, gowns, face shields or face masks, or goggles.

sourceString: Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.
targetString: Pekerja dalam kelompok risiko ini jarang membutuhkan respirator.
en-mt: Workers in this risk group rarely need respirators.

sourceString: If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Jika seseorang jatuh sakit di pesawat terbang, kontrol yang tepat untuk melindungi pekerja dan penumpang lain mencakup memisahkan orang yang sakit dari orang lain dengan jarak 6 kaki, menunjuk satu awak kabin untuk mengurus orang yang sakit, dan menawarkan masker wajah untuk orang yang sakit atau memintanya menutup mulut dan hidung dengan tisu ketika batuk atau bersin.
en-mt: If someone becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from other people by 6 feet, appointing a cabin crew member to care for the sick person, and offering face masks to the sick person or requesting one cover mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces, and possibly additional personal protective equipment if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.
targetString: Awak kabin harus mengenakan sarung tangan medis sekali-pakai ketika merawat penumpang yang sakit atau menyentuh cairan tubuh atau permukaan yang berpotensi terkontaminasi dan mungkin alat pelindung diri lain jika penumpang yang sakit mengalami demam, batuk terus-menerus, atau kesulitan bernapas.
en-mt: Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when caring for sick passengers or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces and possibly other personal protective equipment if the sick passenger has a fever, persistent cough or difficulty breathing.

sourceString: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards.For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.
targetString: Sarung tangan dan barang sekali pakai lainnya harus dibuang dalam kantong bahaya hayati, dan permukaan yang terkontaminasi harus dibersihkan dan didisinfeksi sesudahnya. Untuk pelayaran komersial, termasuk kapal pesiar dan kapal penumpang lainnya, pengendalian bahaya mencakup menunda perjalanan jika sakit, mengisolasi diri, dan menginformasikan pusat medis di atas kapal segera jika seseorang mengalami demam atau gejala lain saat berada di atas kapal.
en-mt: Gloves and other single-use items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterward. For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger ships, hazard control includes delaying travel in case of illness, self-isolation, and informing the onboard medical center immediately if a person develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.

sourceString: Ideally, medical follow-up should occur in the isolated person's cabin.For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
targetString: Idealnya, tindak lanjut medis dilakukan di kabin orang yang diisolasi. Terlepas dari penyebaran di masyarakat, untuk sekolah dan fasilitas penitipan anak, CDC merekomendasikan penutupan jangka pendek untuk membersihkan atau mendisinfeksi jika orang yang terinfeksi pernah berada di gedung sekolah.
en-mt: Ideally, medical follow-up takes place in the isolated person's cabin. Regardless of community spread, for schools and child care facilities, the CDC recommends short-term closures for cleaning or disinfecting if an infected person has been in the school building.

sourceString: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
targetString: Jika ada penularan di masyarakat pada tingkat minimal hingga sedang, strategi pembatasan sosial dapat diterapkan, yang mencakup: membatalkan kunjungan lapangan, pertemuan, dan perkumpulan besar lainnya, seperti pendidikan jasmani, kelas paduan suara, atau makan di kafetaria, meningkatkan jarak antara meja, waktu kedatangan dan kepulangan yang bertahap, membatasi pengunjung nonesensial, dan menggunakan lokasi kantor kesehatan yang terpisah untuk anak-anak dengan gejala mirip flu.
en-mt: If there is minimal to moderate levels of transmission in the community, social distancing strategies can be implemented, which include: canceling field trips, gatherings and other large gatherings, such as physical education, choir classes, or eating in the cafeteria, increasing the distance between tables, time staging arrivals and departures, limiting nonessential visitors, and using separate health office locations for children with flu-like symptoms.

sourceString: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.
targetString: Jika ada penularan yang tinggi di masyarakat lokal, di samping strategi pembatasan sosial, memperpanjang penutupan sekolah dapat dipertimbangkan. Untuk petugas penegak hukum yang melakukan kegiatan rutin harian, risiko kesehatan langsung dianggap rendah oleh CDC.
en-mt: If there is high transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extending school closures may be considered. For law enforcement officers who carry out routine daily activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by the CDC.

sourceString: Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.
targetString: Petugas penegak hukum yang harus melakukan kontak dengan orang terkonfirmasi atau terduga COVID-19 direkomendasikan untuk mengikuti pedoman yang sama dengan teknisi medis darurat, termasuk menggunakan alat pelindung diri yang sesuai.
en-mt: It is recommended that law enforcement officials who have to come into contact with people with confirmed or suspected COVID-19 follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including using appropriate personal protective equipment.

sourceString: If close contact occurs during apprehension, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe, and follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.
targetString: Jika kontak dekat terjadi selama penangkapan, pekerja harus membersihkan dan mendisinfeksi sabuk dan perlengkapan tugas sebelum digunakan kembali dengan menggunakan semprotan atau lap pembersih rumah tangga dan mengikuti prosedur operasi standar untuk mengendalikan dan membuang APD bekas serta untuk mengendalikan dan mencuci pakaian kotor.
en-mt: If close contact occurs during arrest, workers should clean and disinfect belts and duty equipment before reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe and follow standard operating procedures for handling and disposing of used PPE and for handling and washing soiled clothing.

sourceString: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high categories of exposure risk.
targetString: OSHA menganggap tenaga kesehatan dan kamar mayat tertentu berada pada kategori risiko paparan tinggi atau sangat tinggi.
en-mt: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary personnel to be in the high or very high exposure risk category.

sourceString: High exposure risk jobs include healthcare delivery, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who are exposed to known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Pekerjaan berisiko paparan tinggi mencakup pemberian perawatan kesehatan, dukungan, laboratorium, dan tenaga transportasi medis yang terpapar dengan pasien yang diketahui atau diduga COVID-19.
en-mt: High-risk work includes providing healthcare, support, laboratory and medical transport personnel exposed to patients with known or suspected COVID-19.

sourceString: These become very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Pekerjaan ini menjadi berisiko paparan sangat tinggi jika pekerja melakukan prosedur penghasil aerosol pada, atau mengambil atau menangani spesimen dari, pasien yang diketahui atau diduga COVID-19.
en-mt: This work poses a very high risk of exposure if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, patients with known or suspected COVID-19.

sourceString: Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopies, some dental procedures and exams, or invasive specimen collection.
targetString: Prosedur penghasil aerosol meliputi intubasi, prosedur induksi batuk, bronkoskopi, beberapa prosedur dan pemeriksaan gigi, atau pengambilan spesimen invasif.
en-mt: Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopy, some dental procedures and examinations, or invasive specimen collection.

sourceString: High exposure risk mortuary jobs include workers involved in preparing the bodies of people who had known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of their death; these become very high exposure risk if they perform an autopsy.Additional engineering controls for these risk groups include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.
targetString: Pekerjaan kamar mayat berisiko paparan tinggi meliputi pekerja yang terlibat dalam mempersiapkan mayat orang yang diketahui atau diduga kasus COVID-19 pada saat kematian; pekerjaan ini menjadi berisiko paparan sangat tinggi jika pekerja melakukan otopsi. Pengendalian teknik tambahan untuk kelompok risiko ini mencakup ruang isolasi untuk pasien yang diketahui atau diduga COVID-19, mencakup ketika prosedur penghasil aerosol dilakukan.
en-mt: Mortuary work at high risk of exposure includes workers involved in preparing the bodies of persons with known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of death; this job becomes a very high risk of exposure if the worker performs an autopsy. Additional engineering controls for this risk group include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.

sourceString: Specialized negative pressure ventilation may be appropriate in some healthcare and mortuary settings.
targetString: Ventilasi tekanan negatif khusus mungkin sesuai di beberapa tatanan perawatan kesehatan dan kamar mayat.
en-mt: Specific negative pressure ventilation may be appropriate in some health care settings and morgues.

sourceString: Specimens should be handled with Biosafety Level 3 precautions.
targetString: Spesimen harus ditangani dengan tindakan pencegahan Level Keselamatan Biologi 3.
en-mt: Specimens should be handled with Biological Safety Level 3 precautions.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that incoming patients be separated into distinct waiting areas depending on whether they are a suspected COVID-19 case.In addition to other PPE, OSHA recommends respirators for those who work within 6 feet of patients known to be, or suspected of being, infected with SARS-CoV-2, and those performing aerosol-generating procedures.
targetString: Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia (WHO) merekomendasikan agar pasien yang datang dipisahkan ke dalam ruang tunggu yang berbeda berdasarkan jika mereka diduga kasus COVID-19. Selain APD lainnya, OSHA merekomendasikan respirator bagi orang yang bekerja dalam jarak 6 kaki dari pasien yang diketahui atau diduga terinfeksi SARS-CoV-2, dan orang yang melakukan prosedur penghasil aerosol.
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that arriving patients be separated into different waiting rooms based on if they are suspected cases of COVID-19. In addition to other PPE, OSHA recommends respirators for people working within 6 feet of patients known or suspected to be infected with SARS-CoV-2, and people performing aerosol-generating procedures.

sourceString: In the United States, NIOSH-approved N95 filtering facepiece respirators or better must be used in the context of a comprehensive, written respiratory protection program that includes fit-testing, training, and medical exams.
targetString: Di Amerika Serikat, respirator penutup wajah filter N95 yang disetujui NIOSH atau yang lebih baik harus digunakan dalam konteks program perlindungan pernapasan tertulis dan komprehensif yang mencakup uji kesesuaian, pelatihan, dan pemeriksaan medis.
en-mt: In the United States, NIOSH-approved N95 filter facepiece respirators or better must be used in the context of a comprehensive, written respiratory protection program that includes fit testing, training, and a medical examination.

sourceString: Other types of respirators can provide greater protection and improve worker comfort.The WHO does not recommend coveralls, as COVID-19 is a respiratory disease rather than being transmitted through bodily fluids.
targetString: Jenis respirator lain dapat memberikan perlindungan yang lebih besar dan meningkatkan kenyamanan pekerja. WHO tidak merekomendasikan baju tertutup seluruhnya atau coverall karena COVID-19 adalah penyakit pernapasan dan bukan ditularkan melalui cairan tubuh.
en-mt: Other types of respirators can provide greater protection and increase worker comfort. WHO does not recommend fully covered clothing or coveralls because COVID-19 is a respiratory disease and is not transmitted through body fluids.

sourceString: WHO recommends only a surgical mask for point-of-entry screening personnel.
targetString: WHO hanya merekomendasikan masker bedah untuk petugas skrining di titik masuk.
en-mt: WHO only recommends surgical masks for screening officers at points of entry.

sourceString: For those who are collecting respiratory specimens from, caring for, or transporting COVID-19 patients without any aerosol-generating procedures, WHO recommends a surgical mask, goggles, or face shield, gown, and gloves.
targetString: Bagi orang yang mengambil spesimen pernapasan, merawat, atau mengangkut pasien COVID-19 tanpa prosedur penghasil aerosol, WHO merekomendasikan masker bedah, kacamata pelindung, atau perisai wajah, jubah, dan sarung tangan.
en-mt: For people collecting respiratory specimens, treating or transporting COVID-19 patients without an aerosol-generating procedure, WHO recommends a surgical mask, goggles or face shield, gown and gloves.

sourceString: If an aerosol-generating procedure is performed, the surgical mask is replaced with an N95 or FFP2 respirator.
targetString: Jika prosedur penghasil aerosol dilakukan, masker bedah diganti dengan respirator N95 atau FFP2.
en-mt: If an aerosol-generating procedure is performed, replace the surgical mask with an N95 or FFP2 respirator.

sourceString: Given that the global supply of PPE is insufficient, WHO recommends minimizing the need for PPE through telemedicine, physical barriers such as clear windows, allowing only those involved in direct care to enter a room with a COVID-19 patient, using only the PPE necessary for the specific task, continuing use of the same respirator without removing it while caring for multiple patients with the same diagnosis, monitoring and coordinating the PPE supply chain, and discouraging the use of masks for asymptomatic individuals.
targetString: Mengingat bahwa pasokan APD tidak mencukupi di seluruh dunia, WHO merekomendasikan meminimalkan kebutuhan APD melalui layanan kedokteran jarak jauh, pembatas fisik seperti jendela tembus pandang, dengan hanya orang yang terlibat dalam perawatan langsung boleh memasuki ruangan berisi pasien COVID-19, menggunakan hanya APD yang diperlukan untuk tugas tertentu, terus menggunakan respirator yang sama tanpa melepasnya saat merawat banyak pasien dengan diagnosis sama, memantau dan mengoordinasi rantai pasokan APD, dan tidak mendorong penggunaan masker untuk orang tanpa gejala.
en-mt: Given that the supply of PPE is insufficient worldwide, WHO recommends minimizing the need for PPE through remote medicine services, physical barriers such as see-through windows, with only persons involved in direct care allowed to enter rooms containing COVID-19 patients, using only the necessary PPE for certain tasks, continuing to wear the same respirator without removing it when caring for multiple patients with the same diagnosis, monitoring and coordinating the PPE supply chain, and discouraging the use of masks for persons without symptoms.

sourceString: FROM: Katherine Maher, Wikimedia Foundation CEO
targetString: DARI: Katherine Maher, CEO Yayasan Wikimedia
en-mt: FROM: Katherine Maher, CEO of the Wikimedia Foundation

sourceString: TO: All Wikimedia Foundation staff
targetString: KEPADA: Semua staf Yayasan Wikimedia
en-mt: TO: All Wikimedia Foundation staff

sourceString: SUBJECT LINE: [Covid-19] Lightening the load and preparing for the future
targetString: BARIS SUBJEK: [Covid-19] Meringankan beban dan mempersiapkan masa depan
en-mt: SUBJECT LINE: [Covid-19] Lighten the load and prepare for the future

sourceString: SEND DATE/TIME: 14 March, 2020, 00:24 UTC
targetString: TANGGAL/WAKTU PENGIRIMAN: 14 Maret 2020, 00:24 UTC
en-mt: SHIPPING DATE/TIME: March 14, 2020, 00:24 UTC

sourceString: LICENSING: CC0: No rights reserved
targetString: LISENSI: CC0: Tidak ada hak yang dilindungi
en-mt: LICENSE: CC0: No rights reserved

sourceString: We find ourselves in remarkable circumstances this month.
targetString: Kita mendapati diri kita berada dalam situasi yang luar biasa bulan ini.
en-mt: We find ourselves in an extraordinary situation this month.

sourceString: The COVID-19 epidemic is something that makes clear our global human interconnectedness and the responsibilities we have to one another.
targetString: Epidemi COVID-19 adalah hal yang membuat jelas keterkaitan manusia global dan tanggung jawab yang kita miliki satu sama lain.
en-mt: The COVID-19 epidemic is what makes clear the interconnectedness of global humanity and the responsibilities we have for one another.

sourceString: We don’t have precedent for its challenges, but we do know that our best response relies on the sort of global empathy, cooperation, and community building that sits at the heart of this organization.
targetString: Kita belum pernah mengalami tantangannya, tetapi kita tahu bahwa respons terbaik kita tergantung pada bentuk empati, kerja sama, dan pembangunan komunitas global, yang merupakan jantung organisasi ini.
en-mt: We have never experienced the challenge, but we know that our best response depends on the empathy, cooperation, and building of the global community, which is at the heart of this organization.

sourceString: The camaraderie and care we have seen among all of our colleagues over email, calls, and chats is a remarkable validation of the incredible humans we are fortunate enough to work with.
targetString: Persahabatan dan kepedulian yang telah kami saksikan di antara semua rekan kerja melalui email, panggilan, dan obrolan adalah validasi luar biasa adanya manusia luar biasa, yang kami cukup beruntung, untuk bekerja bersama mereka.
en-mt: The friendship and care we have witnessed among all our colleagues through emails, calls and chats is a great validation of the existence of extraordinary people, whom we are fortunate enough, to work with.

sourceString: I couldn’t be more grateful and proud to count you all as colleagues.
targetString: Rasa syukur dan bangga saya tidak terhingga dapat menyebut Anda sekalian sebagai rekan kerja.
en-mt: I am immeasurably grateful and proud to be able to mention all of you as colleagues.

sourceString: Last week, someone shared with me their appreciation for our work.
targetString: Minggu lalu, seseorang berbagi dengan saya penghargaan mereka untuk pekerjaan kita.
en-mt: Last week, someone shared with me their appreciation for our work.

sourceString: They reminded me how meaningful it is for the world to be able to turn to Wikipedia right now, and what a powerful symbol it is for this critical resource to remain online and available to all.
targetString: Mereka mengingatkan saya betapa berartinya bagi dunia saat ini untuk dapat mengakses Wikipedia dan betapa hal ini merupakan lambang kuat bagi sumber daya penting ini untuk tetap tersedia daring bagi semua orang.
en-mt: They remind me how much it means to the world today to be able to access Wikipedia and how it is a powerful symbol for this important resource to remain available online to everyone.

sourceString: Your work makes this possible, whether you keep the sites stay up or our colleagues paid or our communities safe.
targetString: Pekerjaan Anda memungkinkan ini terjadi, entah Anda memastikan situs ini tetap berjalan, membantu membayar rekan kita, atau membantu menjaga keamanan komunitas kita.
en-mt: Your job makes this possible, whether you keep the site running, help pay our associates, or help keep our community safe.

sourceString: The world needs the information that Wikipedia provides, now more than ever.
targetString: Dunia membutuhkan informasi yang disediakan Wikipedia, terutama saat ini.
en-mt: The world needs the information that Wikipedia provides, especially today.

sourceString: This is a moment in which not only what we do, but how we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.
targetString: Inilah momen ketika bukan hanya pekerjaan yang kita lakukan, tetapi cara kita melakukannya, akan membuat dampak yang berarti bagi dunia.
en-mt: This is the moment when not just the work we do, but the way we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.

sourceString: Because of the importance of this mission and your role in it, we will be making some significant adjustments to how we work together, starting this coming week.
targetString: Karena pentingnya misi ini dan peran Anda di dalamnya, kita akan membuat beberapa penyesuaian penting terhadap cara kita bekerja bersama, yang akan dimulai minggu depan.
en-mt: Because of the importance of this mission and your role in it, we will be making some important adjustments to the way we work together, starting next week.

sourceString: Adjustments to our work and schedules
targetString: Penyesuaian terhadap pekerjaan dan jadwal kita
en-mt: Adjustment to our work and schedule

sourceString: As Robyn mentioned previously, the c-team met last night to discuss our approach and schedule for the coming days and months.
targetString: Seperti yang disebutkan Robyn sebelumnya, tim-c bertemu semalam untuk membahas pendekatan dan jadwal kita untuk beberapa hari dan bulan mendatang.
en-mt: As Robyn previously mentioned, the c-team met last night to discuss our approach and schedule for the coming days and months.

sourceString: In that conversation, we considered what we thought would be an appropriate response to what we’re facing and the best way to keep the organization sustainable during this time.
targetString: Dalam percakapan itu, kami mempertimbangkan hal yang kami pikir merupakan respons tepat untuk tantangan yang kita hadapi dan cara terbaik untuk menjaga kelangsungan organisasi selama masa ini.
en-mt: In those conversations, we consider what we think are appropriate responses to the challenges we face and how best to keep the organization going during this time.

sourceString: Overwhelmingly we wanted to remove stress and support our mission for the long term.
targetString: Kami sangat ingin menghilangkan tekanan dan mendukung misi kita untuk jangka panjang.
en-mt: We really want to take the pressure off and support our mission for the long term.

sourceString: If you need to dial back, that’s okay.
targetString: Jika Anda perlu mengurangi jadwal pekerjaan, tidak apa-apa.
en-mt: If you need to reduce your work schedule, that's okay.

sourceString: For all staff, contractors, and contract workers:
targetString: Untuk semua staf, kontraktor, dan pekerja kontrak:
en-mt: For all staff, contractors and contract workers:

sourceString: our daily working expectations will be about 4 hours a day, or 20 hours a week until further notice.
targetString: harapan kerja harian kita adalah sekitar 4 jam sehari, atau 20 jam seminggu, hingga pemberitahuan lebih lanjut.
en-mt: our daily work expectation is about 4 hours a day, or 20 hours a week, until further notice.

sourceString: We’re not declaring a holiday - if you are able to work more normal hours, the mission can use you.
targetString: Kami tidak menetapkan hari libur, jika Anda bisa bekerja lebih banyak pada jam normal, misi ini memerlukan Anda.
en-mt: We don't have set days off, if you can work more normal hours this mission needs you.
